articles.title: Resurrection 1
articles.author: admin
articles.content:
Peace to all brothers and sisters!

Today we will examine the fellowship and share "Resurrection"

Let’s open the Bible to John Chapter 11, verses 21-25, and start reading;

Martha said to Jesus, "Lord, if you had been here, my brother would not have died. Even now I know that whatever you ask God will be given to you." Jesus said to him, "Your brother will surely "I know," said Martha, "that he will rise again at the resurrection." Jesus said to her, "I am the resurrection and the life. He who believes in me will live, even if he dies."

Jesus said: "I am the resurrection and the life! Whoever believes in me, even though he dies, yet will he live"! Amen

(1) The prophet Elijah prayed to God, and the child lived

After this, the woman who was the mistress of the house, her son fell ill. He was so ill that he was breathless (which means dead).
(The child's soul is still in his body, and he is alive)

... Elijah fell upon the child three times and cried out to the Lord, saying, "O Lord my God, please let this child's soul return to his body!" The Lord answered Elijah's words, and the child's soul returned to his body. His body, he lives. 1 Kings 17:17,21-22

(2) The prophet Elisha revived the Shunammite woman’s son

As the child grew older, one day he came to his father and the harvesters. He said to his father, "My head, my head." His father said to his servant, "Take him to his mother." The servant said to him, "Take him to his mother." He took him and gave him to his mother; the child sat on his mother's lap and died at noon.
...Elisha came and went into the house and saw the child dead and lying on his bed.

....Then he came down, walked back and forth in the room, and then went up and lay on the child. The child sneezed seven times and then opened his eyes. 2 Kings 4:18-20,32,35

(3) When a dead person touched Elisha’s bones, the dead person was resurrected

Elisha died and was buried. On New Year's Day, a group of Moabites invaded the country. Some people were burying the dead. Suddenly they saw a group of people. They threw the dead man into Elisha's tomb. As soon as he touched Elisha's bones, the dead man came to life and stood up. 2 Kings 13:20-21

(4)Israel →→ Resurrection of bones

prophet prophesies → Israel → The whole family was saved

He said to me, "Son of man, can these bones be resurrected?" I said, "Sovereign Lord, you know.
"And he said to me, "Prophesy to these bones and say:
Hear the word of the Lord, you dry bones.
This is what the Lord God says to these bones:
"I will cause breath to enter you,
You are going to live.
I will give you sinews, and I will give you flesh, and I will cover you with skin, and I will put breath into you, and you will live; and you will know that I am the LORD.

"....The Lord said to me: "Son of man, These bones are the entire family of Israel . .. Reference Ezekiel 37:3-6,11

Brothers, I do not want you to be ignorant of this mystery (lest you think you are wise), that the Israelites are somewhat hard-hearted; until the number of the Gentiles is full , Then all the Israelites will be saved . As it is written:

“A Savior shall come out of Zion, and shall take away all the sin of the house of Jacob.” And also: “This is my covenant with them, when I take away their sin.” Romans 11:25-27

I heard that among all the tribes of Israel Seal The number is 144,000. Revelation 7:4

(Note: Within one week, half of the week! The Israelites were sealed by God → entered the millennium → which was the fulfillment of the prophetic prophecies. After the Qian Jubilee → the whole family of Israel was saved)

holy city jerhosalem →→ bride, wife of the lamb

One of the seven angels who had the seven golden bowls full of the seven last plagues came to me and said, “Come here, and I will show you the bride, the Lamb’s wife.
The names of the twelve tribes of Israel
“I was inspired by the Holy Spirit, and the angels carried me to a high mountain, and showed me the holy city Jerusalem, which came down out of heaven from God. In the city was the glory of God; the light of the city was like a very precious stone, like jasper, clear as crystal. There was a tall wall with twelve gates, and on the gates were twelve angels, and on the gates were written the names of the twelve tribes of Israel.
The names of the twelve apostles of the lamb

There are three gates on the east side, three gates on the north side, three gates on the south side, and three gates on the west side. The city wall has twelve foundations, and on the foundations are the names of the twelve apostles of the Lamb. Revelation 21:9-14

( Note: The twelve tribes of Israel + the twelve apostles of the Lamb,
Israelite Church + Gentile Church

The church is one! It is the holy city Jerusalem, the bride, the Lamb’s wife! )

Amen. So, do you understand clearly?)

(5) Through prayer: Resurrection of Tabitha and Dorcas

There was a female disciple in Joppa, her name was Tabitha, which in Greek means Dorcas (which means antelope); she did good deeds and gave alms a lot. At that time, she fell ill and died. Someone washed her and left her upstairs.

...Peter told them all to go out, and he knelt down and prayed. Then he turned to the dead man and said, "Tabitha, get up!" Then she opened her eyes, and when she saw Peter, she sat up. Acts 9:36-37,40

(6) Jesus resurrected Jairus’ children

When Jesus returned, the crowds met him because they were all waiting for him. A man named Jairus, a ruler of the synagogue, came and fell at Jesus' feet, begging Jesus to come to his house; for he had an only daughter, about twelve years old, who was dying. As Jesus went, the crowd crowded around him.

.... When Jesus came to his house, no one was allowed to enter with him except Peter, John, James, and the parents of his daughter. All the people wept and beat their breasts for the daughter. Jesus said, "Don't cry! She is not dead, but asleep." When they knew that their daughter was dead, they laughed at Jesus. Jesus took her hand and called out, "Daughter, get up!" and her soul came back. , and she got up immediately and Jesus told her to give her something to eat. Luke 8:40-42,51-55.

(7) Jesus said: "I am the resurrection and the life."

1 The death of Lazarus

There was a sick man named Lazarus who lived in Bethany, the village of Mary and her sister Martha. .. After Jesus had said these words, he then said to them, "Our friend Lazarus has fallen asleep, and I am going to wake him." The disciples said to him, "Lord, if he sleeps, he will recover. These words of Jesus He was talking about his death, but they thought he was sleeping as usual. So Jesus told them plainly, “Lazarus is dead. John 11:1,11-14

2 Jesus said, “I am the resurrection and the life. Whoever believes in me, even though he dies, yet will he live!

When Jesus arrived, he found that Lazarus had been in the tomb four days.
...Martha said to Jesus, "Lord, if you had been here, my brother would not have died. Even now I know that whatever you ask of God, God will give it to you." Jesus said, " "Your brother will rise again." Martha said, "I know that he will rise again in the resurrection of Mobai."

” Jesus said to her, “I am the resurrection and the life.” He who believes in me, even though he dies, will he live again; John 11:17, 21-25

3 Jesus raised Lazarus from the dead

Jesus again groaned in his heart and came to the tomb; it was a cave with a stone in the way. Jesus said, "Take away the stone."
Martha, the sister of the dead man, said to him, "Lord, he must stink now, for he has been dead four days." Jesus said to him, "Did I not tell you that if you believed, you would see God?" Glory?" And they took the stone away.

Jesus raised his eyes to heaven and said, "Father, I thank you because you have heard me. I also know that you always hear me, but I say this for the sake of everyone who is standing around, so that they may believe that you have sent me. Come. When he had said this, he called out with a loud voice, "Lazarus, come out!" Then the dead man came out, his hands and feet wrapped in a cloth, and his face wrapped in a towel. "Untie him," he said to them, "and let him go." John 11:38-44

Notice : The above enumerated statements are God’s way of resurrecting the dead through people’s prayers, supplications and healing! And let everyone see with their own eyes the Lord Jesus resurrecting Lazarus.

Just as the Lord Jesus said: "I am the resurrection and the life. Whoever believes in me, even though he dies, yet he will live." Amen!

The Lord Jesus said: “Whoever lives and believes in me will never die. ( What does this mean? ). Do you believe this?" John 11:26

To be continued, check the traffic sharing "Resurrection" 2

articles.title: Resurrection 2
articles.author: admin
articles.content:
Peace to all brothers and sisters!

Today we continue to study fellowship and share "Resurrection"

Lecture 2; Jesus Christ rose from the dead and reborn us

We opened the Bible to 1 Peter Chapter 1:3-5, and we read together: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ! According to His great mercy, He raised Him from the dead through Jesus Christ , has given us new birth into a living hope into an inheritance incorruptible, undefiled, and unfading, reserved in heaven for you. You who are kept by the power of God through faith will be able to receive the salvation prepared to be revealed in the last days.

1. Jesus Christ resurrected from the dead and regenerated us

ask: Whoever lives and believes in me will never die. Do you believe this? John 11:26
What did Jesus mean when he said this?

For the Scripture also says that it is appointed for men to die once, and after that there is judgment. Hebrews 9.27

answer :Rebirth! Put on the life of Christ, the new man who is born again will never die. Amen!

you must be born again

As the Lord Jesus said: You must be born again, don’t be surprised. Reference John 3:7

Jesus Christ rose from the dead!

Rebirth → → We:

1 Born of water and the Spirit - John 3:5
2 Born of the truth of the gospel - 1 Corinthians 4:15 and James 1.18

3 Born of God - John 1;12-13

ask : Born to Adam?
Born of Jesus Christ?
What's the difference?

answer :Detailed explanation below

(1) Adam was made of dust --Genesis 2:7

Adam became a living person with spirit (spirit: or flesh)--1 Corinthians 15:45

→→The children he bore were also created, flesh and earth.

(2)Last Adam Jesus

→→It is the Word made flesh--John 1:14;
In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God - John 1:1-2
→God became flesh;
The Spirit of God--John 4:24
→The spirit became flesh and spiritual;

Therefore, Jesus was born of the Father - see Hebrews 1:5.

Jesus Christ rose from the dead → regenerates us! Amen

We are reborn ( Newcomer ) is also made by the Word, made by God, made by the Spirit! Born of the Holy Spirit, born of the true word of Jesus Christ through faith in the gospel, born of the Heavenly Father, a spiritual body) because we are members of his body (some ancient scrolls add: His bones and his flesh). Reference Ephesians 5:30

(3) Adam broke the contract in the Garden of Eden - refer to Genesis Chapters 2 and 3
Adam broke the law and sinned → was sold to sin.
As descendants of Adam, we were also sold to sin when we were in the flesh - refer to Romans 7:14
The wages of sin is death - See Romans 6:23
Just as sin entered the world through one man, and death came through sin, so death came to all because all have sinned. Romans 51:12
In Adam all will die. See 1 Corinthians 15:22
→Therefore, it is destined for everyone to die once ---Refer to Hebrews 9:27
→The founder Adam was dust and will return to dust - refer to Genesis 3:19

→Our old human body came from Adam, and it is also dust and will return to dust.

(4) Jesus was sinless and did not sin

no sin
You know that the Lord appeared to take away man's sin, but in Him there is no sin. 1 John 3:5

no crime

He committed no sin, and there was no deceit in his mouth. 1 Peter 2:22
Because our high priest is not unable to sympathize with our weaknesses. He was in every point tempted as we are, yet without sin. Hebrews 4:15

2. Jesus Christ was resurrected from the dead

→→Children who are born again are sinless and do not sin

Let’s open the Bible to 1 John 3:9, turn it over and read together:

Whoever is born of God does not sin, because the word of God abides in him; he cannot sin, because he is born of God.

ask :Jesus was resurrected→Do the regenerated new people still have sins?

answer : not guilty

ask :Can born-again Christians sin?

answer :rebirth( Newcomer ) will not commit a crime

ask :Why?

answer :Detailed explanation below

(1) Anyone born of God →→ (newcomer)

1 Do not sin--1 John 3:9
2 You will not sin--1 John 5:18

3 Neither can he sin--1 John 3:9

(Regenerated new people, why don’t you sin? God will speak through the Bible! You don’t need to speak or doubt, because you will make mistakes as soon as you speak. As long as you believe in the spiritual meaning of God’s words, the following Bible verses will answer: )

4 Because the word of God abides in him, he cannot sin 1 John 3:9
5 For He was born of God--1 John 3:9
(Every new man born of God lives in Christ and is seated with Christ in your hearts and in heavenly places. Abba! The right hand of God the Father. Amen!)
6 Whoever abides in Him does not sin John - Joshua 3:6
7 If the Spirit lives in you, you are no longer of the flesh but of the Spirit - Romans 8:9
8 Because you (the old man) are dead, you ( Newcomer )’s life is hidden with Christ in God--Colossians 3:3
9 He also raised us (new men) up and seated us together in the heavenly places with Christ Jesus - Ephesians 2:6
10 The body is sown ( earthy ), what is resurrected is the spiritual body ( spiritual ). If there is a physical body, there must also be a spiritual body. 1 Corinthians 15:44
11 He is a new creation--refer to 2 Corinthians 5:17

12 Born of God ( Newcomer ) cannot be seen - refer to 2 Corinthians 4:16-18

Notice: The apostle Paul said in 2 Corinthians 4:18 →For we are not concerned about the look "See you( old man) , but the place of care" look "Missing( Newcomer ); This old man is gradually getting worse due to the deceitfulness (sin) of selfish desires - Ephesians 4:22 → The outer body of the old man is being destroyed day by day - refer to 2 Corinthians 4:16. Because the eyes can see ( old man ), is the flesh that was born from Adam and belongs to the flesh. He has been sold to sin. If he sins due to the temptation of the flesh’s evil passions and desires, he will gradually become bad and destroyed. The old man is originally dust, and he will still return to dust after a hundred years. .

Question: Where is our regenerated new man?

Answer: Detailed explanation below

And the invisible ( Newcomer )Woolen cloth! As detailed before: Jesus Christ was resurrected from the dead and reborn ( Newcomer ) is to abide in Christ, to be hidden with Christ in God, to be with Christ in heavenly places, and to be seated at the right hand of God the Father, and in your hearts → as Paul said in Romans 7:22! Because according to my inner meaning (the original text is man) → the invisible person who lives in your hearts is the regenerated new man. This new man was resurrected with Christ and is a spiritual body. Of course, you cannot see it with your naked eyes. The spiritual body is connected with life. First with the tree of life in heaven, with Jesus Christ life, eat the spiritual food of life, drink the living water of the spring of life, be renewed day by day in Christ and grow into a man, full of the stature of the fullness of Christ. On that day, Jesus Christ will come. When he comes again, the reborn The new man will be revealed and revealed → a more beautiful resurrection! Amen. Just like a bee produces a "queen bee" in its hive, this "queen bee" is larger and plumper than other bees. Our new man is the same in Christ. He will be resurrected and appear before the millennium, and will reign with Christ for a thousand years. After the millennium, he will reign with Jesus Christ in the new heaven and new earth forever! Amen.

Any believer who sees, hears and understands the word of truth will choose to join us "The Church in the Lord Jesus Christ" A church with the presence of the Holy Spirit and preaching the true gospel. Because they are wise virgins who have lamps in their hands and have prepared oil in the vessels. Wise virgins understand the true doctrine of the gospel, uphold the true doctrine, and understand the regenerated new man. They are holy, sinless, and cannot sin. , they are virgins, they are without blemish! Like 144,000 people following the Lamb. Amen!

There are many churches that also teach the Bible, just like the church of Laodicea. Some churches do not have the presence of the Holy Spirit and do not preach the true doctrine of the gospel. This causes many brothers and sisters to sit there and listen every week, and they cannot understand what they are hearing. !If you have not eaten and drank the spiritual food of life, have not been regenerated, and have not put on (the new man) Christ, you become pitiful and naked. Therefore, the Lord Jesus rebuked those churches like Laodicea → You said: I am rich, have gained wealth, and need nothing; but I do not know that you are wretched, wretched, poor, blind, and naked. I urge you to buy from me gold refined in the fire, so that you may be rich; and white garments, so that you may not be exposed; and eye drops, to anoint your eyes, so that you may see. Revelation 3:17-18

So, do you understand?

Alert: He who has ears, let him hear!

People who are led by the Holy Spirit will understand it as soon as they hear it, but some people don’t understand it even if they hear it. Why is this? There are also people who become stubborn and resist the true way, destroy the true way, and persecute the children of God. In the end, they will betray Jesus and the children of God.
Therefore, if there is anyone who does not understand, he should humbly pray to God and seek, and he will find; and the door will be opened to him who knocks. Amen
But you must not resist the true way and receive a heart that loves the truth. Otherwise, God will give him a wrong heart and cause him to believe a lie. Reference 2 Thessalonians 2:11
Such people will never understand rebirth and the salvation of Christ. Do you believe it or not?

(2) Anyone who commits a crime →→ (It’s an old person)

ask : Some churches teach that...regenerate people can still sin?

answer : Don’t speak with human philosophy; speak with the Bible.

1 ...Whoever sins has not seen Him - 1 John 3:6

Note: Whoever abides in Him (referring to those in Christ, the new man who was reborn from the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead) does not sin; whoever sins has not seen Him → Have you seen the biblical text? These verses are the words of God in the Bible Talk! Jesus said, "The words that I say to you are spirit and life! Do you see that?

2 Everyone who sins...has not known him - 1 John 3:6

Note: This is eternal life: to know you, the only true God, and Jesus Christ, whom you have sent. - John 17:3. There is an error in some electronic Bibles: "Know You, the Only True God" has an extra word "one", but there is no typo in the written Bible.
So, please ask yourself, do you know the Lord Jesus Christ? Do you understand the salvation of Christ? How do those church ministers teach you that everyone who is resurrected ( Newcomer ), will you still be guilty? Crime? What does the Bible say about preachers who teach this way → Whoever abides in Him ( Is a newcomer ), do not sin; whoever sins has neither seen Him nor known Him.

So, do you understand?

3 Don't be tempted

Note: My little children, don’t be tempted by others, that is, don’t be tempted by fallacies and doctrines; because Newcomer Not in your old flesh, your old sinful body, but the new man in you, who dwells in Christ, in heaven, not on earth, in us. Newcomer It's invisible to the naked eye" spirit man ", through the renewal of the Holy Spirit, be renewed day by day and become a man by practicing righteousness. This means that he who does righteousness is a righteous person, just as the Lord is righteous. Amen

So, do you understand clearly?

Whoever abides in Him does not sin; whoever sins has neither seen Him nor known Him. My little boys, don't be tempted. He who does righteousness is righteous, just as the Lord is righteous. 1 John 3:6-7

3. The whole world lies in the hands of the evil one

Those who sin are of the devil

He who sins is of the devil, for the devil has sinned from the beginning. The Son of God appeared to destroy the works of the devil. 1 John 3:8

(People all over the world, those under the law, those who break the law and sin, sinners! They are all lying under the hand of the evil one. Do you believe it?)

We know that whoever is born of God will never sin; whoever is born of God will keep himself (there are ancient scrolls: He who is born of God will protect him), and the evil one will not be able to harm him. We know that we belong to God and that the whole world lies in the power of the evil one. We also know that the Son of God has come and has given us wisdom to know Him who is true, and we are in Him who is true, His Son Jesus Christ. This is the true God and eternal life. 1 John 5:18-20

To be shared in the third lecture: "Resurrection" 3

articles.title: Resurrection 3
articles.author: admin
articles.content:
Peace to all the brothers and sisters in God’s family!

Today we continue to examine transportation and share "Resurrection"

Lecture 3: Resurrection and Rebirth of the New Man and the Old Man

Let’s open the Bible to 2 Corinthians 5:17-20, turn it over and read together:
If anyone is in Christ, he is a new creation; old things have passed away; all things have become new. All is from God, who reconciled us to himself through Christ and gave us the ministry of reconciliation. This is that God was in Christ reconciling the world to himself, not counting their trespasses against them, and entrusting this message of reconciliation to us. Therefore we are ambassadors for Christ, as if God were making his appeal to you through us. We implore you on behalf of Christ to be reconciled to God.

1. We are messengers of the gospel

→→Don’t put them ( old man )’s transgressions are upon them ( Newcomer ), and has entrusted us with the message of reconciliation.

(1) The old man and the new man

Question: How to distinguish the old man from the new man?

Answer: Detailed explanation below

1 The old man belongs to the old covenant; the new man belongs to the new covenant - 1 Corinthians 11:25
2 The old man belongs to Adam; the new man belongs to Jesus, the last Adam - 1 Corinthians 15:45
3 The old man Adam was born; the new man Jesus was born--1 Corinthians 4:15
4 The old man is earthly; the new man is spiritual--1 Corinthians 15:44
5 The old man is sinner; the new man is righteous--1 Corinthians 6:11
6 The old man sins; the new man will not sin - 1 John 3:9
7 The old man is under the law; the new man is free from the law--Romans 7:6
8 The old man obeys the law of sin; the new man obeys the law of God--Romans 7:25
9 The old man is concerned with the things of the flesh; the new man is concerned with the things of the Spirit - Romans 8:5-6
10 The old man is getting worse; the new man is being renewed day by day in Christ - 2 Corinthians 4:16
11 The old man cannot inherit the kingdom of heaven; the new man inherits the Father’s inheritance--Gal. 3:29
12 The old man died with Christ; the new man was raised with Christ--Romans 6:8

(2) The Holy Spirit fights against the flesh

Question: Where does the Holy Spirit live?

Answer: The Holy Spirit lives in our hearts!

To redeem those who were under the law, so that we might receive adoption as sons. Because you are sons, God has sent the Spirit of his Son into your (literally, our) hearts, crying, “Abba, Father!” Galatians 4:5-6

If the Spirit of God dwells in you, you are no longer of the flesh but of the Spirit. If anyone does not have the Spirit of Christ, he does not belong to Christ. Romans 8:9

ask : Isn’t it said that our body is the temple of the Holy Spirit? --1 Corinthians 6:19
→→Does it say here that you are not carnal? -- Romans 8:9

answer : Detailed explanation below

1 Our flesh has been sold to sin

We know that the law is of the spirit, but I am of the flesh and have been sold to sin. Romans 7:14

2 The flesh loves to obey the law of sin

Thank God, we can escape through our Lord Jesus Christ. From this point of view, I obey the law of God with my heart, but my flesh obeys the law of sin. Romans 7:25

3 Our old man was crucified with Christ →→The body of sin is destroyed, and you are separated from this mortal body.

For we know that our old self was crucified with him, that the body of sin might be destroyed, so that we should no longer serve sin; Romans 6:6

4 The Holy Spirit dwells in the regenerated ( Newcomer ) on

ask : Where are we reborn (new people)?

answer : In our hearts! Amen

For according to the inner man (original text) I delight in the law of God - Romans 7:22

Note: Paul said! According to the meaning in me (the original text is man) → this in my heart ( people ) about the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead ( spirit man ) The spiritual body, the spiritual person, lives in us, this invisible ( spirit man ) is the real me; what you can see from the outside is just a Shadow ! Therefore, the Holy Spirit dwells in regenerated spiritual people! This reborn ( Newcomer ) The spiritual body is the temple of the Holy Spirit, because this body was born of Jesus Christ, and we are his members! Amen
So, do you understand?

(3) The lust of the flesh contends with the Holy Spirit

→→The old man and the new man fight

At that time, those who were born according to the flesh ( old man ) persecuted those who were born according to the Spirit ( Newcomer ), and this is the case now. Galatians 4:29
I say, walk by the Spirit, and you will not fulfill the lusts of the flesh. For the flesh lusteth against the Spirit, and the Spirit lusteth against the flesh: these two are opposed to each other, so that you cannot do what you wish to do. Galatians 5:16-17

For those who live according to the flesh set their minds on the things of the flesh; those who live according to the Spirit set their minds on the things of the Spirit. To be carnally minded is death; to be spiritually minded is life and peace. For the carnal mind is enmity against God; for it is not subject to the law of God, nor can it be, and those who are carnal cannot please God. Romans 8:5-8

(4) Either inside the body or outside the body

I know a man in Christ who was caught up to the third heaven fourteen years ago; (Whether he was in the body, I don’t know; or whether he was outside the body, I don’t know; only God knows.)… He Being caught up into paradise, he heard secret words that no man could speak. 2 Corinthians 12:2,4

ask : Paul's new man. Or his old man. Or his soul?
→→Being raped to the third heaven?

answer : It is a new man who is reborn!

ask : How to say it?

answer : From letters written by Paul

Flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom of God

I say to you, brethren, that flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom of God, neither corruptible nor immortal. 1 Corinthians 15:50

Note: Adam was born of flesh and blood. He is mortal and cannot inherit the kingdom of God; Luke 24:39, the Lord Jesus said! The soul has no bones or flesh. Therefore, it was not that Paul’s old man, body or soul, was raptured to the third heaven, but Paul’s regenerated new man ( spirit man ) The spiritual body was lifted up to the third heaven.

So, do you understand clearly?

Discussing the letters written by the apostles regarding the resurrection and rebirth:

[ peter ] You have been born again, not of perishable seed, but by the living and abiding word of God... 1 Peter 1:23, for Peter... And other disciples witnessed the resurrection of Jesus, speaking in the Acts of the Apostles Says, “His soul is not left in Hades, nor does his body see corruption.
[ John ] In the vision of Revelation, we saw 144,000 people following the Lamb. They were virgins and without blemish! Therefore, 1 John 3:9 says: "Whoever is born of God neither sins nor can sin;
These are those who are not born of blood, not of lust, nor of the will of man, but are born of God. Jesus said, "That which is born of flesh is flesh; that which is born of the Spirit is spirit. John 3:6 and 1:13
[ Jacob ] He did not believe in Jesus before - John 7:5; he believed that Jesus was the Son of God only after seeing the resurrection of Jesus with his own eyes. He discussed Jesus in James 1:18: "He begot us by the word of truth according to his own will."

He himself said: "I know this man who is in Christ; (whether in the body or out of the body, I don't know, only God knows.)
Because Paul personally experienced being born of God ( Newcomer ) was raptured into paradise!
So the spiritual letters he wrote were richer and deeper.

On the old man and the new man:

( Newcomer ) If anyone is in Christ, he is a new creation; old things have passed away; behold, all things have become new. 2 Corinthians 5:17
( old man ) I have been crucified with Christ, and it is no longer I who live... Galatians 2:20; free from sin, free from the law, free from the old man, free from this death body → If the Spirit of God dwells in you, you are not carnal ( old man )...Romans 8:9 → And we know that when we abide in the (old man), we are separated from the Lord. 2 Corinthians 5:6
( Holy Spirit ) For the flesh lusteth against the Spirit, and the Spirit lusteth against the flesh: these two are opposed to each other, so that you cannot do what you want to do. Galatians 5:17

15:44

May the God of peace sanctify you completely! And may your spirit, soul, and body be preserved blameless at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ! He who calls you is faithful and will do it. 1 Thessalonians 5:23-24

We can understand the relationship between the regenerated new man and the old man, the visible man and the invisible spirit man, the natural body and the spiritual body, and sin. Those who are innocent and those who are innocent, those who have sinned and those who will not sin.

→→Because the results of life come from the heart, the Lord Jesus said: “According to your faith, let it be done to you! Matthew 15:28

There is only one person who preaches the word →Old man and new man, natural and spiritual, guilty and innocent, sinful and unsinful Mixed preaching to teach you , when the old man sins, cleanse his sins every day, Treat the blood of Christ as normal . When you look up Bible verses and compare them, you always feel that what they say is wrong, but you don’t know what is wrong with what they say? Because they said " The way of yes and no ", right and wrong, you can't tell the difference without the guidance of the Holy Spirit.

Check out "The Word of Yes and No" and "Walking in the Holy Spirit" about how to deal with the sin of the old man.

2. Be a messenger of the gospel of Christ

→→No old man the transgressions of Newcomer On your body!

This is God in Christ, reconciling the world to himself and not alienating them ( old man )’s transgressions are upon them ( Newcomer ), and has entrusted us with the message of reconciliation. 2 Corinthians 5:19
Brothers, it seems that we are not debtors to the flesh ( Because Christ has paid the sin debt ) to live according to the flesh. Romans 8:12
Then he said: I will remember their sins and their transgressions no more.

Now that these sins have been forgiven, there are no more sacrifices for sin. Hebrews 10:17-18

3. The resurrected new man will appear

(1) The new man appears in glory

For you have died and your life is hidden with Christ in God. When Christ, who is our life, appears, you also will appear with him in glory. Colossians 3:3-4

(2) The body of the new man appears similar to his glorious body

He will transform our lowly bodies to be like His glorious body, according to the power by which He is able to subdue all things to Himself.
Philippians 3:21

(3) You will see His true form, and the body of the new man will appear like Him

Dear brothers, we are children of God now, and what we will be in the future has not yet been revealed; but we know that when the Lord appears, we will be like Him, because we will see Him as He is. 1 John 3:2

articles.author: admin
articles.content:
Peace to all brothers and sisters!

Today we study the fellowship and share about tithing!

Let’s turn to Leviticus 27:30 in the Old Testament and read together:
“Everything on earth,
Whether it is the seed on the ground or the fruit on the tree,
The tenth is the Lord’s;
It is holy to the LORD.

------One-tenth-----

1. Abram’s Dedication

And Melchizedek, king of Salem (which means king of peace), came out to meet him with bread and wine; he was the priest of the Most High God.
He blessed Abram and said: "May the Lord of heaven and earth, the Most High God, bless Abram! Blessed is the Most High God for delivering your enemies into your hands!"

"So Abram gave a tenth of all his earnings to Melchizedek. Genesis 14:18-20

2. Jacob’s Dedication

Jacob made a vow: “If God will be with me and keep me on my way, and give me food to eat and clothing to wear, so that I can return to my father’s house in peace, then I will make the Lord my God. God.

The stones that I have set up for pillars shall also be the temple of God; and of all that you give me I will give you a tenth. ”---Genesis 28:20-22

3. The Israelites’ Dedication

For I have given the Levites as an inheritance the tenth part of the produce of the children of Israel, which is the heave offering to the LORD. So I said to them, ‘There shall be no inheritance among the children of Israel. ’”
The LORD commanded Moses, “Speak to the Levites and say to them, ‘Of the tenth that you take from the children of Israel, which I give you for your inheritance, you are to take another tenth as an inheritance. Offer sacrifices to the LORD—Numbers 18:24-26
Of all the gifts given to you, the best of them, the consecrated ones, shall be offered as a heave offering to the LORD. --Numbers 18:29

"Every three years is the year of tithes. You have taken one-tenth of all the land.
Give it to the Levites (workers of holy works) and to the strangers, to the fatherless and to the widows, so that they may have enough to eat in your gates. Deuteronomy 26:12

5. One-tenth is the Lord’s

“Everything on earth,
Whether it is the seed on the ground or the fruit on the tree,
The tenth is the Lord’s;
It is holy to the LORD.

---Leviticus 27:30

6. The firstfruits belong to the Lord

You have to use your property
and the firstfruits of all your produce honor the LORD.
Then your storehouses will be filled with more than enough;

Your winepresses overflow with new wine. --Proverbs 3:9-10

7. Try depositing one-tenth into the "Tianku"

Test me by bringing a full tenth of your tithes into the storehouse so that there may be food in my house, says the LORD of hosts.
Will it open the windows of heaven for you and pour out blessings to you, even if there is no place to receive it? ---Malachi 3:10

articles.title: Dedication 2
articles.author: admin
articles.content:
Peace to all brothers and sisters!

Today we continue to study fellowship and share about Christian devotion!

Let’s turn to Matthew 13:22-23 in the New Testament of the Bible and read together: He who was sown among thorns is the one who hears the word, but then the cares of the world and the deceitfulness of money choke the word so that it cannot bear fruit. . What was sown on good ground is the one who hears the word and understands it, and it bears fruit, sometimes a hundredfold, sometimes sixtyfold, and sometimes thirtyfold. "

1. Dedication of Doctors from the East

... Certain wise men came to Jerusalem from the east, saying, "Where is he who is born King of the Jews? We have seen his star in the east, and we have come to worship him."

...When they saw the star, they rejoiced greatly; and when they came into the house, they saw the Child with Mary his mother; and they fell down and worshiped the Child, and opened their treasures and presented to Him gifts of gold, frankincense, and myrrh. Matthew 2:1-11

【Faith.Hope.Love】

gold :Represents dignity and confidence!
mastic : Represents the fragrance and the hope of resurrection!

Myrrh :Represents healing, suffering, redemption and love!

2. Dedication of two kinds of people

(1)Cain and Abel

Cain → One day Cain brought an offering from the fruits of the ground to the LORD;
Abel → Abel also offered the firstborn of his flock and their fat. The Lord had regard for Abel and his offering, but not for Cain and his offering.

Cain became very angry and his countenance changed. Genesis 4:3-5

ask :Why did you take a fancy to Abel and his offering?

answer : By faith Abel (offering the best firstlings of his flock and their fat) offered to God a more excellent sacrifice than Cain, and thus received testimony that he was justified, that God pointed out that he was righteous. The gift bears witness. Even though he died, he still spoke because of this faith. Reference Hebrews 11:4 ;

What Cain offered was without faith, love, and reverence for God, Jehovah. He just offered what the ground produced casually, and he did not offer the first fruits of the good produce as an offering. Although the Bible did not explain it, God had already rebuked him. He said that his offering was not good and was not acceptable.

→The Lord said to Cain: "Why are you angry? Why is your countenance changed? If you do well, will you not be accepted? If you do poorly, sin lurks at the door. It will lust after you. You, you shall subdue it.” Genesis 4:6-7.

(2) Hypocrites give tithes

(Jesus) said, “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! Because you tithe mint, fennel, and celery;

On the contrary, the more important matters in the law, namely justice, mercy, and faithfulness, are no longer acceptable. This is the more important thing you should do; it is also necessary. Matthew 23:23

The Pharisee stood and prayed to himself: ‘God, I thank you that I am not like other men, extortioners, unjust, adulterers, nor like this tax collector. I fast twice a week and give a tenth of everything I get. ’ Luke 18:11-12

(3) God does not like those offered according to the law

You do not like burnt offerings and sin offerings.
At that time I said: God, here I come,
To do your will;
My deeds are written in the scrolls.

It says: “Sacrifice and gift, burnt offering and sin offering, which you did not want and which you did not like (these are according to the law)”; Hebrews 10:6-8

ask : Why don’t you like what is offered according to the law?

answer : What is offered according to the law is a command that requires the implementation of regulations, rather than a willing offering. Such a offering reminds people of sins every year, but it cannot get rid of sins.

But these sacrifices were an annual reminder of sin; for the blood of bulls and goats could never take away sin. Hebrews 10:3-4

(4) Donate "one-tenth"

“Everything on earth,
Whether it is the seed on the ground or the fruit on the tree,
The tenth is the Lord’s;
It is holy to the LORD.

---Leviticus 27:30

→→Abraham gave tithe

He blessed Abram and said, "May the Lord of heaven and earth, the Most High God, bless Abram! Blessed is the Most High God for delivering your enemies into your hands!" Abram took what he got. Give a tithe to Melchizedek. Genesis 14:19-20

→→Jacob gave one-tenth

The stones that I have set up for pillars shall also be the temple of God; and of all that you give me I will give you a tenth. ” Genesis 28:22

→→The Pharisees gave one-tenth

I fast twice a week and give a tenth of everything I get. Luke 18:12

Note: Because Abraham and Jacob knew in their hearts that everything they received was given by God, so they were willing to give ten percent;

The Pharisees, on the other hand, were under the law and donated according to the regulations of the law. They obtained all their money by their own cleverness. They reluctantly donated one tenth of "everything I earned", just like paying taxes compulsorily.

Therefore, the behavior and mentality of giving “tenth” is completely different.

So, do you understand clearly?

3. Dedication of the poor widow

Jesus looked up and saw the rich man putting his donation into the treasury, and a poor widow putting in two small coins. He said, "Truly, I say to you, this poor widow has put in more than all the others, for everyone has more than they have." , and put it into the offering, but the widow put in all she had to live on out of her own insufficiency (faith in loving God).” Luke 21:1-4

poverty :Poverty of material money
widowed :Loneliness without support

woman : It means that the woman is weak.

4. Donate money to the saints

Concerning giving for the saints, just as I commanded the churches in Galatia, so you must also do. On the first day of every week, each person is to set aside money according to his own income, so that he will not have to collect it when I come. 1 Corinthians 16:1-2
But do not forget to do good and to donate, for such sacrifices please God. Hebrews 13:16

5. Be willing to contribute

ask : How do Christians give?

answer : Detailed explanation below

(1) willingly

Brothers, I tell you about the grace that God has given to the churches in Macedonia. Even when they were in great trials and tribulations, they were still full of joy. Even in the midst of extreme poverty, they showed great kindness in giving. I can attest that they gave freely and willingly according to their ability and beyond their ability, 2 Corinthians 8:1-3

(2) Not out of reluctance

Therefore, I think I have to ask those brothers to come to you first and prepare the donations that were promised before, so that it will be shown that what you donate is out of willingness and not out of compulsion. 2 Corinthians 9:5

(3) Participate in spiritual benefits

But now, I go to Jerusalem to minister to the saints. For the Macedonians and Achaeans were willing to collect donations for the poor among the saints in Jerusalem.
Although this is their willingness, it is actually considered a debt owed (a debt owed to preaching the gospel and providing for the shortcomings of the saints and the poor); because since the Gentiles share in their spiritual benefits, they should use the things that support their health. Supply them. Romans 15:25-27

Participate in spiritual benefits:

ask : What is spiritual benefit?

answer : Detailed explanation below

1: Let people believe the gospel and be saved--Romans 1:16-17
2: Understand the truth of the gospel--1 Corinthians 4:15, James 1:18
3: That you may understand regeneration--John 3:5-7
4: Believe in death, burial, and resurrection with Christ--Romans 6:6-8
5: Understand that the old man initiates death, and the new man manifests the life of Jesus--2 Corinthians 4:10-12
6: How to believe and work together with Jesus--John 6:28-29
7: How to be glorified with Jesus--Romans 6:17
8: How to get reward--1 Corinthians 9:24
9: Receive the crown of glory--1 Peter 5:4
10: A better resurrection--Hebrews 11:35
11: Reign with Christ for a thousand years--Revelation 20:6
12: Reign with Jesus forever and ever--Revelation 22:3-5

Note: Therefore, if you zealously donate to support the holy work in the house of God, the servants who preach the true gospel, and the poor brothers and sisters among the saints, you are working together with God. If you work hard and contribute with the servants of Christ, God will remember it. Servants of the Lord Jesus Christ, they will lead you to eat and drink the spiritual food of life, so that your spiritual life will be richer and you will have a better resurrection in the future. Amen!

You followed Jesus, believed in the true gospel, and supported the servants who preached the true gospel! They receive the same glory, reward, and crown with Jesus Christ →→ That is, you are the same as them: receive the glory, reward, and crown together, a better resurrection, a premillennial resurrection, and Christ’s reign for a thousand years, New heavens and new earth with Jesus Christ reigning forever and ever. Amen!

So, do you understand clearly?

(Just like the tribe of Levi paid tithe through Abraham)

→→It can also be said that Levi, who received the tithe, also received the tithe through Abraham. Because when Melchizedek met Abraham, Levi was already in the body (original text, loins) of his ancestor.

Hebrews 7:9-10

【Christians should be alert:】

If some people follow→and believe→those preachers who preach false doctrines and confuse the true gospel, and they do not understand the Bible, the salvation of Christ, and rebirth, then you are not reborn, do you believe it or not. As for their desire to receive glory, rewards, crowns, and their delusional plans to be resurrected before the millennium, let’s not even mention it. Do you think that’s right? Whoever has ears, let him hear and be alert.

4. Store up treasures in heaven

“Do not lay up for yourselves treasures on earth, where moths and rust destroy, and where thieves break in and steal. But store up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where moths and rust do not destroy, and where thieves break in and steal. Matthew Gospel 6:19-20

5. First fruits honor the Lord

You have to use your property
and the firstfruits of all your produce honor the LORD.
Then your storehouses will be filled with more than enough;

Your winepresses overflow with new wine. --Proverbs 3:9-10

(The firstfruits are the first wealth obtained, such as the first salary, the income from the first business or the harvest of the land, and the best sacrifices are made to honor the Lord. Such as giving to support the gospel work in God’s house, preaching Servants of the gospel, saints of the poor. In this way, you may have food in the storehouses of heaven. And to everyone who has food in the storehouses of heaven, the Father will add to you, so that you may have an abundance.)

6. To everyone who has, more will be given

For to everyone who has (stored up in heaven), to him (on earth) more will be given, and he will have an abundance; but whoever does not have, even what he has will be taken away from him. Matthew 25:29
(Note: If you don’t store your treasures in heaven, insects will bite you on the earth, and thieves will break in and steal. When the time comes, your money will fly away, and you will have nothing in heaven and earth.)

7. “He who sows sparingly will reap sparingly; he who sows sparingly will reap bountifully.”

→→This is true. Let each give as he has determined in his heart, without difficulty or force, for God loves those who give cheerfully. God is able to make all grace abound toward you, so that you may always have all sufficiency in everything and be able to abound in every good work. As it is written:
He gave money to the poor;
His righteousness endures forever.

He who gives seed to the sower and bread for food will multiply the seed for your sowing and the fruit of your righteousness, so that you may be rich in everything, so that you may give abundantly, giving thanks to God through us. 2 Corinthians 9:6-11

6. Total dedication

(1) Official of a wealthy person

A judge asked the "Lord":"Good Master, what should I do to inherit eternal life?" The "Lord" said to him: "Why do you call me good? Except There is no one good except God. You know the commandments: 'You shall not commit adultery; you shall not murder; you shall not steal; you shall not bear false witness; you shall honor your father and mother.'" The man said, "I have kept all these since I was a child. "The Lord" heard this and said, "You still lack one thing: sell everything you have and give it to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven; and you will come and follow me."

When he heard this, he was very sad, because he was very rich.

( Rich officials are reluctant to store their treasures in heaven )

When Jesus saw him, he said, “How difficult it is for those who have wealth to enter the kingdom of God! Luke 18:18-24

(Lay up inexhaustible treasure in heaven)

---Luke 12:33

“Do not lay up for yourselves treasures on earth, where moths and rust destroy, and where thieves break in and steal. But store up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where moths and rust do not destroy, and where thieves break in and steal. Because of you Where your treasure is, there your heart will be also." Matthew 6:19-21

(2) Follow Jesus

1 left behind--Luke 18:28, 5:11
2 Denial of self--Matthew 16:24
3 Follow Jesus--Mark 8:34
4 Bearing the crossroads--Mark 8:34
5 Hate life--John 12:25
6 Lose your life--Mark 8:35
7 Obtain the life of Christ--Matthew 16:25
8 Receive glory--Romans 8:17

.......

(3) Offer as a living sacrifice

Therefore, I urge you, brethren, by the mercies of God, to present your bodies a living sacrifice, holy, acceptable to God, which is your spiritual service. Do not be conformed to this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind, that you may prove what is the good and acceptable and perfect will of God. Romans 12:1-2

7. Run straight towards the goal

Brothers, I do not count myself as having already received it; but one thing I do: forgetting what is behind and reaching forward to what is before, I press toward the goal for the prize of the high calling of God in Christ Jesus.

Philippians 3:13-14

8. There are 100, 60, and 30 times

What was sown among thorns is a person who heard the word, but later the cares of the world and the deceitfulness of money choked the word, so that it could not bear fruit.

What was sown on good ground is the one who hears the word and understands it, and it bears fruit, sometimes a hundredfold, sometimes sixtyfold, and sometimes thirtyfold. ” Matthew 13:22-23

[Believe that you will get a hundredfold in this life and eternal life in the next life]

There is no one who cannot live a hundredfold in this world and cannot live forever in the world to come. "

Luke 18:30

articles.title: The Parable of the Ten Virgins
articles.author: admin
articles.content:
Peace to all brothers and sisters!

Today we are looking for fellowship sharing: The Parable of the Ten Virgins

Let’s open our Bible to Matthew 25:1-13 and read together: “Then the kingdom of heaven will be likened to ten virgins who took their lamps and went out to meet the bridegroom. Five of them were foolish and five were wise. Foolishly The wise took their lamps, but took no oil in their vessels; the wise took their lamps, and prepared oil in their vessels. . . .

Question: What do virgins represent?

answer:" virgin "It means chastity, holiness, cleanness, flawless, undefiled, sinless! It represents rebirth, new life! Ah guys

1 Born of water and the Spirit--Refer to John 1:5-7
2 Born from the truth of the gospel--refer to 1 Corinthians 4:15, James 1:18

3 Born of God--refer to John 1:12-13

[I have begotten you in Christ Jesus through the gospel] → You who are students of Christ may have ten thousand teachers but few fathers, for I have begotten you through the gospel in Christ Jesus. 1 Corinthians 4:15

【" virgin "Also for the church.as chaste virgins presented to Christ]→ ...for I have betrothed you to one husband to be consecrated to Christ as chaste virgins. 2 Corinthians 11:2

Question: What does "Lamp" represent?

Answer: "Lamp" represents faith and confidence!

The church where the "Holy Spirit" is present! Reference Revelation 1:20,4:5
The light emitted by the church's "lamp" → guides us on the path to eternal life.
Your word is a lamp to my feet and a light to my path. (Psalm 119:105)

→→“At that time (that is, at the end of the world), the kingdom of heaven will be likened to ten virgins who took lamps (that is, the faith of the ten virgins) and went out to meet (Jesus) the bridegroom. Matthew 25:1

[Five fools holding lamps]

1 Anyone who hears the teachings of the kingdom of heaven but does not understand

The "faith, faith" of the five foolish people → is like the "Parable of the Sower": Whoever hears the word of the kingdom of heaven and does not understand it, the evil one comes and takes away what is sown in his heart; this is what is sown on the road Next to it. Matthew 13:19

2 Because he had no root in his heart... he fell.

What is sown on rocky ground is a person who hears the word and immediately receives it with joy, but because he has no root in his heart, it is only temporary. When he suffers tribulation or persecution because of the word, he immediately falls. Matthew 13:20-21
ask:" Oil "What does it mean?"
answer:" Oil "Refers to the anointing oil. The word of God! It represents rebirth and receiving the promised Holy Spirit as a seal! Amen

“The Spirit of the Lord is upon me, because he has anointed me to preach good news to the poor; he has sent me to proclaim release to the captives and recovery of sight to the blind, to set at liberty the oppressed, Luke 4:18

【 five wise virgins 】

1 When people hear the message and understand it

"Faith. Faith" of Five Wise Virgins: The Church with the Presence of the Holy Spirit → What is sown on good ground is the one who hears the word and understands it, and then it bears fruit, sometimes a hundredfold, sometimes sixtyfold, and sometimes thirtyfold. ” Matthew 13:23

(Type 1 people) Anyone who hears the teachings of the kingdom of heaven but does not understand...Matthew 13:19

(Type 2 people)→→ ... People hear the message and understand it ...Matthew 13:23

ask:
What is the doctrine of the kingdom of heaven?
What does it mean to hear the sermon and understand it?

Answer: Detailed explanation below

Hearing the word of truth → is the truth of the kingdom of heaven

And since you have heard the word of truth, the gospel of your salvation, and have believed in Christ...

1 (Belief) Jesus is the Messiah sent by God - Isaiah 9:6

And buried - 1 Corinthians 15:3-4, 1 Peter 2:24

9 (Faith) We are born of water and the Spirit--John 1:5-7
10 (Faith) We are born of the truth of the gospel - 1 Corinthians 4:15, James 1:18
11 (Faith) We are born of God - John 1:12-13
12 (Faith) The gospel is the power of God for salvation to everyone who believes - Romans 1:16-17

15 (Faith) Christ's (once) sacrifice makes those who are sanctified eternally perfect - Hebrews 10:14
16 (Believe) that the Spirit of God dwells in you, and you (the new man) are not of the flesh (the old man) - Romans 8:9

20 In Him you were sealed with the Holy Spirit of promise, when you also believed in Christ when you heard the word of truth, the gospel of your salvation—Ephesians 1:13

【 People hear the message and understand it 】

This is what the Lord Jesus said: "Everyone who hears the word of the kingdom of heaven... hears it and understands it! Later it bears fruit, some a hundred times, some sixty, and some thirty times. Do you understand?


Matthew 25:5 When the bridegroom delays...(It tells us to wait patiently for the coming of the Lord Jesus the bridegroom.)

’ The wise man replied: ‘I’m afraid it’s not enough for you and me. Why don’t you go to the oil seller and buy it yourself.

Q: Where is the place that sells "oil"?
answer:" Oil "Refers to the anointing oil! The anointing oil is the Holy Spirit! The place where oil is sold is the church where God's servants preach the gospel, speak the truth, and the church where the Holy Spirit is with you, so that you can hear the word of truth and receive the promised "anointing oil" of the Holy Spirit. !

articles.title: Put on Spiritual Armor 7
articles.author: admin
articles.content:
Peace to all brothers and sisters!

Today we continue to examine fellowship and share: Christians must put on the spiritual armor given by God every day.

Lecture 7: Rely on the Holy Spirit. Pray and ask at any time

Let’s open our Bible to Ephesians 6:18 and read together: Pray at all times with all kinds of supplications and supplications in the Spirit; and be alert in this without tiring to make supplications for all the saints.

1. Live by the Holy Spirit and act by the Holy Spirit

If we live by the Spirit, we should also walk by the Spirit. Galatians 5:25

(1) Live by the Holy Spirit

Question: What is life by the Holy Spirit?

Answer: Rebirth - is to live by the Holy Spirit! Amen

1 Born of water and the Spirit - John 3:5-7
2 Born from the truth of the gospel - 1 Corinthians 4:15, James 1:18

3 Born of God - John 1:12-13

(2) Walk by the Holy Spirit

Question: How do you walk by the Holy Spirit?

Answer: Detailed explanation below

1 Old things have passed away, and all things have become new.

If anyone is in Christ, he is a new creation; old things have passed away; all things have become new. 2 Corinthians 5:17

2 The new man who is reborn does not belong to the flesh of the old man

If the Spirit of God dwells in your hearts, you (the new man) are no longer of the flesh (the old man), but of the Spirit. If anyone does not have the Spirit of Christ, he does not belong to Christ. Romans 8:9

3 The conflict between the Holy Spirit and the lust of the flesh

I say, walk by the Spirit, and you will not fulfill the lusts of the flesh. For the flesh lusteth against the Spirit, and the Spirit lusteth against the flesh: these two are opposed to each other, so that you cannot do what you wish to do. But if you are led by the Spirit, you are not under the law. The works of the flesh are obvious: adultery, impurity, licentiousness, idolatry, sorcery, hatred, strife, jealousy, outbursts of anger, factions, dissensions, heresies, and envy. , drunkenness, revelry, etc. I told you before and I tell you now that those who do such things will not inherit the kingdom of God. Galatians 5:16-21

4 Put to death the evil deeds of the body by the Holy Spirit

Brothers, it seems that we are not debtors to the flesh to live according to the flesh. If you live according to the flesh, you will die; but if by the Spirit you put to death the deeds of the body, you will live. Romans 8:12-13 and Colossians 3:5-8

5 Put on the new self and put off the old self

Do not lie to one another, for you have put off your old self and its deeds and have put on the new self. The new man is renewed in knowledge into the image of his Creator. Colossians 3:9-10 and Ephesians 4:22-24

6 The old man’s flesh is gradually deteriorating, but the new man is being renewed day by day in Christ.

Therefore, we do not lose heart. Although the outer body (the old man) is being destroyed, the inner man (the new man) is being renewed day by day. Our light and momentary sufferings will work for us an eternal weight of glory beyond compare. 2 Corinthians 4:16-17

7 Grow up to Christ, the Head

To equip the saints for the work of ministry, and to build up the body of Christ, until we all come to the unity of the faith and the knowledge of the Son of God, to mature manhood, to the measure of the stature of the fullness of Christ,… only by Love speaks the truth and grows in all things into Him who is the Head, Christ, by whom the whole body is held together and fitted together, with every joint serving its purpose and supporting one another according to the function of each part, causing the body to grow and build itself up in love. Ephesians 4:12-13,15-16

8 A more beautiful resurrection

A woman had her own dead raised to life. Others endured severe torture and refused to be released (the original text was redemption) in order to obtain a better resurrection. Hebrews 11:35

2. Pray and ask at any time

(1) Pray often and don’t lose heart

Jesus told a parable to teach people to pray often and not lose heart. Luke 18:1

Whatever you ask for in prayer, just believe, and you will receive it. ” Matthew 21:22

(2) Tell God what you want through prayer and supplication

Do not be anxious about anything, but in everything by prayer and supplication, with thanksgiving, present your requests to God. And the peace of God, which transcends all understanding, will guard your hearts and your minds in Christ Jesus. Philippians 4:6-7

(3) Pray in the Holy Spirit

But, dear brothers, build yourselves up in the most holy faith, pray in the Holy Spirit,

Keep yourselves in the love of God, looking to the mercy of our Lord Jesus Christ unto everlasting life. Jude 1:20-21

(4) Pray with spirit as well as with understanding

Paul said, "What about this?" I want to pray with the spirit and also with the understanding; I want to sing with the spirit and also with the understanding. 1 Corinthians 14:15

(5) The Holy Spirit prays for us with groans

#The Holy Spirit intercedes for the saints according to God’s will#

Moreover, the Holy Spirit helps us in our weakness; we do not know how to pray, but the Holy Spirit Himself prays for us with unutterable groanings. He who searches the hearts knows the thoughts of the Spirit, because the Spirit intercedes for the saints according to the will of God. Romans 8:26-27

(6) Be cautious, watchful and pray

The end of all things is near. Therefore, be careful and sober, watch and pray. 1 Peter 4:7

(7) The prayers of righteous people are very effective in healing.

If any of you is suffering, he should pray; if anyone is happy, he should sing praises. If any of you is sick, he should call the elders of the church; they may anoint him with oil in the name of the Lord and pray for him. The prayer of faith will save the sick man, and the Lord will raise him up; and if he has sinned (sins of the old man's flesh), he will be forgiven. (Refer to Hebrews 10:17) Therefore confess your sins to one another and pray for one another, so that you may be healed. The prayer of a righteous man has great effect. James 5:13-16

(8) Pray and lay hands on the sick to be healed

At that time, Publius's father lay sick with fever and dysentery. Paul went in, prayed for him, laid his hands on him, and healed him. Acts 28:8
Jesus could not perform any miracles there, but he only laid hands on a few sick people and healed them. Mark 6:5

Do not be hasty when laying hands on others; do not participate in other people's sins, but keep yourself clean. 1 Timothy 5:22

3. Be a good soldier of Christ

Suffer with me as a good soldier of Christ Jesus. 2 Timothy 2:3

And I looked, and behold the Lamb standing on Mount Zion, and with him one hundred and forty-four thousand, having his name and the name of his Father written on their foreheads. …These have not been tainted with women; they are virgins. They follow the Lamb wherever he goes. They were purchased from among men as firstfruits for God and for the Lamb. Revelation 14:1,4

4. Working together with Christ

For we are laborers together with God; you are God’s field and His building. 1 Corinthians 3:9

5. There are 100, 60, and 30 times

And some fell into good soil and bore fruit, some a hundredfold, some sixtyfold, and some thirtyfold. Matthew 13:8

6. Receive glory, reward, and crown

If they are children, then they are heirs, heirs of God and joint heirs with Christ. If we suffer with Him, we will also be glorified with Him. Romans 8:17
I press toward the goal for the prize of the high calling of God in Christ Jesus. Philippians 3:14

(The Lord said) I am coming quickly, and you must hold on to what you have, so that no one takes your crown away. Revelation 3:11

7. Reigning with Christ

Blessed and holy are those who take part in the first resurrection! The second death has no authority over them. They shall be priests of God and of Christ, and shall reign with Christ a thousand years. Revelation 20:6

8. Reign forever and ever

There will be no more night; they will have no need of lamps or sunlight, for the Lord God will give them light. They will reign forever and ever. Revelation 22:5

Therefore, Christians must put on the full armor given by God every day so that they can resist the devil's schemes, resist the enemy in the days of tribulation, and accomplish everything and still stand firm. So stand firm,

1 Girdle your waist with the truth,
2 Put on the breastplate of righteousness,
3 Having put on your feet the preparation for walking, the gospel of peace.
4 Furthermore, taking up the shield of faith, with which you can quench all the flaming arrows of the evil one;
5 And put on the helmet of salvation, and take up the sword of the Spirit, which is the word of God;
6 Pray at all times with all kinds of supplications and supplications in the Spirit;

7 And be alert and unfailingly praying for all the saints!

articles.title: Put on Spiritual Armor 6
articles.author: admin
articles.content:
Peace to all brothers and sisters!

Today we continue to examine fellowship and share: Christians must put on the spiritual armor given by God every day.

Lecture 6: Put on the helmet of salvation and hold the sword of the Holy Spirit

Let’s open our Bible to Ephesians 6:17 and read together: And put on the helmet of salvation, and take the sword of the Spirit, which is the word of God;

1. Put on the helmet of salvation

(1) Salvation

The Lord has invented his salvation, and has shown his righteousness in the sight of the nations; Psalm 98:2
Sing to the LORD and bless his name! Preach His salvation every day! Psalm 96:2

He who brings good news, peace, good news, and salvation says to Zion: Your God reigns! How beautiful are the feet of this man climbing the mountain! Isaiah 52:7

Question: How do people know God’s salvation?

Answer: Forgiveness of sins - then you know salvation!

Note: If your religious "conscience" always feels guilty, the sinner's conscience will not be cleansed and forgiven! You would not know God's salvation - See Hebrews 10:2.
We should believe what God says in the Bible according to His words. This is right and correct. Amen! As the Lord Jesus said: My sheep hear my voice, and I know them, and they follow me - Reference John 10:27
That his people may know salvation through the forgiveness of their sins…

All flesh will see God’s salvation! Luke 1:77,3:6

Question: How are our sins forgiven?

Answer: Detailed explanation below

(2) Salvation by Jesus Christ

Question: What is salvation in Christ?

Answer: Believe in Jesus! Believe the gospel!

(Lord Jesus) said: "The time is fulfilled, and the kingdom of God is at hand. Repent and believe the gospel!" Mark 1:15

(Paul said) I am not ashamed of the gospel; for it is the power of God for salvation to everyone who believes, to the Jew first and also to the Greek. For the righteousness of God is revealed in this gospel; this righteousness is by faith from faith to faith. As it is written: “The righteous shall live by faith.” Romans 1:16-17

So you believe in Jesus and the gospel! This gospel is the salvation of Jesus Christ. If you believe in this gospel, your sins can be forgiven, saved, reborn, and have eternal life! Amen.

Question: How do you believe this gospel?

Answer: Detailed explanation below

[1] Believe that Jesus was a virgin conceived and born of the Holy Spirit - Matthew 1:18,21
[2] Belief that Jesus is the Son of God-Luke 1:30-35
[3] Believe that Jesus came in the flesh - 1 John 4:2, John 1:14
[4] Belief in Jesus is the original way of life and the light of life - John 1:1-4, 8:12, 1 John 1:1-2
[5] Believe in the Lord God who laid the sin of us all on Jesus - Isaiah 53:6

[6] Believe in the love of Jesus! He died on the cross for our sins, was buried, and rose again on the third day. 1 Corinthians 15:3-4

(Note: Christ died for our sins!

1 that we all may be freed from sin - Romans 6:7;

2 Freed from the law and its curse - Romans 7:6, Galatians 3:13;
3 Delivered from the power of Satan - Acts 26:18
4 Delivered from the World - John 17:14
And buried!
5 Set us free from the old self and its practices - Colossians 3:9;
6 Out of self-Galatians 2:20
Resurrected on the third day!

7 Christ’s resurrection has regenerated us and justified us! Amen. 1 Peter 1:3 and Romans 4:25

[7] Adoption as sons of God-Galatians 4:5
[8] Put on the new self, put on Christ - Galatians 3:26-27
[9] The Holy Spirit bears witness with our spirit that we are children of God - Romans 8:16
[10] Translate us (the new man) into the kingdom of God’s beloved Son - Colossians 2:13
[11] Our regenerated new life is hidden with Christ in God - Colossians 3:3
[12] When Christ appears, we also will appear with him in glory - Colossians 3:4

This is the salvation of Jesus Christ. Everyone who believes in Jesus is a child of God. They are resurrected and reborn with Christ. They put on the new man and put on Christ. They all wear the helmet of salvation! Amen.

2. Hold the sword of the Holy Spirit

(1) Receive the promised Holy Spirit

Question: How to receive the promised Holy Spirit?

Answer: Hear the gospel, the true way, and believe in Jesus!

In Him you were sealed with the Holy Spirit of promise, when you also believed in Christ when you heard the word of truth, the gospel of your salvation. Ephesians 1:13
For example, Simon Peter preached in the house of "Gentiles" Cornelius. These Gentiles heard the word of truth, the gospel of their salvation, and believed in Jesus Christ, and the Holy Spirit fell on all those who listened. Reference Acts 10:34-48

(2) The Holy Spirit testifies with our hearts that we are children of God

For as many as are led by the Spirit of God are the sons of God. You did not receive the spirit of bondage to remain in fear; you received the spirit of adoption, in which we cry, “Abba, Father!” The Holy Spirit bears witness with our spirit that we are children of God; and if we are children, That is, heirs, heirs of God, joint heirs with Christ. If we suffer with Him, we will also be glorified with Him.
Romans 8:14-17

(3) The treasure is placed in an earthen vessel

We have this treasure in earthen vessels to show that this great power comes from God and not from us. 2 Corinthians 4:7

Question: What is this treasure?

Answer: It is the Holy Spirit of truth! Amen

"If you love me, you will keep my commandments. And I will ask the Father, and he will give you another Comforter (or Comforter; the same below), that he may be with you forever, who is the truth. The world cannot accept the Holy Spirit; for it neither sees Him nor knows Him, but you know Him, for He abides with you and will be in you John 14:15-17.

3. It is the Word of God

Question: What is the Word of God?

Answer: The gospel preached to you is the word of God!

(1) In the beginning there was Tao

In the beginning there was the Tao, and the Tao was with God, and the Tao was God. This Word was with God in the beginning. John 1:1-2

(2) The Word became flesh

The Word became flesh and dwelt among us, full of grace and truth. And we have beheld his glory, the glory as of the only begotten of the Father. John 1:14

(3) Believe in the gospel and be reborn. This gospel is the word of God.

Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ! According to his great mercy he has begotten us again into a living hope through the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead... You have been born again, not of perishable seed but of incorruptible seed, Through the living and abiding word of God. …Only the Word of the Lord endures forever.

This is the gospel that was preached to you. 1 Peter 1:3,23,25

Brothers and sisters!

Remember to collect.

articles.title: Put on Spiritual Armor 5
articles.author: admin
articles.content:
Peace to all brothers and sisters!

Today we continue to examine fellowship and share: Christians must put on the spiritual armor given by God every day.

Lecture 5: Use faith as a shield

Let’s open our Bible to Ephesians 6:16 and read it together: Furthermore, taking the shield of faith, which is able to quench all the flaming arrows of the evil one;

(Note: The paper version is "vine"; the electronic version is "shield")

1. Faith

Question: What is faith?
Answer: "Faith" means faith, honesty, truth, and amen; "virtue" means character, holiness, righteousness, love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faithfulness, gentleness, and self-control.

2. Confidence

(1) letter

Question: What is a letter?

Answer: Detailed explanation below

Faith is the substance of things hoped for, the evidence of things not seen. The ancients had wonderful evidence in this letter.
By faith we know that the worlds were created by the word of God; so that what is seen was not created out of the obvious. (Hebrews 11:1-3)

For example, a farmer is planting wheat in the field. He expects that if a grain of wheat falls into the ground and is planted, it will produce many grains in the future. This is the substance of things hoped for, the evidence of things not seen.

(2) Based on faith and to faith

For the righteousness of God is revealed in this gospel; this righteousness is by faith from faith to faith. As it is written: “The righteous shall live by faith.” (Romans 1:17)

(3) Faith and promise

Believe in Jesus and receive eternal life:
“For God so loved the world that he gave his only begotten Son, that whoever believes in him shall not perish but have everlasting life. (John 3:16)
From faith to faith:
Based on faith: Believe in Jesus and be saved and have eternal life! Amen.
To the point of believing: Follow Jesus and walk with Him to preach the gospel, and receive glory, reward, crown, and a better resurrection. Amen!

If they are children, then they are heirs, heirs of God and joint heirs with Christ. If we suffer with Him, we will also be glorified with Him. (Romans 8:17)

3. Taking faith as a shield

Furthermore, taking up the shield of faith, with which you can quench all the flaming arrows of the evil one; (Ephesians 6:16)

Question: How to use faith as a shield?

Answer: Detailed explanation below

(1)Faith

1 Believe that Jesus was conceived by the virgin and born of the Holy Spirit - Matthew 1:18,21
2 Believe that Jesus is the Word made flesh - John 1:14
3 Belief that Jesus is the Son of God-Luke 1:31-35
4 Believe in Jesus as the Savior, Christ, and Messiah - Luke 2:11, John 1:41
5 Faith in the Lord lays the sin of us all upon Jesus - Isaiah 53:8
6 Believe that Jesus died on the cross for our sins, was buried, and rose again on the third day - 1 Corinthians 15:3-4
7 Belief that Jesus rose from the dead and regenerated us - 1 Peter 1:3
8 Belief in the resurrection of Jesus justifies us - Romans 4:25
9 Because the Holy Spirit lives in us, our new self is no longer of the old self and flesh - Romans 8:9
10 The Holy Spirit bears witness with our spirit that we are children of God - Romans 8:16
11 Put on the new self, put on Christ - Gal 3:26-27
12 Believe that the Holy Spirit gives us various gifts, authority and power (such as preaching the gospel, healing the sick, casting out demons, performing miracles, speaking in tongues, etc.) - 1 Corinthians 12:7-11
13 We who suffered for the faith of the Lord Jesus will be glorified with Him - Romans 8:17
14 Resurrection with a better body-Hebrews 11:35

15 Reign with Christ for a thousand years and forever! Amen-Revelation 20:6,22:5

(2) Faith serves as a shield to quench all the flaming arrows of the evil one

1 Discern the deception of the evil one - Ephesians 4:14
2 can resist the devil’s schemes - Ephesians 6:11
3 Reject all temptation-Matthew 18:6-9
(For example: the customs of this world, idols, computer games, mobile networks, artificial intelligence... follow the desires of the flesh and heart - Ephesians 2:1-8)
4. To resist the enemy in the day of trouble - Ephesians 6:13
(As recorded in the Bible: Satan struck Job and gave him boils from his feet to his head - Job 2:7; Satan's messenger put a thorn in Paul's flesh - 2 Corinthians 12:7)
5 I say to you, "Beware of the leaven of the Pharisees (who are justified by the law) and the Sadducees (who do not believe in the resurrection of the dead)." This does not refer to bread. Why don't you understand? ” Matthew 16:11
6 Resist him, firm in the faith, knowing that your brothers throughout the world are also undergoing the same kind of suffering. The God of all grace, who has called you to his eternal glory in Christ, after you have suffered a little while, will Himself perfect you, strengthen you, and give you strength. 1 Peter 5:9-10

7 Therefore, obey God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you. Draw near to God, and God will draw near to you…James 4:7-8

(3)Those who overcome through Jesus

(Better than the devil, better than the world, better than death!)

For whoever is born of God overcomes the world; and that which overcomes the world is our faith. Who is it that overcomes the world? Isn’t it the one who believes that Jesus is the Son of God? 1 John 5:4-5

1 Whoever has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches! To him who overcomes, I will give him to eat from the tree of life in the Paradise of God. ’” Revelation 2:7
2 …He who overcomes will not be hurt by the second death. ’”
Revelation 2:11
3 …To him who overcomes, I will give the hidden manna, and to him a white stone, with a new name written on it, which no one will know except the one who receives it. ’” Revelation 2:17
4 He who overcomes and keeps my commandments to the end, to him will I give authority over the nations; ... and to him I will give the morning star. Revelation 2:26,28
5 Whoever overcomes will be clothed in white, and I will not blot out his name from the book of life; but he will confess his name in the presence of my Father, and in the presence of all his angels. Revelation 3:5
