articles.content:
Peace to all brothers and sisters!

Today we continue to examine fellowship and share that Christians must wear the spiritual armor given by God every day

Lecture 4: Preaching the Gospel of Peace

Let’s open our Bibles to Ephesians 6:15 and read it together: “Having put on your feet the preparation for walking with the gospel of peace.”

1. Gospel

Question: What is the gospel?

Answer: Detailed explanation below

(1)Jesus said

Jesus said to them, "This is what I told you when I was with you: that everything must be fulfilled that is written about me in the Law of Moses, the Prophets, and the Psalms." So Jesus said Open their minds so that they can understand the Scriptures, and say to them: “It is written, that the Christ should suffer and rise from the dead on the third day, and that repentance and forgiveness of sins should be preached in his name. , spread from Jerusalem to all nations (Luke’s Gospel. 24:44-47 )

2. Peter said

Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ! According to his great mercy, he has given us new birth to a living hope through the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead to an inheritance incorruptible, undefiled, and unfading, reserved in heaven for you. …You have been born again, not of corruptible seed, but of incorruptible, through the living and abiding word of God. …but the word of the Lord endures forever. This is the gospel that was preached to you. (1 Peter 1:3-4,23,25)

3. John said

In the beginning there was the Tao, and the Tao was with God, and the Tao was God. This Word was with God in the beginning. (John 1:1-2)

Concerning the original word of life from the beginning, this is what we have heard, seen, seen with our own eyes, and touched with our hands. (This life has been manifested, and we have seen it, and now testify that we pass on to you the eternal life which was with the Father and was manifested in us.) (1 John 1:1-2)

4. Paul said

And you will be saved by this gospel, if you do not believe in vain but hold fast what I preach to you. For what I also delivered to you: first, that Christ died for our sins according to the Scriptures, that he was buried, and that he was raised up on the third day according to the Scriptures (1 Corinthians 15 :2-4)

2. The Gospel of Peace

(1)Give you rest

Come to me, all you who labor and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest. Take my yoke upon you and learn from me, for I am gentle and lowly in heart, and you will find rest for your souls. (Matthew 11:28-29)

(2) be healed

He hung on the tree and bore our sins personally so that, having died to sin, we might live to righteousness. By his stripes you were healed. (1 Peter 2:24)

(3) Get eternal life

“For God so loved the world that he gave his only begotten Son, that whoever believes in him shall not perish but have everlasting life. (John 3:16)

(4) be glorified

If they are children, then they are heirs, heirs of God and joint heirs with Christ. If we suffer with Him, we will also be glorified with Him.

(Romans 8:17)

3. Put on your feet with the gospel of peace as shoes to prepare you for walking

(1)The gospel is the power of God

I am not ashamed of the gospel; for it is the power of God for salvation to everyone who believes, to the Jew first and also to the Greek. For the righteousness of God is revealed in this gospel; this righteousness is by faith from faith to faith. As it is written: “The righteous shall live by faith.” (Romans 1:16-17)

(2) Jesus preached the gospel of the kingdom of heaven

Jesus traveled through every city and every village, teaching in their synagogues, preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing every disease and disease. When he saw the crowds, he had compassion on them, because they were wretched and helpless, like sheep without a shepherd. (Matthew 9:35-36 Union Version)

(3) Jesus sent workers to harvest the crops

So he said to his disciples, "The harvest is plentiful, but the workers are few. Therefore, ask the Lord of the harvest to send out workers into his harvest." (Matthew 9:37-38)

Don’t you say, ‘There are still four months until the harvest’? I tell you, lift up your eyes and look at the fields. The crops are ripe and ready for harvest. The reaper receives his wages and gathers grain for eternal life, so that the sower and the reaper may rejoice together. As the saying goes: ‘One sows, another reaps’, and this is obviously true. I have sent you to reap what you have not labored for; others have labored, and you enjoy the labor of others. ”(John 4:35-38)

articles.author: admin
articles.content:
Peace to all brothers and sisters!

Today we continue to examine fellowship and sharing. Christians must put on the spiritual armor given by God every day:

Lecture 3: Use righteousness as a breastplate to cover your breasts

Let’s open our Bible to Ephesians 6:14 and read it together: Stand firm therefore, girding your waist with the belt of truth, and covering your breast with the breastplate of righteousness;


1. Justice

Question: What is justice?
Answer: "Gong" means justice, fairness and integrity;

Bible interpretation! “Righteousness” refers to God’s righteousness!

2. Human righteousness

Question: Do people have "righteousness"?

Answer: No.

【There is no righteous person】

As it is written:
There is none righteous, not even one.
There is no understanding;
There is no one who seeks God;
They are all straying from the right path,
become useless together.
There is no one who does good, not even one.

(Romans 3:10-12)

【Everything humans do is evil】

Their throats are open graves;
They use their tongues to deceive,
The poisonous breath of adder is in his lips,
His mouth was full of curses and bitterness.
Killing and bleeding,
Their feet fly,
There will be cruelty and cruelty along the way.
The way of peace they have not known;
There is no fear of God in their eyes.

(Romans 3:13-18)

【Justified by faith】

(1)

Question: Noah was a righteous man!

Answer: Noah (believed in) the Lord, he did everything God commanded, so God called Noah a righteous man.

But Noah found favor in the sight of the Lord.
The descendants of Noah are recorded below. Noah was a righteous man and a perfect man in his generation. Noah walked with God. …That’s what Noah did. Whatever God commanded him, he did so.

(Genesis 6:8-9,22)

(2)

Question: Abraham was a righteous man!
Answer: Abraham (believed) in Jehovah, God justified him!
So he took him outside and said, "Look up to heaven and count the stars. Can you count them?" And he said to him, "So will your descendants be." Abram believed in the LORD, and the LORD followed this for his righteousness.

(Genesis 15:5-6)

(3)

Question: Was Job a righteous man?

Answer: Detailed explanation below

"Job"

1 Complete integrity:

There was a man named Job in the land of Uz. He was a perfect and upright man, a man who feared God and shunned evil. (Job 1:1)

2 The greatest among the Orientals:

His property consisted of seven thousand sheep, three thousand camels, five hundred pairs of oxen, five hundred she-donkeys, and many servants and maids. This man is the greatest among the people of the East. (Job 1:3)

3 Job calls himself righteous

I clothe myself with righteousness,
Wear justice as your robe and crown.
I am the eyes of the blind,
Lame feet.
I am a father to the poor;
I find out the case of someone I have never met.
…My glory increases in me;
My bow grows stronger in my hand. …I choose their paths, and I sit in the first place….

(Job 29:14-16,20,25)

Job once said: I am righteous, but God has taken away my justice; (Job 34:5)

Note: (Job’s repentance) Job 38 to 42, Jehovah answered Job’s argument. After Job listened to Jehovah’s words//

Then the LORD said to Job: Shall a arguer argue with the Almighty? Those who argue with God can answer these! …(Job) I am vile! What shall I answer you with? I had to cover my mouth with my hands. I said it once and I didn’t answer; I said it twice and I didn’t say it again. (Job 40:1-2,4-5)

Please listen to me, I want to speak; I ask you, please show me. I heard about you before,
See you now with my own eyes. Therefore I hate myself (or translation: my words) and repent in dust and ashes. (Job 42:4-6)

Later, the Lord favored Job, and the Lord later blessed him even more than before.

Therefore, Job’s righteousness was human righteousness (self-righteousness), and he was the greatest among the people of the East. "He said, "I went out to the city gate and set up a seat in the street. The young people saw me and avoided me, and the old people stood up. The princes stopped talking and covered their mouths with their hands. The leaders were silent and stuck their tongues to the roof of their mouths. He who hears me with his ears calls me blessed; he who sees me with his eyes praises me;

…my glory increases in my body; my bow grows stronger in my hand. When people hear me, they look up and wait silently for my guidance.

…I chose their ways, and I sat in the first place…(Job 29:7-11,20-21,25)

---And what did the Lord Jesus say? ---

“Woe to you when everyone says good things about you!…” (Luke 6:26).

Job claimed to be righteous and “righteous”, but disaster befell him and his family. Later, Job repented before the Lord! I heard about you before, but now I see you with my own eyes. Therefore I hate myself (or translation: my words), and repent in dust and ashes! Finally God blessed Job with more blessings than before.

3. God’s righteousness

Question: What is the righteousness of God?

Answer: Detailed explanation below

【God's righteousness】

Includes: love, kindness, holiness, loving mercy, slow to anger, not taking into account a wrong, kindness, joy, peace, longsuffering, kindness, goodness, faithfulness, gentleness, humility, self-control, uprightness, righteousness, light, righteousness The way is truth, life, light, healing, and salvation. He died for sinners, was buried, was resurrected on the third day, and ascended to heaven! Let people believe this gospel and be saved, resurrected, reborn, have life, and have eternal life. Amen!

My little children, I write these things to you so that you may not sin. If anyone sins, we have an advocate with the Father, Jesus Christ the righteous. (1 John 2:1)

4. Justice

Question: Who is righteous?

Answer: God is righteous! Amen.

He will judge the world with righteousness, and judge the peoples with uprightness. (Psalm 9:8)
Righteousness and justice are the foundation of your throne; love and truth go before you. (Psalm 89:14)
For the Lord is righteous and loves righteousness; the upright shall see his face. (Psalm 11:7)
The Lord has invented his salvation, and has shown his righteousness in the sight of the nations; (Psalm 98:2)
for he comes to judge the earth. He will judge the world with righteousness, and the peoples with justice. (Psalm 98:9)
The Lord executes justice and avenges all who are wronged. (Psalm 103:6)
The Lord is gracious and righteous; our God is merciful. (Psalm 116:5)
You are righteous, O Lord, and your judgments are upright! (Psalm 119:137)
The Lord is righteous in all his ways, and merciful in all his ways. (Psalm 145:17)
But the Lord Almighty is exalted for his justice; God the Holy One is sanctified for his righteousness. (Isaiah 5:16)
Since God is just, he will repay trouble to those who give you trouble (2 Thessalonians 1:6)

I looked and saw that the heavens were opened. There was a white horse, and his rider was called Faithful and True, who judges and makes war in righteousness. (Revelation 19:11)

5. Use righteousness as a breastplate to cover your breasts

Question: How to protect your heart with righteousness?

Answer: Detailed explanation below

It means putting off the old self, putting on the new self, and putting on Christ! Equip yourself daily with the righteousness of the Lord Jesus Christ, and preach the love of Jesus: God is love, kindness, holiness, loving mercy, slow to anger, not taking into account a wrong, love, joy, peace, longsuffering, kindness, goodness, Faithfulness, gentleness, humility, self-control, integrity, righteousness, light, the way, the truth, the life, the light of men, healing, and salvation. He died for sinners, was buried, was resurrected on the third day, and ascended to heaven for our justification! Sit at the right hand of the Almighty. Let people believe this gospel and be saved, resurrected, reborn, have life, and have eternal life. Amen!

6. Keep the Tao, keep the truth, and protect the heart

Question: How to uphold the true way and protect your heart?

Answer: Rely on the Holy Spirit and firmly adhere to the truth and good ways! This is to protect the heart, just like a mirror.

1 Guard your heart

You must guard your heart above all else.
Because the effects of life come from the heart.

(Proverbs 4:23 and)

2 Rely on the Holy Spirit to keep the good way

Keep the sound words which you have heard from me, with faith and love that is in Christ Jesus. You must guard the good ways entrusted to you by the Holy Spirit who lives in us.

(2 Timothy 1:13-14)

3 Anyone who hears the message but does not understand it

Whoever hears the word of the kingdom of heaven does not understand it, then the evil one comes and takes away what is sown in his heart; it is sown by the wayside. (Matthew 13:19)

So, do you understand?


7. Walk with God

The Lord has shown you, O man, what is good.
What does he want from you?
As long as you do justice and love mercy,
Walk humbly with your God.

(Micah 6:8)

8. 144,000 people followed Jesus

And I looked, and behold the Lamb standing on Mount Zion, and with him one hundred and forty-four thousand, having his name and the name of his Father written on their foreheads. … These people have not been tainted with women; they are virgins. They follow the Lamb wherever he goes. They were purchased from among men as firstfruits for God and for the Lamb. (Revelation 14:1,4)

Peace to all brothers and sisters!

Today we continue to examine traffic sharing

Lecture 2: Put on spiritual armor every day

Let’s open our Bible to Ephesians 6:13-14 and read them together:

Therefore, take up the whole armor of God, that you may be able to withstand the enemy in the day of trouble, and having done all, to stand. So stand firm, girding yourself with the truth...

1: Girdle your waist with truth

Question: What is truth?

Answer: Detailed explanation below

(1) The Holy Spirit is truth

The Holy Spirit is truth:

This is Jesus Christ who came by water and blood; not by water alone, but by water and blood, and bearing the witness of the Holy Spirit, for the Holy Spirit is truth. (1 John 5:6-7)

The Spirit of Truth:

"If you love me, you will keep my commandments. And I will ask the Father, and he will give you another Comforter (or Comforter; the same below), that he may be with you forever, who is the truth. The world cannot accept Him; for it neither sees Him nor knows Him, but you know Him, for He abides with you and will be in you (John 14:15-17).

(2) Jesus is the truth

What is truth?
Pilate asked him, "Are you a king?" Jesus answered, "You say that I am a king. For this I was born, and for this I came into the world, to bear witness to the truth. He who is true listens to my voice.” Pilate asked, “What is truth?”

(John 18:37-38)

Jesus is the truth:

Jesus said, “I am the way, the truth, and the life; no one comes to the Father except through me. (John 14:6)

(3) God is truth

The Word is God:

In the beginning there was the Tao, and the Tao was with God, and the Tao was God. This Word was with God in the beginning. (John 1:1-2)

God’s Word is truth:

They are not of the world, just as I am not of the world. Sanctify them in the truth; your word is truth. As you have sent me into the world, even so I have sent them into the world. For their sakes I sanctify myself, that they also may be sanctified through the truth.

(John 17:16-19)

Note: In the beginning there was the Tao, the Tao was with God, and the Tao was God! God is the Word, the Word of life (see 1 John 1:1-2). Your Word is truth, therefore, God is truth. Amen!

2: How to girdle your waist with truth?

Question: How to girdle your waist with truth?

Answer: Detailed explanation below

Note: Using the truth as a belt to girdle your waist, that is, God’s way, God’s truth, God’s words, and the inspiration of the Holy Spirit, are authoritative and powerful for God’s children and Christians! Amen.

(1) Rebirth
1 Born of water and the Spirit - John 3:5-7
2 Born from the faith of the gospel - 1 Corinthians 4:15, James 1:18

3 Born of God - John 1:12-13

(2) Put on the new self and put on Christ

Put on the new man:

And put on the new self, created in the image of God in true righteousness and holiness. (Ephesians 4:24)

Put on a new man. The new man is renewed in knowledge into the image of his Creator. (Colossians 3:10)

Put on Christ:

Therefore you are all sons of God through faith in Christ Jesus. As many of you as were baptized into Christ have put on Christ. (Galatians 3:26-27)

Always put on the Lord Jesus Christ and do not make arrangements for the flesh to fulfill its lusts. (Romans 13:14)

(3) Abide in Christ

The new man abides in Christ:

There is now no condemnation for those who are in Christ Jesus. (Romans 8:1 KJV)

Whoever abides in Him does not sin; whoever sins has neither seen Him nor known Him. (1 John 3:6 KJV)

(4) Confidence-I am no longer the one alive now

I have been crucified with Christ, and it is no longer I who live, but Christ lives in me; and the life I now live in the flesh I live by faith in the Son of God, who loved me and gave himself for me. (Galatians 2:20 KJV)

(5) The new man joins Christ and grows into an adult

To equip the saints for the work of ministry, and to build up the body of Christ, until we all come to the unity of the faith and the knowledge of the Son of God, to mature manhood, to the measure of the stature of the fullness of Christ,… only by Love speaks the truth and grows in all things into Him who is the Head, Christ, by whom the whole body is held together and fitted together, with every joint serving its purpose and supporting one another according to the function of each part, causing the body to grow and build itself up in love. (Ephesians 4:12-13,15-16 KJV)

(6) The "flesh" of the old man gradually deteriorates

If you have heard his word, received his instruction, and learned his truth, then you must put off your old self, which is your old self, which is corrupting through the deceitfulness of its lusts. (Ephesians 4:21-22 Union Version)

(7) The new man “spiritual man” is renewed day by day in Christ

Therefore, we do not lose heart. Although the outer body is being destroyed, yet the inner body is being renewed day by day. Our light and momentary sufferings will work for us an eternal weight of glory beyond compare. It turns out that we care not about what is seen, but about what is unseen; for what is seen is temporary, but what is unseen is eternal. (2 Corinthians 4:16-18 KJV)

That your faith may not rest on the wisdom of men but on the power of God. (1 Corinthians 2:5 KJV)

Note:

Paul is for the word of God and the gospel! In the flesh, he experienced tribulations and chains in the world. When he was imprisoned in Philippi, he saw the soldier jailer wearing full armor. He was inspired by the Holy Spirit! So he wrote a letter to all the saints in Ephesus. Christians have spiritual blessings. They rely on the power of God and are good soldiers of Christ. They must put on the whole armor of God.

Take heed to yourselves, and do not act as fools, but as wise. Make the most of the time, for these days are evil. Don’t be a fool, but understand what the Lord’s will is. Reference Ephesians 5:15-17

Three: Christians as soldiers of Christ

Wear what God has given you every day

-Spiritual Armor:

Especially when Christians are physically experiencing trials, tribulations, and tribulations; when Satan’s messengers in the world are attacking Christians’ bodies, Christians must get up every morning, put on the full spiritual armor given by God, and use the truth as their belt. Girdle your loins and get ready for a day's work.

(As Paul said) I have one final word: Be strong in the Lord and in His power. Put on the whole armor of God, so that you can stand against the devil's schemes. For we do not wrestle against flesh and blood, but against principalities, against powers, against the rulers of the darkness of this world, against spiritual wickedness in high places. Therefore, take up the whole armor of God, that you may be able to withstand the enemy in the day of trouble, and having done all, to stand. Therefore stand firm, girding yourself with the belt of truth…(Ephesians 6:10-14 KJV)

articles.title: love
articles.author: admin
articles.content:
---How to distinguish between love and adultery---

Today we will examine fellowship sharing: love and adultery

Let’s open the Bible to Genesis Chapter 2, verses 23-25, and read together:
The man said: This is bone of my bones and flesh of my flesh. You can call her woman because she was taken from man.

Therefore a man will leave his father and mother and cleave to his wife, and the two will become one flesh. The couple were naked at the time and were not ashamed.

1. Love

Question: What is love?

Answer: Detailed explanation below

(1)The love between Adam and Eve

--The couple were naked and not ashamed--

1 Adam said to Eve, "This is bone of my bones and flesh of my flesh, let me call you woman"!
"Women" are the most beautiful gifts given by God to men, they are truth, kindness and beauty! It is a compliment, a companion, a comfort, and a helper!
2 A man will leave his parents;
3 Join your wife,
4 The two become one.

5 The man and his wife were naked, and they were not ashamed.

[Note] Adam and Eve were in the Garden of Eden, their hearts were pure, holy, true love, truth, goodness and beauty! Therefore, the husband and wife are naked and have no shame. This is love that has not yet entered human beings.)

(2)The love between Isaac and Rebekah

So Isaac brought Rebekah into the tent of Sarah his mother, and took her to be his wife, and loved her. Isaac found comfort now that his mother was gone. Genesis 24:67

[Note] Isaac typifies Christ, and Rebekah typifies the church! Isaac married Rebekah and loved her! That is, Christ marries the church and loves the church.

(3)The love of Song of Songs

【Beloved Man and Couple】

"Beloved" typifies Christ,
"Best Couple":
1 typifies the chaste virgin-2 Corinthians 11:2, Revelation 14:4;
2 typifies the church-Ephesians 5:32;

3 typifies the bride of Christ - Revelation 19:7.

I am the rose of Sharon and the lily of the valley.
My beloved is among women, as a lily among thorns.
My beloved is among men as an apple tree is among the trees.
I sat under his shadow with joy and tasted his fruit,

It feels sweet. He brings me into the banquet hall and sets love as his banner over me. Song of Songs 2:1-4

Please place me on your heart like a seal and carry me on your arm like a stamp.

For love is strong as death, jealousy is cruel as hell; its lightning is the lightning of fire, the blazing flame of the Lord. Love cannot be extinguished by many waters, nor can it be drowned by floods. If anyone exchanges all the treasures in his family for love, he will be despised. Song of Songs 8:6-7

2. Adultery

Question: What is adultery and adultery?

Answer: Detailed explanation below

(1) According to the reborn holy spirit of faith:

1 Friends of the world--refer to James 4:4
2 The church united with the kings of the earth--Refer to Revelation 17:2

3. Those who are based on the law--refer to Romans 7:1-3, Gal. 3:10

(2) According to the commandments of the ordinances of the flesh:

1 You shall not commit adultery--Exodus 20:14
2 Whoever divorces his wife and marries another commits adultery; and whoever marries a divorced wife commits adultery. ” Luke 16:18

3 Whoever looks at a woman lustfully has already committed adultery with her in his heart - Matthew 5:27-28

3. How to distinguish between love and adultery

Question: How do Christians identify love?

Answer: A marriage coordinated by God is love!

1 A person wants to leave his parents,
2 Be united with your wife,
3 The two become one,
4 It is God’s cooperation,
5 Let no one be separated--Refer to Matthew 19:4-6
6 They were both naked,

7 Not ashamed--Refer to Genesis 2:24

Question: How do Christians identify adultery?

Answer: Any lust "outside" God's coordinated marriage is committing adultery.

(Example:) Genesis 6:2 When the sons of God saw the daughters of men who were beautiful, they took them as wives of their own choosing.

(Note:) Seeing the beauty of a man’s daughter (the lust of the flesh, the lust of the eyes), he chooses at will (and the pride of this life) and takes her as his wife (neither comes from the Father “God”) → It is not a marriage coordinated by God . Reference James 2:16
Genesis 3-4 (not) God cooperates with human women to have children → "great men, heroic and famous people" → "heroes, idols, arrogant, proud" who like to be "kings" and have people worship or worship them object.
And the LORD saw that the wickedness of man was great in the earth, and that all the thoughts of his thoughts were only evil continually, Genesis 6:5

4. Behavior and characteristics of (love, adultery)

Question: What actions are love? Are those acts committing adultery?

Answer: Detailed explanation below

(1) Husband and wife

1 The marriage of God’s cooperation

A man will leave his parents and cleave to his wife, and the two will become one flesh! A marriage joined by God cannot be separated by man. For example, a husband misses his wife or a wife misses her husband. The two are naked and "united" without shame → this is love. Please refer to 1 Corinthians 7:3-4.
Example: Adam and Eve - refer to Genesis 2:18-24
Example: Abraham and Sarah - refer to Genesis 12:1-5

Example: Isaac and Rebekah - refer to Genesis 24:67

2 A marriage blessed by God

Example: Noah and his family - refer to Genesis 6:18
Example: Jacob was loved by God, and his two wives and two maids gave birth to the twelve tribes of Israel. This was a marriage blessed by God!

Example: Ruth and Boaz – Reference Luke: 4:13

3 It is not a marriage coordinated by God

For example, if Abraham takes a concubine and sleeps with Hagar, Abraham will feel "ashamed" in his heart because he is unworthy of his wife Sarah! Therefore, it is a marriage that is not pleasing to God. In the end, most of the descendants of Hagar who "begot" Ishmael deviated from God's ways and abandoned God.

4 God does not look at human behavior

Example: Tamash and Judah

The behavior of Tamar, the daughter-in-law, and her father-in-law was considered a sin of "fornication" according to the laws of the flesh. However, God did not consider Tamar's behavior. He only considered her faith in God and her faith in bearing a son for the house of Judah. God declared her righteous. She is listed in Jesus’ genealogy. Refer to Genesis 38:24-26, Matthew 1:3 and Deuteronomy 22 "The Ordinance of Chastity"

Example: Lahab and Salmon--Matthew 1:5

Example: David and Bathsheba

David committed "adultery and borrowing a sword to kill." After David was disciplined by God, he gave birth to Solomon. God loved Solomon. And because David loved God wholeheartedly and followed God’s will in everything (leading the Israelites to trust God), he was called a man after God’s own heart. See Acts 13:22 and 2 Samuel 11-12.

(2) Unmarried men and women

"Boys and girls" refers to unmarried men and women. Boys and girls fall in love with each other and want to start a family. This is the beginning of love. If you have lustful thoughts with the other person in your heart, you are committing adultery.

As the Lord Jesus said: But I say to you, whoever looks at a woman lustfully has already committed adultery with her in his heart. Matthew 5:28

(3) Widows. Divorce and marriage issues

I say to you, whoever divorces his wife, except for sexual immorality, commits adultery, and whoever marries a woman who has been divorced commits adultery. ” Matthew 19:9

[As Paul’s own opinion]

1 To the unmarried and the widows

If you can't help it, you can get married. Instead of burning with desire, it would be better to get married. 1 Corinthians 7:9

2 If your husband dies, you can remarry

articles.title: Know Your Only True God
articles.author: admin
articles.content:
Peace to all brothers and sisters!

Today we examine the fellowship and share "Knowing the True God"

Let’s open the Bible to John 17:3, turn it over and read together:

This is eternal life: to know you, the only true God, and Jesus Christ, whom you have sent.

1. Know your only true God

Question: What is the name of the one true God?

Answer: Jehovah is his name!

So the only true God, His name is Jehovah! Amen.

Just like Moses said: What is your name?

God said to Moses: "I am I am"... God also said to Moses: "Thus you shall say to the children of Israel: 'The Lord, the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob. God has sent me to you. 'The LORD is my name forever, and this is my memorial to all generations.' Exodus 3:14-15

Question: Know your only true God, since you are the only true God!
Why do people in the world worship many idols, false gods, and ghosts? Such as Sakyamuni Buddha, Guanyin Bodhisattva, Muhammad, Mazu, Wong Tai Sin, the door god at home, the god of wealth, the social root god in the village, Bodhisattva, etc., and there are many unknown gods?

Answer: Because the world is ignorant and does not know the true God.

As Paul said in the Acts of the Apostles: "As I was walking around, I saw what you worship, and I came across an altar with the inscription 'Unknown God' on it. Now I tell you what you worship that you do not know. Create the universe and all things in it God, who is the Lord of heaven and earth, does not dwell in temples made with human hands, nor is he served by human hands, as if he needed anything; but he himself gives to everyone life and breath and all things. blood) to create all nations of mankind to inhabit the entire earth, and he also predetermined their times and the boundaries of where they would live, so that they would seek God may be understood, but he is not far from each of us; our life, movement, and existence all depend on him. Just like you poets, some people say: "We are also born of him." Since we are God's children. Those who are born should not think that the divinity of God is like gold, silver, or stone carved by human craftsmanship and thought. When the world is ignorant, God does not watch, but now he commands everyone everywhere to repent, for he has appointed a day in which he will judge the world in righteousness by the man whom he has appointed, and he will give trust to all men by raising him from the dead. Evidence.” Acts 17:23-31.

2. There is no god except Jehovah

Question: Is there any other god besides the one true God?

Answer: I am the LORD, and there is no other god before me; there is no god before me. Even though you don’t know me, I will girdle your loins (that is, girdle your loins with truth, and know the truth so that you can know the true God).

From where the sun rises to where it sets, let everyone know that there is no other god but me. I am the LORD; there is no other god before me. Isaiah 45:5-6

【Whoever believes in the LORD will be saved】

You shall state and present your reasonings, and let them consult among themselves. Who pointed it out from ancient times? Who told it from ancient times? Am I not the LORD? There is no God but me; I am the righteous God and the Saviour; there is no other god but me. Look to me, all the ends of the earth, and you will be saved; for I am God, and there is no other. Isaiah 45:21-22

3. The only true God has three persons

(1)Father, Son, Holy Spirit

Jesus came to them and said to them, "All authority has been given to me in heaven and on earth. So go and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit." baptize them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit) and teach them to obey everything I have commanded you, and I am with you always, even to the end of the age.” Matthew 28:18-20

(2)The names of the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit

Question: In the name of the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit! Is it the name of God? Or a title?

Answer: "Father, Son" is a title, not a name! For example, your father is what you call him. "Father" is not a given name. Your father's name is Li XX, Zhang XX, etc. So, do you understand?

Question: What are the names of the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit?

Answer: Detailed explanation below

1 The name of the Father: Jehovah the Father--Exodus 3:15
2 The name of the Son: Jehovah the Son! The Word became flesh and was called Jesus! Refer to Matthew 12:21, Luke 1:30-31

3 The name of the Holy Spirit: also called Comforter or Anointing--John 14:16, 1 John 2:27

(3) The only true God has three persons

Question: Father, Son, Holy Spirit! How many gods are there like this?

Answer: There is only one God, the only true God!

But we have one God, the Father, from whom are all things and to whom are we; and one Lord, Jesus Christ, through whom are all things and we through him. 1 Corinthians 8:6

Question: What are the three persons?

Answer: Detailed explanation below

1 The Holy Spirit is one
There are varieties of gifts, but the same Spirit. 1 Corinthians 12:4
2 But there is one Lord, the Lord Jesus Christ!
There are different ministries, but the Lord is the same. 1 Corinthians 12:5
3 God is one

There are diversities of functions, but it is the same God who works all things in all. 1 Corinthians 12:6

Question: The Holy Spirit is one, the Lord is one, and God is one! Isn’t this three gods? Or a god?

Answer: "God" is a God, the only true God!

The one true God has three persons: one Holy Spirit, one Lord, and one God! Amen.

(Just as) there is one body and one Spirit, just as you were called to one hope. One Lord, one faith, one baptism, one God and Father of all, over all, through all, and in all. Ephesians 4:4-6

So, do you understand?

Okay, let’s share the fellowship here today!

Let us pray to God together: Thank you Abba Heavenly Father, our Lord Jesus Christ, and thank the Holy Spirit for opening our spiritual eyes to see and hear spiritual truth! This is eternal life, to know you, the only true God, and Jesus Christ, whom you have sent! Amen

In the name of the Lord Jesus! Amen

articles.title: Walk in the Spirit 2
articles.author: admin
articles.content:
Peace to all brothers and sisters!

Today we continue to examine, traffic, and share!

Lecture 2: How Christians Deal with Sin

Let’s open the Bible to Galatians 5:25 and read it together: If we live by the Spirit, we must also walk by the Spirit.

Turn again to Romans 8:13. If you live according to the flesh, you will die; but if by the Spirit you put to death the deeds of the body, you will live.

Question: What! What to do about the transgressions of the flesh? Don’t we need to worry about them?

Answer: Detailed explanation below

1 Not imputing their (old man’s) trespasses to them (the new man), but having entrusted to us the message of reconciliation--Refer to 2 Corinthians 5:19
2 If we live by the Spirit, we must also walk by the Spirit - Reference Gal 5:25
3 Put to death the deeds of the body by the Holy Spirit--Refer to Romans 8:13
4 Mortify your members that are on earth - refer to Colossians 3:5
5 We (the old man) were crucified with Christ, and it is no longer I who live--Refer to Gal 2:20
6 Consider yourselves (old man) dead to sin - See Romans 6:11
7 Whoever hates his (old man’s sinful) life in this world must preserve his (new man) life for everlasting life. Reference about 12:25

8 Code of Conduct for New Believers--Refer to Ephesians 4:25-32

[Old Testament] Therefore, in the Old Testament, there were laws and regulations, but no one was justified before God by the law. This is obvious. Therefore, Paul said that if you rely on these regulations to control the flesh, Lust has no effect whatsoever--Refer to Colossians 2:20-23

Question: Why is it ineffective?

Answer: For everyone who works by the law is under a curse... No one is justified before God by the law. This is obvious - refer to Galatians 3:10-11;

[New Testament] In the New Testament, you are also dead to the law through the body of Christ...and are now free from the law - refer to Romans 7:4,6! Since you have been freed from the law, you are now born again Christians have the presence of the Holy Spirit! If we live by the Holy Spirit, we should also walk by the Holy Spirit - see Galatians 5:25. That is to say, we should rely on the Holy Spirit to put to death all the evil deeds of the fleshly desires, hate the sinful life of the (old man), and preserve the (new man) to eternal life! (New man) By the Holy Spirit produce: love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faithfulness, gentleness, self-control! The fruits of the Holy Spirit! Amen. Galatians 5:22-23. So, do you understand?

9. Put the treasure in the earthen vessel

We have this treasure in earthen vessels to show that this great power comes from God and not from us. 2 Corinthians 4:7

Question: What is baby?

Answer: The "treasure" is the Holy Spirit of truth - refer to John 15:26-27

Question: What is an earthen vessel?

Answer: "Earthen vessel" means that God wants to use you as a precious vessel - refer to 2 Timothy 2:20-21! The treasure placed in the earthen vessel is the Holy Spirit placed on our regenerated new man.

Question: Why? Sometimes we fail to demonstrate the power of the Holy Spirit?

Such as: healing diseases, casting out demons, performing miracles, speaking in tongues...etc.!

Answer: This great power comes from God, not from us.

For example: When Christians first believed in Jesus, they would personally experience many visions and dreams, and many wonderful things would happen around them. But now it gradually appears less often or even disappears? The reason is that after we believed in Jesus, our hearts followed the flesh, cared about the things of the flesh, and followed the world. It was full of thorns, and we were unable to show the power of the Holy Spirit.

10. Death activates in us to reveal the life of Jesus

We always carry the death of Jesus with us so that the life of Jesus may also be revealed in us. ...In this way, death is at work in us, but life is at work in you. 2 Corinthians 4:10,12

Question: What is initiating death?

Answer: The death of Jesus is activated in us! How did Jesus die? Jesus saved us from sin and died on the cross for our sins. If we have been united with Him in the likeness of His death, we shall also be united with Him in the likeness of His resurrection - See Romans 6:5. Being united to Him in the likeness of death means that death is active in us and we always carry the spirit of Jesus with us. Die! Take up your cross and be the way of the Lord. If you lose your old life for the gospel, you will gain the life of Jesus - refer to Mark 8:34-35. If you have the life of Jesus, you can reveal the life of Jesus! The life of the Holy Spirit Power is witnessing the life of Jesus! Amen.

"Before that day", everyone must die once, and everyone in the world will experience physical "birth, old age, sickness and death" and even die due to other things; but Christians should pray more to the Lord Jesus and not let their physical body "birth, old age". .Sickness.Death", let alone being tortured by the "disease" and dying of physical pain, dying in the hospital, or dying on the hospital bed; We should pray to the Lord Jesus to cause His death to be activated in our old man. We should be willing to take up our cross, follow Jesus, lose our old life for the truth and the gospel, and experience death with Christ! Perhaps when you are old, the best wish is to die physically in your sleep or to die naturally and peacefully in your sleep.

11. The old man gradually becomes bad, and the new man gradually grows up

Therefore, we do not lose heart. Although the outer body is being destroyed, yet the inner body is being renewed day by day. 2 Corinthians 4:16

Note:

(Old man) The "outer body" is the visible body from the outside. Although it is destroyed, this old man's flesh gradually becomes bad due to the deceitfulness of lusts - refer to Ephesians 4:22

(New Man) What is raised with Christ is the spiritual body - refer to 1 Corinthians 15:44; your life is hid with Christ in God - refer to Colossians 3:3; according to what is in me (original text: "man" ") - Reference Romans 7:22.

→→The invisible (new man) born of God, joined to Christ, gradually grows into a man, fulfilling the stature of the full stature of Christ - refer to Ephesians 4:12-13

Therefore, we do not lose heart. Although the outer body (the old man's flesh) is destroyed, the inner body (the reborn new man) is being renewed day by day and "grows into a man." Our temporary and light sufferings (putting off the sufferings of the old man) will accomplish for us (the new man) an incomparable and eternal weight of glory. It turns out that we do not care about what we see (the old man), but we care about what we do not see (the new man); because what we see (the old man) is temporary, but what we do not see (the new man) is eternal. Refer to 2 Corinthians 4:16-18. Do you understand this?

12. Christ appears, and the new man appears and enters eternal life

When Christ, who is our life, appears, you also will appear with him in glory. Colossians 3:4

1 Dear brothers, we are children of God now, and what we will be in the future has not yet been revealed; but we know that when the Lord appears, we will be like him, because we will see him as he is. 1 John 3:2
2 But as for those who have fallen asleep in Christ, God will also bring them with Jesus - for - refer to 1 Thessalonians 4:13-14
3 For those who are alive and remain, in a moment, in the blink of an eye, the corruptible flesh is "transformed" into the incorruptible spiritual body - refer to 1 Corinthians 15:52
4 His lowly body was transfigured to become like his own glorious body--Refer to Philippians 3:21
5 He will be caught up with them in the clouds to meet the Lord in the air - refer to 1 Thessalonians 4:17
6 When Christ appears, we also will appear with Him in glory--Refer to Colossians 3:4
7 May the God of peace sanctify you completely! And may your spirit, soul, and body be preserved blameless at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ! He who calls you is faithful and will do it. Reference 1 Thessalonians 5:23-24

articles.title: Walk in the Spirit 1
articles.author: admin
articles.content:
Peace to all brothers and sisters!

Today we will examine traffic sharing together

Lecture 1: How Christians Deal with Sin

Let’s turn to Romans 6:11 in our Bible and read it together: So you also must consider yourselves dead to sin, but alive to God in Christ Jesus.

1. Why do people die?

Question: Why do people die?
Answer: People die because of "sin".

For the wages of sin is death; but the gift of God is eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord. Romans 6:23

Question: Where does our "sin" come from?
Answer: It comes from the first ancestor Adam.

Just as sin entered the world through one man, and death came through sin, so death came to all because all have sinned. Romans 5:12

2. Definition of "crime"

(1) sin

Question: What is sin?
Answer: Breaking the law is sin.

Whoever sins breaks the law; breaking the law is sin. 1 John 3:4

(2) Sins unto death and sins (not) unto death

If anyone sees his brother committing a sin that does not lead to death, he should pray for him, and God will give him life; but if there is a sin that leads to death, I do not say that he should pray for him. All unrighteousness is sin, and there are sins that do not lead to death. 1 John 5:16-17

Question: What is the sin leading to death?

Answer: God makes a covenant with man! If a man "breaks the covenant," the sin is a sin leading to death.

like:

1 Adam’s sin of breach of contract in the Garden of Eden--Refer to Genesis 2:17
2 God made a covenant with the Israelites (if anyone breaks the covenant, it will be a sin) - refer to Exodus 20:1-17

3 The sin of not believing in the New Testament! --Refer to Luke 22:19-20 and John 3:16-18.

Question: What is a sin "not" leading to death?

Answer: The transgressions of the flesh!

Question: Why are the transgressions of the flesh (not) sins leading to death?

Answer: Because you are already dead - refer to Colossians 3:3;

Our old human flesh was crucified with Christ with its passions and desires - refer to Gal 5:24; the body of sin was destroyed so that we would no longer be slaves to sin - refer to Romans 6:6;

If the Spirit of God lives in you, you are not carnal - see Romans 8:9;

Now it is no longer I who live, but Christ who lives in me - Reference Gal 2:20.

God and Us【New Testament】

Then he said: I will remember their sins and their transgressions no more. Now that these sins have been forgiven, there are no more sacrifices for sin. Hebrews 10:17-18! Do you understand this?

3. Escape from death

Question: How does one escape from death?

Answer: Because the wages of sin is death - refer to Romans 6:23

(If you want to be free from death, you must be free from sin; if you want to be free from sin, you must be free from the power of the law.)

Die! Where is your power to overcome?
Die! Where is your sting?

The sting of death is sin, and the power of sin is the law. 1 Corinthians 15:55-56

4. Escape from the power of the law

Question: How to escape from the power of the law?

Answer: Detailed explanation below

1 Free from the law

So, my brethren, you also died to the law through the body of Christ, so that you might belong to others, even to him who was raised from the dead, that we might bear fruit to God. …But since we died to the law that bound us, we are now free from the law, so that we may serve the Lord according to the newness of spirit (spirit: or translated as the Holy Spirit) and not according to the old way of ceremony. . Romans 7:4,6

2 Freedom from the Curse of the Law

Christ redeemed us from the curse of the law by becoming the curse for us; for it is written, “Cursed is everyone who hangs on a tree.” Galatians 3 :13

3 Delivered from the law of sin and death

There is now no condemnation for those who are in Christ Jesus. For the law of the Spirit of life in Christ Jesus has made me free from the law of sin and death. Romans 8:1-2

5. Rebirth

Question: What do you believe in rebirth?

Answer: (Believe) the gospel is reborn!

Question: What is the gospel?

Answer: What I also passed on to you was: First, that Christ died for our sins according to the Scriptures, that he was buried, and that he was raised up on the third day according to the Scriptures. 1 Corinthians 15:3-4

Question: How did the resurrection of Jesus give birth to us?

Answer: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ! According to his great mercy, he has given us new birth to a living hope through the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead to an inheritance incorruptible, undefiled, and unfading, reserved in heaven for you. You who are kept by the power of God through faith will receive the salvation prepared to be revealed in the last time. 1 Peter 1:3-5

Question: How are we reborn?

Answer: Detailed explanation below

1 Born of water and the Spirit--Refer to John 3:5-8
2 Born from the truth of the gospel--refer to 1 Corinthians 4:15; James 1:18

3 Born of God--refer to John 1:12-13; 1 John 3:9

6. Break away from the old man and his behavior

Question: How to get rid of the old man and his behaviors?

Answer: For if we have been united with him in the likeness of his death, we shall also be united with him in the likeness of his resurrection, knowing that our old man was crucified with him, that the body of sin might be destroyed, that we might no longer work sin Servant; Romans 6:5-6

Note: We died, were buried, and were resurrected with Christ! Jesus rose from the dead and reborn us! In this way, the reborn (new man) has been separated from the (old man) and the behavior of the old man. Reference Colossians 3:9

7. The new man (does not belong to) the old man

Question: What is the old man?

Answer: All flesh that comes from the roots of Adam’s flesh belongs to the old man.

Question: What is a newcomer?

Answer: All members born from the last Adam (Jesus) are new people! Amen

1 Born of water and the Spirit--Refer to John 3:5-8
2 Born from the truth of the gospel--refer to 1 Corinthians 4:15; James 1:18

3 Born of God--refer to John 1:12-13; 1 John 3:9

Question: Why does the new man (not belong to) the old man?

Answer: If the Spirit of God (i.e. the Holy Spirit, the Spirit of Jesus, the Spirit of the Heavenly Father) dwells in you, you are no longer of the flesh (the old man of Adam), but the (new man) is of the Holy Spirit (that is, of the Holy Spirit, but of the Christ belongs to God the Father). If anyone does not have the Spirit of Christ, he does not belong to Christ. Refer to Romans 8:9. Do you understand this?

8. The Holy Spirit and the Flesh

1 body

Question: Who does the body belong to?

Answer: The flesh belongs to the old man and has been sold to sin.

We know that the law is of the spirit, but I am of the flesh and have been sold to sin. Romans 7:14

2 Holy Spirit

Question: Where does the Holy Spirit come from?
Answer: From God the Father! The new man belongs to the Holy Spirit

But when the Helper comes, whom I will send from the Father, the Spirit of truth, who proceeds from the Father, he will testify about me. John 15:26

3 The conflict between the Holy Spirit and the lust of the flesh

For the flesh lusteth against the Spirit, and the Spirit lusteth against the flesh: these two are opposed to each other, so that you cannot do what you wish to do. Galatians 5:17

Question: What are the lusts of the old man’s flesh?
Answer: The works of the flesh are obvious: adultery, impurity, licentiousness, idolatry, sorcery, hatred, strife, jealousy, fits of rage, factions, dissensions, heresies, and envy. words), drunkenness, carousing, etc. I told you before and I tell you now that those who do such things will not inherit the kingdom of God. Galatians 5:19-21

4 The new man delights in the law of God; the old man obeys the law of sin

Because according to the inner meaning (the original text is man) (that is, the regenerated new man), (the new man), I like the law of God; but I feel that there is another law in my body that is warring with the law in my heart and takes me captive. Make me conform to the law of sin in the members. I am so miserable! Who can save me from this body of death? Thank God, we can escape through our Lord Jesus Christ. In this way, I obey the law of God with my heart (new man), but my flesh (old man) obeys the law of sin. Romans 7:22-25

Question: What is God’s law?

Answer: "The law of God" is the law of the Holy Spirit, the law of release, and the fruit of the Holy Spirit - refer to Romans 8:2; the law of Christ - refer to Gal 6:2; the law of love - refer to Romans 13:10, Matthew 22:37-40 and 1 John 4:16;

Whoever is born of God does not sin - refer to 1 John 3:9. "The law of God" is the law of love. The love of Jesus regenerates you, and whoever is born of God does not sin! In this way, not sinning → is the law of God! Anyone who is born of God will not break the law and sin. Do you understand?

(If there is the presence of the Holy Spirit, regenerated believers will understand as soon as they hear it, because as soon as God’s words are revealed, they will emit light and make fools understand. Otherwise, some people will not understand even if their lips are dry. Is this why? The same is true for some "pastors or evangelists". Their hearts are greasy, their ears are heavy, their eyes deliberately cannot see, and their ears do not want to hear. They are deceived by "sin", their hearts become hardened, and they become stubborn and stubborn. )

Question: What is the law of sin?

Answer: He who breaks the law and does unrighteous things → He who breaks the law and commits sin is the law of sin. Reference John 1 3:4

Question: What is the law of death?

Answer: Detailed explanation below - Romans 8:2

#. .In the day you eat of it you will surely die--Genesis 2:17
# ..For the wages of sin is death--Romans 6:23
# ..If you do not believe that Jesus is the Christ, you will die in your sins - John 8:24
# ..Unless you repent, you will all likewise perish!--Luke 13:5

Therefore, if you do not repent → do not believe that Jesus is the Christ, do not believe in the gospel, and do not believe in the "New Testament"! You will all perish → this is the "law of death". Do you understand?

4 Sins of the Old Man’s Flesh

Question: The old man’s flesh obeyed the law of sin. If he sinned, do he have to confess his sins?

Answer: Detailed explanation below

[John said: ] If we say that we (the old self) are sinless, we deceive ourselves, and the truth is not in us. If we confess our sins, God is faithful and just and will forgive us our sins and cleanse us from all unrighteousness. If we say that we (the old man) have not sinned, we regard God as a liar, and His word is not in us. 1 John 1:8-10

[Paul said: ] For we know that our old man was crucified with him, that the body of sin might be destroyed, so that we (the new man) should no longer be slaves to sin. Romans 6:6; Brothers, it seems that we (the new man) are not debtors to the flesh to live according to the flesh. Romans 8:12

[John said] Whoever is born of God does not sin, because the word of God abides in him; nor can he sin, because (the new man) he is born of God. 1 John 3:9

【Note:】

Many people mistakenly think that these two passages in 1 John 1:8-10 and 3:9 are contradictory. In fact, they are not contradictory. What John said is correct.

The "former" is for those who are not regenerated and have not believed in Jesus; while the "latter" is for those who believe in Jesus and have been regenerated (new people); and James 5:16 "Confess your sins to one another" is for those who believe in Jesus. The twelve tribes of Israel lived in 1:1.

And Paul was well versed in the law and said, "What was gain at first is now considered loss for the sake of Christ - refer to Philippians 3:5-7; Paul received a great revelation (the new man) and was caught up by God to the third heaven, "the paradise of God" -Refer to 2 Corinthians 12:1-4,

And only the letters written by Paul: 1 If the Spirit of God dwells in you, you are not in the flesh." 2 The Holy Spirit lusts against the flesh. 3 "The old man is carnal and the new man is spiritual." 4 Flesh and blood cannot bear it. Kingdom of God, 5 The Lord Jesus also said that the flesh profiteth nothing. Therefore the wisdom which God gave him (Paul) wrote to you.

Because the regenerated (new man) obeys the law of God and does not sin; while the flesh (old man) has been sold to sin, but obeys the law of sin. If the Spirit of God dwells in you, you are not of the flesh - refer to Romans 8:9. That is, the (new man) does not belong to the flesh (the old man), and the (new man) does not owe any debt to the flesh (i.e., sin debt), to obey The flesh lives - see Romans 8:12.

In this way, the regenerated new man no longer "confesses" the sins of the old man's flesh. If you say you want to confess, a problem arises, because the flesh (old man) obeys the law of sin every day, and those who break the law and commit sins are guilty of "sin." You will ask the precious blood of the Lord "many times" to blot out and cleanse your sins. When you behave in this way, you will treat the blood of Jesus' sanctifying covenant as "normal" and despise the Holy Spirit of grace. --Reference Hebrews 10:29,14! Therefore, Christians should not be foolish, nor should they grieve the Holy Spirit of God. They should be especially alert, careful, and discerning regarding matters concerning the "covenant of life and death."

Question: I believe that my old man was crucified with Christ and the body of sin was destroyed. I am no longer the one who lives now. But now my old man is still alive in the flesh! I can still walk, work, eat, drink, sleep, and get married and have a family. Child! What about the young flesh? What about the young? The old can still do it, but the flesh sometimes gets sick! (For marriage issues, please refer to 1 Corinthians 7) I also know that the flesh has been sold to sin (Romans 7:14) , living in the flesh still likes to obey the law of sin and violate the law and commit sins. In this case, what should we do about the transgressions of our old human flesh? Shouldn’t we just ignore them?

articles.author: admin
articles.content:
Peace, brothers and sisters!

Let’s search, fellowship, and share together today! Bible Ephesians:

Preface scripture!

spiritual blessings

1: Obtain sonship

Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ! He has blessed us with every spiritual blessing in the heavenly places in Christ: just as God chose us in Him before the foundation of the world to be holy and blameless before Him; because of His love for us He chose us in Him He predestined us to adoption as sons through Jesus Christ, according to the good pleasure of his will (Ephesians 1:3-5)

2: God’s grace

We have redemption through the blood of this beloved Son, the forgiveness of our sins, according to the riches of his grace. This grace is given to us abundantly by God in all wisdom and understanding; it is all according to His own good pleasure, which He has predestined to make known to us the mystery of His will, so that in the fullness of time He may make heavenly things according to His plan. , everything on earth is united in Christ. In him we also have an inheritance, having been predestined according to the purpose of him who works out all things according to the counsel of his will, so that through us, who were first in Christ, we may receive his glory. He who hopes will be praised. (Ephesians 1:7-12)

Three: Being sealed by the promised Holy Spirit

In Him you were sealed with the Holy Spirit of promise, when you also believed in Christ when you heard the word of truth, the gospel of your salvation. This Holy Spirit is the pledge (original text: inheritance) of our inheritance until God’s people (original text: inheritance) are redeemed to the praise of His glory. (Ephesians 1:13-14)

Four: Die with Christ, resurrect with Christ, and be in heaven with Him


You were dead in your trespasses and sins, and he made you alive. In which you walked according to the course of this world, in obedience to the prince of the power of the air, the spirit which now works in the sons of disobedience. We were all among them, indulging the lusts of the flesh, following the desires of the flesh and the heart, and by nature were children of wrath, just like everyone else. However, God, who is rich in mercy and loves us with great love, makes us alive with Christ even when we were dead in our trespasses. It is by grace you have been saved. He also raised us up and seated us with us in the heavenly places in Christ Jesus (Ephesians 2:1-6)

I have final words: Be strong in the Lord and in His power. Put on the whole armor of God, so that you can stand against the devil's schemes. For we do not wrestle against flesh and blood, but against principalities, against powers, against the rulers of the darkness of this world, against spiritual wickedness in high places. Therefore, take up the whole armor of God, that you may be able to withstand the enemy in the day of trouble, and having done all, to stand. So stand firm, girding your waist with truth, covering your breast with the breastplate of righteousness, and putting on your feet the shoes of the good news of peace. Furthermore, taking up the shield of faith, with which you can quench all the flaming arrows of the evil one; and also the helmet of salvation, and the sword of the Spirit, which is the word of God; praying at all times with all kinds of supplications and supplications in the Spirit; and be alert in this without tiring to pray for all the saints, and for me, that I may receive eloquence, that I may speak boldly and declare the mysteries of the gospel, (I A messenger in chains for the mystery of this gospel,) and made me speak with boldness according to my duty. (Ephesians 6:10-20)

Six: Praise God with spiritual songs

Speak to one another in psalms, hymns, and spiritual songs, singing and praising the Lord with your heart and your mouth. Give thanks always to God the Father for everything in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ. We should submit to one another out of reverence for Christ.
(Ephesians 5:19-21)

Seven: Illuminate the eyes of your heart

Pray for our Lord Jesus Christ God, the Father of glory, has given to you the Spirit of wisdom and revelation in the knowledge of Him, and the eyes of your hearts being enlightened, so that you may know the hope of His calling and the hope of His calling in the saints What are the riches of the glory of the inheritance; and how great is the exceeding greatness of his power toward us who believe, according to the mighty power which he exercised in Christ, in raising him from the dead and seating him in the heavenly places His right hand, (Ephesians 1:17-20)

articles.title: Parable of the Fig Tree
articles.author: admin
articles.content:
Peace to all brothers and sisters!
Today we are looking for fellowship sharing: The Parable of the Fig Tree

Then he used a parable: "A man had a fig tree planted in his vineyard. He came to the tree looking for fruit, but could not find any. So he said to the gardener, 'Look, I have been coming to this fig tree for the past three years. I'm looking for fruit, but I can't find it. Cut it down, because it's occupying the ground in vain!" The gardener said, "Lord, keep it this year until I dig up the soil around it and add dung. If it bears fruit later, That's it, or I'll cut it down again.'"

Luke 13:6-9

Metaphorical Notes:

So he used a parable to say: "A man had a fig tree ("fig tree" typifies the Israelites) planted in a vineyard (Heavenly Father is the cultivator - refer to John 15:1). He (referring to Heavenly Father) came He looked for fruit before the tree, but could not find it.

Then he said to the gardener (Jesus), "Look, in the past three years, Jesus, sent by God, was born, preached the gospel of the kingdom of heaven to the people of Israel, and made people believe that Jesus is the Son of God and the Christ. He is the Messiah and the Savior! Died for sinners. Resurrected and ascended to heaven → "Those who believe in Jesus" → are reborn, saved, have eternal life, and bear spiritual first fruits) came to this fig tree to look for fruit, but could not find it (because Jesus was resurrected from the dead) As the firstfruits, and the Israelites do not believe in Jesus, they are not born again → they cannot bear spiritual fruit). Cut it down, why occupy the land in vain!

'The steward of the garden (that is, the Son of Man Jesus) said, 'Lord, keep it this year until I dig up the soil around me (typifying the kingdom of Israel → "outside") (referring to the spread of the gospel to the Gentiles) and add dung (Symbolizes the increase in the number of the salvation of the Gentiles and the abundant growth of the life of the body of Christ) → From the root of Jesse (the original text is the mound) will spring a branch; the branch from his root will bear fruit.

Isaiah 11:1

(The Israelites "saw" the Gentiles believe in Jesus: rebirth, salvation, the return of Jesus Christ at the end of the day, the redemption of the Gentiles' bodies, and the firstfruits; finally the Israelites entered the "Millennium", the Millennium Later, all the real Israelites believed that Jesus was the Christ and the Savior! So the whole family of Israel was saved - refer to Romans 11:25-26 and Revelation Chapter 20)

If it bears fruit in the future, so be it, otherwise, cut it down again. ’”

So, do you understand clearly?

articles.title: Baptism
articles.author: admin
articles.content:
Peace to all brothers and sisters!

Today we examine traffic sharing: "Baptism" The Pattern of Christian New Life

Let’s open our Bible to Romans Chapter 6, verses 3-4, and read them together:

Do you not know that those of us who were baptized into Christ Jesus were baptized into his death? Therefore we were buried with Him by baptism into death, in order that we might walk in newness of life, just as Christ was raised from the dead through the glory of the Father.

Question: How to join Jesus?

answer: into Jesus by baptism !

1 Be baptized into Jesus--Romans 6:3
2 Our old self was crucified with Him--Romans 6:6
3 Die with him--Romans 6:6
4 Buried with him--Romans 6:4
5 For those who have died are freed from sin--Romans 6:7
6 Having been united with him in the likeness of his death, you will also be united with him in the likeness of his resurrection - Romans 6:5
7 Resurrected with Christ--Romans 6:8
8 In order that every one of us may walk in newness of life--Romans 6:4

Question: What are the characteristics of "faith and behavior" of a born-again Christian?

Answer: Every move has a new style

1. Baptism

Question: What is the "purpose" of baptism?
Answer: Come to Jesus! Join him in form.

(1) Willing to be baptized into the death of Jesus

Do you not know that those of us who were baptized into Christ Jesus were baptized into his death? Therefore we were buried with him through baptism into death,...Romans 6:3-4

(2) Be united with him in the form of death

Question: What was the shape of Jesus' "death"?
Answer: Jesus died on the tree for our sins. This was the shape of His death.

Question: How to be united with Him in the likeness of His death?

Answer: By being "baptized" into the death of Jesus and being buried with Him;

"Being baptized" means being crucified, died, buried, and resurrected with Christ! Amen. Reference Romans 6:6-7

(3) Be united with Him in the likeness of His resurrection

Question: What is the shape of Jesus’ resurrection?
Answer: Jesus’ resurrection is a spiritual body--1 Corinthians 15:42
If you look at my hands and feet, you will know that it is really me. Touch me and see! A soul has no bones and no flesh. You see, I do. ” Luke 24:39

Question: How can we be united with Him in His resurrection likeness?

Answer: Eat the Lord’s supper!

Because Jesus’ flesh → saw neither corruption nor death – see Acts 2:31

When we eat the "bread" His body, we have the body of Jesus within us. When we drink the "grape juice" His blood in the cup, we have the life of Jesus Christ within our hearts. Amen! This is to be united with Him in the form of resurrection. Whenever we eat this bread and drink this cup, we will remain united until He comes again. Reference 1 Corinthians 11:26

2. (Belief) The old man is dead and has been freed from sin

Question: How do believers escape from sin?
Answer: Jesus died for our sins, freeing us from them. Being united to him in the likeness of death, our old man was crucified with him, so that the body of sin might be destroyed, so that we might no longer be slaves to sin, for he who has died is freed from sin. Refer to Romans 6:6-7 and Col 3:3 for you are already dead...!

3. (Faith) Anyone born of God will never sin

Question: Why does anyone who is born of God not sin?

Answer: Detailed explanation below

(1) Jesus used his own blood to wash away people’s sins (once). Reference Hebrews 1:3 and 9:12
(2) The unblemished blood of Christ cleanses your hearts (original text is "conscience") refer to Hebrews 9:14
(3) Once the conscience is cleansed, it no longer feels guilty - Hebrews 10:2

Question: Why do I always feel guilty?

Answer: Detailed explanation below

1 Because you have the law, you are under the law and break the law, the law convicts you of sin, and the devil accuses you of sin. Reference Romans 4:15, 3:20, Revelation 12:10
2 The blood of Jesus only cleansed people's sins (once). You (do not) believe that His precious blood (once) became the eternal atonement for sins; you only listen to the preachers who speak nonsense and say "His precious blood lasts forever." "Efficacious" → wash away sins (many times), blot out sins, and treat His blood as normal. Reference Hebrews 10:26-29
3 Those who feel guilty are not born again! That is, they have not been reborn as a (new man), they have not understood the gospel, and they have not understood the salvation of Christ; because they are still in the (old man) sinful body, in the evil passions and lusts of Adam; they are not in the holiness of Christ.
4 You have not (believed) that the old man was crucified with Christ, that the body of sin might be destroyed... For he who has died has been freed from sin - Romans 6:6-7, for you have died... Colossians 3 :3
5 You must [consider] yourselves (the old man) to be dead to sin, but you must [consider] yourselves (the new man) to be alive to God in Christ Jesus. Romans 6:11
For example: Jesus said to them, "If you were blind, you would have no sin; but now that you say, 'We can see,' your sin remains." -- John 9:41
6 Everyone who sins violates the law and is not freed from the law (by faith) through Jesus. They are under the law and lie in the power of the evil one. From this, it becomes clear who are the children of God and who are the children of the devil. Reference John 1:10

4. Chaste virgins

(1) 144,000 people

These men had not been tainted with women; they were virgins. They follow the Lamb wherever he goes. They were purchased from among men as firstfruits for God and for the Lamb. No lie can be found in their mouths; they are without blemish. Revelation 14:4-5

Question: Where did the above 144,000 people come from?

Answer: The Lamb was purchased from man with his blood--1 Corinthians 6:20

Question: Who do the 144,000 people here represent?

Answer: It typifies the saved Gentiles and all the saints! Amen

(2) Christians who believe in the gospel and are born again are chaste virgins

The anger I feel for you is the anger of God. For I have betrothed you to one husband, to present you as chaste virgins to Christ. 2 Corinthians 11:2

5. Putting off the old man Adam

(1) Experience→The old man is gradually put off

Question: When did I put off my old man, Adam?
Answer: I (believed in) being crucified, died, and buried with Christ, and thus put off the old man Adam; then believing (experience) that the death of Jesus started in me, and gradually put off the old man. See 2 Corinthians 4:4:10-11 and Ephesians 4:22

(2) Experience→The newcomer gradually grows up

If the Spirit of God dwells in you, you are no longer of the flesh but of the Spirit. ...Refer to Romans 8:9 → Therefore, we do not lose heart. Although the outer body (old man) is being destroyed, the inner man (new man) is being renewed day by day. Our light and momentary sufferings will work for us an eternal weight of glory beyond compare. 2 Corinthians 4:16-17

6. Eat the Lord’s Supper

Jesus said, "Truly, truly, I say to you, unless you eat the flesh of the Son of Man and drink his blood, you have no life in you. Whoever eats my flesh and drinks my blood has eternal life, at the last day I will raise him up. My flesh is food, and my blood is drink. He who eats my flesh and drinks my blood abides in me, and I abide in him. John 6:53-56

7. Put on the new self and put on Christ

Therefore you are all sons of God through faith in Christ Jesus. As many of you as were baptized into Christ have put on Christ. Galatians 3:26-27

8. Like to preach the gospel and make people believe in Jesus

The most obvious characteristic of a reborn Christ is that he likes to preach Jesus to his family, relatives, classmates, colleagues, and friends, telling them to believe in the gospel and be saved and have eternal life.
(For example) Jesus came to them and said to them, "All authority has been given to me in heaven and on earth. So go and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit ( Baptize them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit). Teach them to obey everything I have commanded you, and I am with you always, even to the end of the age.” Matthew 28:18- 20

9. No longer worship idols

Born-again Christians no longer worship idols, they only worship the Lord who created heaven and earth, the Lord Jesus Christ! Amen
You were dead in your trespasses and sins, and he made you alive. In which you walked according to the course of this world, in obedience to the prince of the power of the air, the spirit which now works in the sons of disobedience. We were all among them, indulging the lusts of the flesh, following the desires of the flesh and the heart, and by nature were children of wrath, just like everyone else. However, God, who is rich in mercy and loves us with great love, makes us alive with Christ even when we were dead in our trespasses. It is by grace you have been saved. He also raised us up and seated us with us in heavenly places with Christ Jesus. Ephesians 2:1-6

10. Love gatherings, studying the Bible, and praising God with spiritual songs

Born-again Christians love one another and love to gather as members to listen to sermons, read and study the Bible, pray to God, and praise our God with spiritual songs!
that my spirit may sing your praises and never be silent. I will praise you, O LORD, my God, forever! Psalm 30:12
Let the word of Christ dwell in your hearts richly, teaching and admonishing one another with psalms, hymns, and spiritual songs, singing praises to God with your hearts filled with grace. Colossians 3:16

11. We do not belong to the world

(As the Lord Jesus said) I have given them your word. And the world hates them; because they are not of the world, even as I am not of the world. I do not ask you to take them out of the world, but I ask you to keep them from the evil one (or translated: from sin). They are not of the world, just as I am not of the world. John 17:14-16

12. Waiting for the return of Christ with faith, hope, and love

Now there are three things that always exist: faith, hope, and love, the greatest of which is love. --1 Corinthians 13:13

We know that all creation groans and labors together until now. Not only that, even we who have the first fruits of the Spirit groan inwardly, waiting for our adoption as sons, the redemption of our bodies. Romans 8:22-23
He who testifies this says, “Yes, I am coming quickly!” Amen! Lord Jesus, I want you to come!

May the grace of the Lord Jesus always be with all the saints. Amen! Revelation 22:20-21
