articles.title: Believe in the Gospel 12
articles.author: admin
articles.content:
"Believe in the Gospel" 12

Peace to all brothers and sisters!

Today we continue to examine fellowship and share "Belief in the Gospel"

Let’s open the Bible to Mark 1:15, turn it over and read together:

Said: "The time is fulfilled, and the kingdom of God is at hand. Repent and believe the gospel!"

Lecture 12: Believing in the gospel redeems our bodies

Romans 8:23, Not only so, but we ourselves, who have the first fruits of the Spirit, groan inwardly as we wait for adoption as sons, the redemption of our bodies.

Question: When will our bodies be redeemed?

Answer: Detailed explanation below

(1) Our life is hidden with Christ in God

For you have died and your life is hidden with Christ in God. Colossians 3:3

Question: Are our regenerated lives and bodies visible?

Answer: The regenerated new man is hidden with Christ in God and is invisible.
It turns out that we care not about what is seen, but about what is unseen; for what is seen is temporary, but what is unseen is eternal. 2 Corinthians 4:18

(2) Our life appears

Question: When does our life manifest?

Answer: When Christ appears, our lives will also appear.

When Christ, who is our life, appears, you also will appear with him in glory. Colossians 3:4

Question: Does life appear to have a body?

Answer: There is a body!

Question: Is it Adam’s body? Or the body of Christ?
Answer: It is the Body of Christ! Because He gave birth to us by the gospel, we are His members. Ephesians 5:30

Note: What is in our hearts is the Holy Spirit, the Spirit of Jesus, and the Spirit of Heavenly Father! The soul is the soul of Jesus Christ! The body is the immortal body of Jesus; therefore, our new man is not the soul body of the old man, Adam. So, do you understand?

May the God of peace sanctify you completely! And may your spirit, soul, and body (i.e., your reborn soul and body) be kept blameless at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ! He who calls you is faithful and will do it. 1 Thessalonians 5:23-24

(3) Those who fell asleep in Jesus, Jesus brought with him

Question: Where are those who have fallen asleep in Jesus Christ?

Answer: Hidden with Christ in God!

Question: Where is Jesus now?

Answer: Jesus was resurrected and ascended to heaven. He is now in heaven, sitting at the right hand of God the Father. Our lives and the lives of those who have fallen asleep in Jesus are also in heaven. Reference Ephesians 2:6

Question: Why do some churches (such as Seventh-day Adventists) say that the dead sleep in graves until Christ comes again, and then they come out of the graves and are resurrected?

Answer: Jesus will come down from heaven when he comes again, and concerning those who have fallen asleep in Jesus, of course he will be brought from heaven;

【Because the work of redemption of Jesus Christ has been completed】

If the dead are still sleeping in the tomb, their faith will be in big trouble. They will have to wait until the end of the millennium, the final judgment, when death and Hades will hand over the dead among them. If someone's name is not written in the book of life, he will was cast into the lake of fire. So, do you understand? Refer to Revelation 20:11-15

We do not want you to be ignorant, brethren, concerning those who are asleep, lest you should grieve like those who have no hope. If we believe that Jesus died and rose again, even those who sleep in Jesus will God also bring with him. 1 Thessalonians 4:13-14

Question: Those who have fallen asleep in Christ, will they be resurrected with bodies?

Answer: There is a body, a spiritual body, the body of Christ! Reference 1 Corinthians 15:44

For the Lord Himself will descend from heaven with a shout, with the voice of the archangel, and with the trumpet of God; and the dead in Christ will rise first. 1 Thessalonians 4:16

(4) Those who are alive and remain will be transformed and put on the new man and appear in the blink of an eye.

Now I tell you a mysterious thing: we will not all sleep, but we will all be changed, in an instant, in the blink of an eye, when the last trumpet sounds. For the trumpet will sound, the dead will be raised incorruptible, and we will be changed. This perishable must be put on ("put on") the incorruptible; this mortal must put on immortality. 1 Corinthians 15:51-53

(5)We will see his true form

Question: Who does our true form look like?

Answer: Our bodies are the members of Christ and appear to be like Him!

Dear brothers, we are children of God now, and what we will be in the future has not yet been revealed; but we know that when the Lord appears, we will be like Him, because we will see Him as He is. 1 John 3:2 and Philippians 3:20-21

alright! "Believe in the Gospel" is shared here.

Let us pray together: Thank you Abba Heavenly Father, thank you the Savior Jesus Christ, and thank the Holy Spirit for always being with us! May the Lord Jesus continue to illuminate the eyes of our souls and open our minds so that we can see and hear spiritual truths and understand the Bible! We understand that when Jesus comes, we will see His true form, and our new man’s body will also appear, that is, the body will be redeemed. Amen

Today we continue to examine fellowship and share "Belief in the Gospel"

Let’s open the Bible to Mark 1:15, turn it over and read together:

Said: "The time is fulfilled, and the kingdom of God is at hand. Repent and believe the gospel!"

Lecture 11: Believing in the gospel enables us to receive sonship

Question: How to obtain the sonship of God?

Answer: Detailed explanation below

(1) The middle partition wall was demolished

(2) Christ used his body to destroy hatred

(3) Enmity was destroyed on the cross

Question: What grievances were demolished, abolished, and destroyed?

Answer: It is the regulations written in the law.

For he is our peace, and has made the two into one, and has broken down the dividing wall; and in his body he has destroyed the enmity, even the precepts which are written in the law, that he might have made the two by himself A new man thus achieves harmony. Having put an end to enmity on the cross, we have been reconciled to God through the cross. Ephesians 2:14-16

(4) Obliterate laws and documents

(5)Remove it

(6) Nailed on the cross

Question: What did Christ anoint for us? Remove what?

Answer: Blot out the writings in the statutes that are against us and are harmful to us, and remove them.

Question: What was the “purpose” of Jesus “blotting out” the laws, ordinances and writings, taking them away and nailing them to the cross?

Answer: Anyone who sins breaks the law; breaking the law is sin. 1 John 3:4

Refer to Revelation 12:10 because Satan the devil is before God day and night accusing → brothers and sisters → Is it against the law? Accuse you with laws and regulations and condemn you to death? Satan has to find the laws, regulations and letters as "evidence" to prove that you have violated the law before the judgment seat → condemn you to death; and love our God, Lord Jesus Christ! He blotted out the statutes and letters of the law, the evidence that accused us and condemned us to death, and took them away, nailing them to the cross. In this way, Satan will not be able to use "evidence" to accuse you, nor will he be able to convict you or condemn you to death. So, do you understand?

You were dead in your trespasses and uncircumcision of the flesh, but God has made you alive together with Christ, having forgiven you (or translated: us) all our trespasses, and having blotted out all that is in the law Take away the writings (evidences of guilt) that are written against us and against us, and nail them to the cross. Reference Colossians 2:13-14

(7) Freedom from the law and the curse of the law

Question: How to escape the law and curse?

Answer: Die to the law through the body of Christ

So, my brethren, you also are dead to the law through the body of Christ... But since we died to the law by which we are bound, we are now free from the law... Romans 7:4 ,6

Christ redeemed us from the curse of the law by becoming the curse for us; for it is written, “Cursed is everyone who hangs on a tree.” Galatians 3 :13

(8) Obtain the sonship of God

Question: How to obtain sonship?
Answer: To redeem those who were under the law, so that we might receive sonship.

When the fullness of time came, God sent his Son, born of a woman, born under the law, to redeem those who were under the law, so that we might receive adoption as sons. Galatians 4:4-5

Question: Why should those under the law be redeemed?

Answer: Detailed explanation below

1 Whoever commits sin breaks the law, and the violation of the law is sin. 1 John 3:4
2 Everyone who works according to the law is under a curse; for it is written, “Cursed is everyone who does not continue to do everything written in the book of the law.” No one is cursed. Being justified before God by the law is evident; for the Scripture says, "The righteous shall live by faith." Galatians 3:10-11
3 For the law provokes wrath (or translation: causes punishment)
So →→
4 Where there is no law, there is no transgression - Romans 4:15
5 Without the law, sin is not considered sin - Romans 5:13
6 For without the law sin is dead - Romans 7:8

7 Whoever sins without the law will perish without the law; and whoever sins under the law will be judged according to the law. Reference Romans 2:12

(The Great Judgment of the Last Day: Brothers and sisters should be sober and pay attention. Those who are (not) under the law, that is, those who are in Jesus Christ, will be resurrected and reign with Christ for a thousand years before the millennium; Those who are under the law will have to wait until "after" the Millennium. These dead people will be handed over and judged according to their deeds under the law and their transgressions and sins. If anyone's name is not recorded, In the book of life, he was cast into the lake of fire and perished).
If you do not believe that this [gospel] is the power of God, please do not "weep and gnash your teeth" on the Day of Judgment. Refer to Revelation 20:11-15
So, do you understand?

alright! Share it here today

Let us pray together: Thank you Heavenly Father! He sent his only begotten Son, Jesus, who was born under the law, to redeem those who were under the law, to be freed from the law, and to give us sonship! Amen.
For where there is no law, there is no transgression; where there is no law, there is no sin; where there is no law, there is no sin; where there is no law, there is no sin, and there is no curse.

That which is born of flesh is flesh; that which is born of spirit is spirit. Don’t be surprised when I say, “You must be born again.” John 3:6-7

Answer: Detailed explanation below

1 Unless a man is born again he cannot see the kingdom of God - John 3:3
2 Cannot enter the kingdom of God - John 3:5
3 Flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom of God - 1 Corinthians 15:50

Therefore, the Lord Jesus said: “Do not be surprised that you must be born again.”

If a person is not regenerated, he does not have the Holy Spirit. Without the guidance of the Holy Spirit, you will not understand the Bible. No matter how many times you read it, you will not understand the Bible or understand what the Lord Jesus said. For example, the disciples who followed Jesus at the beginning did not understand what Jesus said. When Jesus was resurrected and ascended to heaven, and the Holy Spirit came on Pentecost, they were filled with the Holy Spirit and received power, and then they understood what the Lord Jesus said. So, do you understand?

Question: Why cannot flesh and blood inherit the kingdom of God?

Answer: The perishable (cannot) inherit the incorruptible.

Question: What is perishable?

Answer: The Lord Jesus said! What is born of the flesh is the flesh. Our flesh is born of our parents → we were created from the dust of Adam. Because of sin, Adam’s flesh will decay and see death, so he cannot inherit the kingdom of God.

Question: Did Jesus also have a body of flesh and blood?
Answer: Jesus was born of the Heavenly Father, came down from Jerusalem in heaven, was conceived by a virgin and was born by the Holy Spirit. He is the Word incarnate, he is spiritual, holy, sinless, incorruptible, and does not see death! Reference Acts 2:31
Our flesh, which came from the dust of Adam, has been sold to sin, and the wages of sin is death. Therefore, our flesh is corruptible and mortal. The body created by flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom of God. So, do you understand?

Question: How can we inherit the kingdom of God?

Answer: Must be reborn!

Question: How are we born again?

Answer: Believe in Jesus! Believe the gospel, understand the word of truth, and receive the promised Holy Spirit as a seal. We cry out: "Abba, Father!" The Holy Spirit testifies with our hearts that we are children of God - Romans 8:15-16; Everything from God Whoever is born does not sin, amen! Refer to 1 John 3:9. This proves that you have been born again. Do you understand this?

We will study and share with brothers and sisters in detail about "Rebirth" in the future. Well, I will share it here today.

Let us pray together: Dear Abba Heavenly Father, our Lord Jesus Christ, thank the Holy Spirit for guiding us children to believe the gospel and understand the way of truth, allowing us to receive the promised Holy Spirit as a seal, become children of God, and understand rebirth! Only those who are born of water and the Spirit can see the kingdom of God and enter the kingdom of God. Thank you Heavenly Father for giving us the word of truth and for giving us the promised Holy Spirit to regenerate us! Amen

Romans 6:8, If we died with Christ, we will also believe that we will live with him. Amen!

Question: How to die with Christ?

Answer: To die with Christ through “baptism” into His death.

Do you not know that those of us who were baptized into Christ Jesus were baptized into his death? Therefore we were buried with Him by baptism into death, in order that we might walk in newness of life, just as Christ was raised from the dead through the glory of the Father. Romans 6:3-4

Question: How to live with Christ?

Answer: "Being baptized" means testifying to die with Him and testifying to living with Christ! Amen

You were buried with him in baptism, in which you were also raised with him through faith in the working of God, who raised him from the dead. You were dead in your trespasses and uncircumcision of the flesh, but God made you alive together with Christ, having forgiven you (or us) all our trespasses; Colossians 2:12-13.

2. Formally united with Christ

For if we have been united with him in the likeness of his death, we shall also be united with him in the likeness of his resurrection; Romans 6:5

Question: What was the shape of Jesus’ death?

Answer: Jesus died on the cross, and this was the shape of His death!

Question: How to be united with Him in the form of His death?

Answer: Use the method of believing in the Lord! When you believe in Jesus and the gospel, and are "baptized" into the death of Christ, you are united with Him in the form of death, and your old man is crucified with Him.

Question: What is the shape of Jesus’ resurrection?

Answer: Detailed explanation below

(1) Resurrection is the spiritual body

The body that is sown refers to the body of Adam, the old man, and the body that is resurrected refers to the body of Christ, the new man. If there is a physical body, there must also be a spiritual body. So, do you understand? Reference 1 Corinthians 15:44

(2) Jesus’ flesh is imperishable

Foreknowing this, he spoke of the resurrection of Christ and said: "His soul was not left in Hades, nor did his body see corruption." ’ Acts 2:31

(3) The shape of Jesus’ resurrection

If you look at my hands and my feet, you will know that it is really me. Touch me and see! A soul has no bones and no flesh. You see, I do. ” Luke 24:39

Question: How to be united with Him in His resurrection likeness?

Answer: Because Jesus’ flesh did not see corruption or death!

When we eat the Lord’s Supper, the Holy Communion, we eat His body and drink the Lord’s blood! We have the life of Christ within us, and this life (which has nothing to do with Adam’s flesh and blood). The regenerated new man is the flesh and blood of Jesus. This is to be united with Christ in the likeness of his resurrection. Until Christ comes and Christ appears in His true form, our bodies will also appear and appear in glory with Christ. Amen! So, do you understand? See 1 John 3:2, Col 3:4

3. Our resurrection life is hidden with Christ in God

Because you have died (that is, the old man has died), your life (the resurrection life with Christ) is hidden with Christ in God. So, do you understand? Reference Colossians 3:3

Lead us into all the truth and understand that if we believe in dying with Christ, we will also believe in living with Christ; by being baptized into death, we are united to him in the likeness of death; we eat the Lord’s supper, eat the Lord’s body and drink The blood of the Lord will also be united with Him in the likeness of His resurrection! Amen

So the sea gave up the dead in them, and death and Hades gave up the dead in them; and they were judged every one according to their works. Revelation 20:13

I am sending you to them that their eyes may be opened and that they may turn from darkness to light and from the power of Satan to God; that through faith in me they may receive forgiveness of sins and an inheritance with all who are sanctified. ’” Acts 26:18

I have given them your word. And the world hates them; because they are not of the world, even as I am not of the world. I do not ask you to take them out of the world, but I ask you to keep them from the evil one (or translated: from sin). They are not of the world, just as I am not of the world. John 17:14-16

Question: Do our old men belong to the world?

Answer: "The Holy Spirit in your heart tells you"! Faith is very important, as "Paul" said! It is no longer me who lives, but Christ who lives in me, because your "heart" is in heaven, and you are the reborn new man. Is it clear? Reference plus 2:20

Question: Does the regenerated new man belong to the world?

Answer: The regenerated new man lives in Christ, in the Father, in the love of God, in heaven and in your hearts. The new man is hidden with Christ in God. The new man born of God is not of this world.

God has saved us from the power of darkness, the power of death, Hades, and the power of Satan, and has transferred us to the kingdom of His beloved Son, Jesus. Amen!

Lecture 6: The gospel enables us to put off the old man and its behaviors

[Colossians 3:3] For you have died and your life is hidden with Christ in God. Verse 9 Do not lie to one another, for you have put off the old man and its deeds.

(1) Have put off the old man and his behaviors

Question: What does it mean that you are dead?

Answer: "You" means that the old man has died, died with Christ, the body of sin has been destroyed, and he is no longer the slave of sin, because he who has died has been freed from sin. Reference Romans 6:6-7

Question: When did our “old man, sinful body” die?

Answer: When Jesus was crucified, your old man of sin was already dead and extinct.

Question: I was not yet born when the Lord was crucified! You see, isn’t our “sinful body” still alive today?

Answer: God’s gospel is preached to you! "The "purpose" of the gospel tells you that the old man has died, the body of sin has been destroyed, and you are no longer a slave to sin. It tells you to believe the gospel and use the method of believing in the Lord to believe. To unite and use (faith) in the likeness of death. Be united with Christ and be united with him in the likeness of his resurrection. Do you understand this? See Romans 6:5-7.

Question: When did we put off the old man?
Answer: When you believe in Jesus, believe in the gospel, and understand the truth, Christ died for our sins, was buried, and rose again on the third day! You were resurrected with Christ. When you were reborn, you had already put off the old man. You believe that this gospel is the power of God to save you, and you are willing to be "baptized" into Christ and be united with Him in the likeness of His death; you will also be united with Him in the likeness of His resurrection. so,

"Being baptized" is an act that testifies that you have put off the old man and your old self. Do you understand clearly? Reference Romans 6:3-7

Question: What are the behaviors of the old man?
Answer: The evil passions and desires of the old man.

The works of the flesh are obvious: adultery, impurity, licentiousness, idolatry, sorcery, hatred, strife, jealousy, outbursts of anger, factions, dissensions, heresies, and envy. , drunkenness, revelry, etc. I told you before and I tell you now that those who do such things will not inherit the kingdom of God. Galatians 5:19-21

Question: How do we know that we are not of the old human flesh?

Answer: If the Spirit of God dwells in you, you are no longer of the flesh but of the Spirit. If anyone does not have the Spirit of Christ, he does not belong to Christ. Romans 8:9

Note:

"The Spirit of God" is the Spirit of the Father, the Spirit of Jesus. Jesus asked the Holy Spirit sent by the Father to live in your hearts → you are born again:

1 Born of water and the Spirit - John 3:5-7
2 Born from the faith of the gospel - 1 Corinthians 4:15
3 Born of God - John 1:12-13

The regenerated new man no longer belongs to the old flesh, the dead body of sin, or the destroyed body; the new man born of God belongs to the Holy Spirit, to Christ, and to God the Father! It is holy and without Sinful, eternal life! Amen. Do you understand this?

(3) The new man gradually grows; the old man gradually destroys

Answer: The "regenerated new man" lives in Christ. The body has not yet appeared, and you cannot see it with the naked eye, because the regenerated "new man" is the spiritual body, the resurrected body of Christ. We are members of Christ and are together with Christ. Hidden in God and gradually growing; refer to Colossians 3:3-4, 1 Corinthians 15:44

As for the visible sinful body of the old man, it undergoes death and its outer body is gradually destroyed. The old man is the body of Adam. The flesh of the old man came from Adam. It was originally dust and will eventually return to dust. So, do you understand? Reference Genesis 3:19

Refer to the following two verses:

Therefore, we do not lose heart. Although the outer body is being destroyed, the inner heart (that is, the Spirit of God dwelling in the heart) is being renewed day by day. 2 Corinthians 4:16

If you have listened to his word, received his teachings, and learned his truth, you must put off your old self in your former conduct, which is gradually getting worse through the deceitfulness of lust.

Ephesians 4:21-22

We understand that Christ was crucified and died for our sins and was buried, so that we have put off the old man and its behaviors; we have been reborn through Christ’s resurrection from the dead, and the Spirit of God lives in our hearts, and we experience The regenerated new man "lives in Christ, is gradually renewed and grows, and grows to be full of the stature of Christ; it also experiences the putting off of the outer body of the old man, which is gradually destroyed. The old man was dust when he came from Adam, and will return to dust.

"Believe in the Gospel" 5

Peace to all brothers and sisters!

Today we continue to examine fellowship and share "Belief in the Gospel"

Let’s open the Bible to Mark 1:15, turn it over and read together:

Said: "The time is fulfilled, and the kingdom of God is at hand. Repent and believe the gospel!"

Lecture 5: The gospel frees us from the law and its curse

Question: Is it good to be free from the law? Or is it better to keep the law?

Answer: Freedom from the law.

Question: Why?

Answer: Detailed explanation below

1 Everyone who works by the law is under a curse, for it is written: “Cursed is everyone who does not continue to do everything written in the book of the law.” Galatians Book 3:10
2 It is evident that no one is justified before God by the law; for it is said, “The righteous shall live by faith.” Galatians 3:11
3 Therefore by the works of the law no flesh will be justified before God, for the law is a convict of sin. Romans 3:20
4 You who seek to be justified by the law have been alienated from Christ and have fallen from grace. Galatians 5:4
5 For the law was not made for the righteous, "that is, the children of God," but for the lawless and disobedient, for the ungodly and sinful, for the unholy and profane, for the parricide and murderer, for the sexually immoral and fornicator, for the robber or for any other thing that is contrary to righteousness. 1 Timothy 1:9-10

So, do you understand?

(1) Break away from Adam’s covenant-breaking law

Question: Free from what law?

Answer: To be freed from the sin that leads to death is Adam’s “breaking of the covenant” law. God commanded Adam! (But you shall not eat from the tree of the knowledge of good and evil, for in the day you eat from it you will surely die!"), this is a commandment law. Genesis 2:17

Question: Why are all humans under the curse of the law when the “first ancestors” broke the law?

Answer: This is just like sin entered the world through one man, Adam, and death came from sin, so death came to everyone because everyone sinned. Romans 5:12

Question: What is sin?

Answer: Breaking the law is sin → Anyone who sins breaks the law; breaking the law is sin. 1 John 3:4

Note:

All have sinned, and in Adam all were under the curse of the law and died.

Die! Where is your power to overcome?
Die! Where is your sting?
The sting of death is sin, and the power of sin is the law.
If you want to be free from death, you must be free from sin.
If you want to be free from sin, you must be free from the law of sin's power.
Amen! So, do you understand?

1 Where there is no law, there is no transgression. Romans 4:15
2 Where there is no law, sin is not counted. Romans 5:13
3 For without the law sin is dead. Romans 7:8
4 Whoever does not have the law and does not follow the law perish. Romans 2:12

Said: "The time is fulfilled, and the kingdom of God is at hand. Repent and believe the gospel!"

Lecture 4: Believing in the gospel frees us from sin


Question: What is repentance?
Answer: "Repentance" means a contrite, sad and contrite heart, knowing that one is in sin, in evil passions and lusts, in weak Adam, and in death;

"Change" means correction. Psalm 51:17 The sacrifice God requires is a broken spirit; you, O God, will not despise a broken and contrite heart.

Question: How to correct it?

Answer: Believe in the gospel! "Repentance" does not mean asking you to reform, improve, or change yourself. You can never change your "sins" on your own. The real meaning of "repentance" is for you to believe the gospel. The gospel is the power of God to save everyone who believes. Believing in the gospel → frees us from sin, from the law and the curse of the law, and from the old man and the old self. Acts, escape from Satan, escape from the influence of Satan in the darkness of Hades; resurrect with Christ, be reborn, be saved, put on the new man and put on Christ, receive the sonship of God, and obtain eternal life! Amen.

→→This is true "repentance"! Be renewed in your mind and put on the new self in true righteousness and holiness - refer to Ephesians 4:23-24

It was the old man, now it is the new man;
Once in sin, now in holiness;
Originally in Adam, now in Christ.
Belief in the gospel → repentance!
Be transformed → Previously you were a son of Adam who was made of dust;

Now the son of Jesus, the last Adam. So, do you understand?

Question: How to believe the gospel?

Answer: Believe in the gospel! Just believe in Jesus!

We believe that Jesus Christ, sent by God, has done the work of redemption for us (to save his people from their sins). This "work of redemption" is the gospel! Amen. So, do you understand?

Question: How do we believe in the work of redemption? How do we work?

Answer: Jesus answered, “This is the work of God, that you believe in Him whom He has sent.” John 6:29

Question: How to understand this verse?
Answer: Believe in Jesus sent by God to do the work of redemption for us!
I believed: God’s work of salvation is at work in me, and the “wage” of Jesus’ work is imputed to those who “believe”, and God counts me as having worked → I am the same as God. Work, God’s work. Amen! Do you understand this?

So Paul says in Romans 1:17! The righteousness of God is “by faith→saved by faith!”; and due to faith→belief, the Holy Spirit operates “walking with God” to do the work of renewal, so that you can receive glory, rewards, and crowns. This is what God says to those who believe. Do you understand the mystery of the work in the body?

Question: How (faith) do we count as co-workers and walk with God?

Answer: Believe in Jesus Christ sent by God to do the work of redemption. Christ died for our sins and freed us from our sins.

(1)The Lord laid the sins of all people on Jesus

We all like sheep have gone astray; each one has turned to his own way; the Lord has laid upon Him the iniquity of us all. Isaiah 53:6

(2) Christ died “for” all

For the love of Christ compels us; for we consider that since one died for all, one died for all; 2 Corinthians 5:14

(3) The dead are freed from sin

For we know that our old man was crucified with Him, that the body of sin might be destroyed, that we should no longer serve sin; for he who has died has been freed from sin. Romans 6:6-7

[Note:] Jehovah God laid the sins of all people on Jesus, and Jesus was crucified for them all, so that all died - 2 Corinthians 5:14 → Those who have died are freed from sin - Romans 6:7; “all” died, and all were freed from sin. Amen! You have seen and heard it. This is the gospel sent by God’s servants to tell you that you have been freed from sin. If you believe “this gospel”, the “wage” of Jesus’ work will be attributed to you. This gospel is God’s salvation. Power operates on those who "believe". This is the mystery of God's salvation. Do you understand?

Therefore, this gospel is the power of God to save everyone who believes that Jesus died on the cross for our sins, so that we have been freed from sin. You understand the pattern of this "doctrine". If you don't believe that this gospel has freed you from sin, you will be condemned. Your sin has been determined and you will be judged at the end of the day. Do you understand it?

Let us pray to God together: Dear Abba, Heavenly Father! You have laid the sin of all people on Jesus Christ, who died for our sins, so that we all have been freed from our sins. Amen! Blessed are those who see, hear, and believe this gospel. The "wages" of Jesus' redemption work are returned to the body of those who believe. This is co-working with God and doing God's work.

In the name of the Lord Jesus Christ! Amen

(1) Jesus was filled with the Holy Spirit and preached the gospel

“The Spirit of the Lord is upon me, because he has anointed me to preach good news to the poor; he has sent me to proclaim release to the captives and recovery of sight to the blind, to set at liberty the oppressed, to proclaim the favor of God The Jubilee Year of Nirvana” Luke 4:18-19.

Answer: Detailed explanation below

Jesus was baptized in the Jordan River, filled with the Holy Spirit, and after being led into the wilderness to be tempted, began to preach the gospel of the kingdom of heaven!

"The Spirit of the Lord (that is, the Spirit of God, the Holy Spirit)
In me (i.e. Jesus),
Because He (that is, Heavenly Father) has anointed me,
Ask me to preach the gospel to the poor (meaning they are naked and have nothing, no life and eternal life); refer to Revelation 3:17

I am sent to report:

1 Those who were taken captive by the devil,
2 Those who are imprisoned by the powers of darkness and Hades,

3 What death has taken away will be released.

Luke 24:44-47

Peace to all brothers and sisters!

Let’s open the Bible to Mark 1:15, turn it over and read together:

Said: "The time is fulfilled, and the kingdom of God is at hand. Repent and believe the gospel!"

Foreword:
From knowing the true God, we know Jesus Christ!

→→Believe in Jesus!

Lecture 1: Jesus is the Beginning of the Gospel

The beginning of the gospel of Jesus Christ, the Son of God. Mark 1:1

Question: Believe in the gospel. What do you believe in?
Answer: Belief in the gospel →→ is (belief in) Jesus! The name of Jesus is the gospel. The name "Jesus" means: because he will save his people from their sins. Amen! Do you understand this? See Matthew 1:21

Question: Why is Jesus the beginning of the gospel?

Answer: Detailed explanation below

1. Jesus is the eternal God

1The God who exists and exists

God said to Moses, “I am who I am”; Exodus 3:14
Question: When did Jesus exist?
Answer: Proverbs 8:22-26
“In the beginning of the Lord’s creation,
In the beginning, before all things were created, there was me (that is, there was Jesus).
From eternity, from the beginning,
Before the world was, I was established.
There is no abyss, no fountain of great waters, from which I was born.
Before the mountains were laid, before the hills came into existence, I was born.

Before the LORD created the earth and its fields and the soil of the world, I gave birth to them. So, do you understand clearly?

2 Jesus is Alpha and Omega

"I am Alpha and Omega, the Almighty, who was, and who was, and who is to come," says the Lord God. Revelation 1:8

3 Jesus is the first and the last

I am Alpha and Omega; I am the first and the last; I am the beginning and the end. ” Revelation 22:13

2. Jesus’ Creation Work

Question: Who created the worlds?

Answer: Jesus created the world.

1 Jesus created the worlds

God, who in ancient times spoke to our ancestors through the prophets at many times and in many ways, has now spoken to us in these last days through his Son, whom he appointed heir of all things and through whom he created all the worlds. Hebrews 1:1-2

2 All things were created by Jesus

In the beginning God created the heavens and the earth - Genesis 1:1

Through Him (Jesus) all things were made; and without Him nothing was made that was made. About 1:3

3 God created man in his own image and likeness

God said: “Let us create man in our image (referring to the Father, Son, and Holy Spirit), after our likeness, and let them have dominion over the fish of the sea, over the birds in the air, over the livestock on the earth, and over all the earth. All insects that crawl on the ground.”

So God created man in his own image, in the image of God he created him; male and female he created them. Genesis 1:26-27

【Note:】

The previous "Adam" was created in the image and likeness of God Himself (Jesus). Adam was the "shadow" of God's image and likeness. We start by following the "shadow" to find the true image of the original thing. Real body! --Refer to Colossians 2:17, Hebrews 10:1, Romans 10:4.

When the “shadow” is revealed, it is → the last Adam Jesus! The previous Adam was a "shadow" → the last Adam, Jesus → is the real Adam, so Adam is the son of God! See Luke 3:38. In Adam all died because of "sin"; in Christ all will be resurrected because of "rebirth"! See 1 Corinthians 15:22. So, I wonder if you understand it?

Those who are enlightened by the Holy Spirit will understand when they see and hear, but some people will not understand even if their lips are dry. Those who don’t understand can listen slowly and pray to God more. He who seeks will find it, and the Lord will open the door to him who knocks! But you must not oppose the true way of God. Once people oppose the true way of God and do not accept the love of the truth, God will give them a wrong heart and make them believe in falsehood. These people will continue to resist God. They will Do you believe that you will never understand the gospel or rebirth until you die? Refer to 2:10-12.
(For example, 1 John 3:9, 5:18 Whoever is born of God "neither shall sin nor shall he sin"; many people say that "whoever is born of God" will still sin. What is the reason? Can you understand? ? Do you understand rebirth? If you are not born again, you cannot enter the kingdom of God. Do you believe it? )
Just like Judas, who had followed Jesus for three years and betrayed Him, and the Pharisees who opposed the truth, they did not understand that Jesus was the Son of God, the Christ, and the Savior until their death.

For example, the "tree of life" is the true image of the original thing. There is a "shadow" of the tree under the tree of life; the "shadow" of the previous Adam is revealed, which is the last Adam → Jesus! Jesus is the true image of the original thing. Our (old man) is born of the flesh of Adam and is also a "shadow"; our reborn (new man) is born of the gospel of Jesus and is the body of Christ, the real me, and the children of God. Amen! So, do you understand? Reference 1 Corinthians 15:45

3. Jesus’ work of redemption

1 Mankind fell in the Garden of Eden

And he said to Adam, “Because you obeyed your wife and ate of the tree, of which I commanded you not to eat, cursed is the ground because of you;
You must labor all your life to get food from the ground.

The earth will bring forth thorns and thistles for you, and you will eat the herbs of the field. By the sweat of your brow you will eat your bread until you return to the ground, from which you were born. You are dust, and to dust you will return. ” Genesis 3:17-19

2 As soon as sin entered the world from Adam, death came to everyone

Just as sin entered the world through one man, and death came through sin, so death came to all because all have sinned. Romans 5:12

3. God gave his only begotten son, Jesus. Believe in Jesus and you will have eternal life.

“For God so loved the world that he gave his only begotten Son, that whoever believes in him should not perish but have everlasting life. For God did not send his Son into the world to condemn the world, but to convict the world of sin. He is saved. John 3:16-17

4. Jesus is the first love

1 first love

However, there is one thing I have to blame you for: you have left your first love. Revelation 2:4

Question: What is the first love?
Answer: “God” is love (John 4:16)! Jesus is both human and God! So, the first love is Jesus!

In the beginning, you had the hope of salvation "by" believing in Jesus; later, you had to rely on your own behavior "to believe". If you leave "faith", you will leave Jesus, and you will leave your original love. So, do you understand?

2 The original command

Question: What was the original order?

Answer: We should love one another. This is the command you heard from the beginning. 1 John 3:11

3 Love God. Love neighbor. Love neighbor as yourself.

“Teacher, which is the greatest commandment in the law?” Jesus said to him, “You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, with all your soul, and with all your mind. This is the first and the greatest commandment. The greatest. And the second is like it: Love your neighbor as yourself. On these two commandments hang all the law and the prophets.” Matthew 22:36-40.

So "The beginning of the gospel of Jesus Christ, the Son of God, is Jesus! Amen, do you understand?

Next, we will continue to share the gospel text: "Believe in the Gospel" Jesus is the beginning of the gospel, the beginning of love, and the beginning of all things! Jesus! This name is "gospel" → to save your people from their sins! Amen

Let us pray together: Thank you Abba Heavenly Father, our Lord Jesus Christ, thank the Holy Spirit for enlightening us and leading us to know that Jesus Christ is: the beginning of the gospel, the beginning of love, and the beginning of all things! Amen.

In the name of the Lord Jesus! Amen

articles.content:
"Knowing Jesus Christ" 8

Peace to all brothers and sisters!

Today we continue to study, fellowship, and share "Knowing Jesus Christ"

Let’s open the Bible to John 17:3, turn it over and read together:

This is eternal life, to know you, the only true God, and Jesus Christ, whom you have sent! Amen

Lecture 8: Jesus is Alpha and Omega

(1) The Lord is Alpha and Omega

The Lord God says: “I am Alpha and Omega (Alpha, Omega: the first and last two letters of the Greek alphabet), the Almighty, who was, who is, and who is to come.” Revelation 1: 7-8

Question: What does “Alpha and Omega” mean?

Answer: Alpha and Omega → are the Greek letters "first and last", which means the first and the last.

Question: What is the meaning of past, present and eternal?

Answer: "Is in the past" means the Almighty One in eternity, the beginning, the beginning, the beginning, before the world existed → the Lord God Jesus has existed, exists today, and will be forever! Amen.

The book of Proverbs says:

“In the beginning of the Lord’s creation,
In the beginning, before all things were created, there was me (that is, there was Jesus).
From eternity, from the beginning,
Before the world was, I was established.
There is no abyss, no fountain of great water, I (referring to Jesus) have been born.
Before the mountains were laid, before the hills came into existence, I was born.
Before the LORD created the earth and its fields and the soil of the world, I gave birth to them.
(Heavenly Father) He has established the heavens, and I (referring to Jesus) are there;
He drew a circle around the face of the abyss. Above he makes the sky firm, below he makes the sources stable, sets limits for the sea, keeps the water from crossing his command, and establishes the foundation of the earth.
At that time I (Jesus) was with Him (the Father) a master craftsman (engineer),
He delights in Him every day, always rejoicing in His presence, rejoicing in the place He has prepared for man (referring to mankind) to dwell in, and (Jesus) delights to live among men.

Now, my sons, listen to me, for blessed is he who keeps my ways. Proverbs 8:22-32

(2) Jesus is the first and the last

When I saw him, I fell at his feet as if dead. He laid his right hand on me and said, "Do not be afraid! I am the first and the last;

He who lives; I was dead, and behold, I live forever and ever; and I have the keys of death and of Hades. Revelation 1:17-18

Question: What does the first and the last mean?

Answer: "First of all" means from eternity, from the beginning, the beginning, the beginning, before the world existed → Jesus already existed, was established, and was born! “The end” refers to the end of the world, when Jesus is the eternal God.

Question: Jesus died. For whom did he die?

Answer: Jesus died “once” for our sins, was buried, and rose again on the third day. 1 Corinthians 15:3-4

Question: Jesus died for our sins and was buried. What does it free us from?

Answer: Detailed explanation below

1 Free us from sin

That we should no longer be slaves to sin - Romans 6:6-7

2 Freedom from the law and its curse - Romans 7:6, Gal 3:13
3 Put off the old man and its deeds - Colossians 3:9
4 Having put away the passions and desires of the flesh - Gal 5:24
5 Out of myself, it is no longer I who live - Gal 2:20
6 Out of the world - John 17:14-16

7 Delivered from Satan - Acts 26:18

Question: Jesus was resurrected on the third day. What does it give us?
Answer: Justify us! Romans 4:25. Let us be resurrected, reborn, saved, adopted as sons of God, and have eternal life together with Christ! Amen

(Jesus) He has rescued us from the power of darkness (referring to death and Hades) and transferred us into the kingdom of his beloved Son; Colossians 1:13

Therefore, the Lord Jesus said: "I was dead, and now I am alive forever and ever, and I have the keys of death and Hades. Do you understand this?"

Question: What is the difference between Jesus' "birth" and our "birth"?

Answer: Detailed explanation below

【The virgin conceived by the Holy Spirit】

Question: What is a virgin?

Answer: We humans experience birth → "girls" are called → young girls (babies) when they are born from the mother's womb; after the age of young girls, they become → virgins; after the age of virgins, they become → girls; after the girls get married in Huaichun, they become → women; after the age of women, Just middle-aged women; when they get older, they are called wives or grandmothers.

Therefore, "virgin" is the age before menstruation and before a girl ovulates and becomes pregnant. She is called a "virgin"! A "girl"'s body begins to ovulate due to physiological characteristics, and menstruation occurs after ovulation. The body's physiological need to ovulate is to want to get married. A girl is called a "girl" when she is pregnant, and a girl who marries a man and gives birth to a child is a "woman". So, do you understand?

Therefore, Jesus was conceived by the Virgin Mary and born from the Holy Spirit. Jesus came from heaven. Just like Abraham's wife Sarah, who was very old and had stopped menstruating. God also promised her to conceive and give birth to a son, Isaac. Isaac was the child God promised to give birth to, and Isaac typified Christ! Amen

articles.author: admin
articles.content:
Peace to my dear brothers and sisters in God’s family! Amen

Let’s open the Bible to Revelation 7:4 and read it together: And I heard that the number of the seals among the tribes of the children of Israel was one hundred and forty-four thousand.

Today we will study, fellowship, and share together 《 144,000 people were sealed 》 Pray: Dear Abba, Holy Heavenly Father, our Lord Jesus Christ, thank you that the Holy Spirit is always with us! Amen. Thank you Lord! A virtuous woman【 church 】Send out workers: through the word of truth written in their hands and the word of truth they preach, which is the gospel for our salvation, glory, and redemption of our bodies. Bread is brought from far away from heaven, and is supplied to us in due season, so that we Spiritual life is more abundant! Amen. May the Lord Jesus continue to illuminate the eyes of our souls and open our minds to understand the Bible so that we can hear and see spiritual truths: Let all the children of God understand that the 12 tribes of Israel have a seal number of 144,000 →→ representing the remnant of Israel!

The above prayers, supplications, intercessions, thanks, and blessings! I ask this in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ! Amen

One hundred and forty-four thousand people were sealed:

ask: Who are the 144,000 people?
answer: Detailed explanation below

【Old Testament】 The 12 sons of Jacob and the number of sealed people in the 12 tribes of Israel are 144,000 →→representing the remnant of Israel.

Question: What is the purpose of Israel being “sealed”?
Answer: Because the Israelites "have not yet" believed that Jesus is the Son of God, they are still hoping, waiting for the Messiah, and waiting for the Savior to save them! Therefore, the remnant of Israel is protected by God and must be “sealed by God” before they can enter the millennium.

And Christians who believe in Jesus! Already received the seal of the → Holy Spirit, the seal of Jesus, the seal of God! (There is no need to be sealed anymore)

→→Do not grieve the Holy Spirit of God, by whom you were sealed (that is, the seal of the Holy Spirit, the seal of Jesus, the seal of God) until the day of redemption. Reference Ephesians 4:30
【New Testament】

1 The 12 apostles of Jesus→→represent the 12 elders
2 The 12 tribes of Israel →→ represent the 12 elders
3 12+12=24 elders.

Immediately I was moved by the Holy Spirit and saw a throne set in heaven, and someone sitting on the throne. ...and around the throne were twenty-four seats; and on them sat twenty-four elders, clothed in white robes, and with golden crowns on their heads. Revelation 4:2,4

Four living creatures:

The first living creature was like a lion → Matthew (Prince)
The second living creature was like a calf → Gospel of Mark (Servant)
The third living creature had a face like a man → Gospel of Luke (Son of Man)
The fourth living creature was like a flying eagle → Gospel of John (Son of God)

There was like a sea of glass before the throne, like crystal. In the throne and around the throne were four living creatures, full of eyes front and back. The first living creature was like a lion, the second was like a calf, the third had a face like a man, and the fourth was like an eagle. Each of the four living creatures had six wings, and they were covered with eyes both inside and outside. Day and night they say:
Holy! Holy! Holy!
The Lord God was, and is,
The Almighty who will live forever.
Revelation 4:6-8

1. 144,000 people from each tribe of Israel were sealed

(1)Seal of the Eternal God

ask: What is the seal of the living God?
answer: " print "It is a sign, a seal! The seal of the eternal God is that God's people are sealed and marked;

And belongs to " snake " is the mark of the beast 666 . So, do you understand?

After that, I saw four angels standing at the four corners of the earth, controlling the winds in the four directions of the earth, so that they would not blow on the earth, on the sea, or on the trees. And I saw another angel coming up from the rising of the sun, having the seal of the living God. Then he cried out with a loud voice to the four angels who had authority to harm the earth and the sea: Reference (Revelation 7:1-2)

(2) Do not harm God’s servants

"Do no harm to the earth or the sea or the trees, until we have sealed the servants of our God on their foreheads." Reference (Revelation 7:3)

ask: What does it mean not to harm them?
answer: Israel, God’s chosen people! In the last great tribulation~ remnant people ! Tell the angels who have power over the four winds of the earth not to harm the remnant of the people, for God chooses the remnant to be sealed →→ Entering the Millennium .

(3) Each tribe of Israel is sealed

And I heard that the number of the seals among the tribes of the children of Israel was one hundred and forty-four thousand. Reference (Revelation 7:4)
1 12,000 from the tribe of Judah; 2 12,000 from the tribe of Reuben;
3 12,000 from the tribe of Gad; 4 12,000 from the tribe of Asher;
5 Naphtali, 12,000; 6 Manasseh, 12,000;
7 The tribe of Simeon, 12,000; 8 The tribe of Levi, 12,000;
9 Issachar 12,000; 10 Zebulun 12,000;
11 Joseph had 12,000 men; 12 Benjamin had 12,000 men.
( Note: Manasseh and Ephraim were the two sons of Joseph. There is no record of the "tribe of Dan" and will not be discussed here). Refer to Genesis Chapter 49.

2. The Remnant People of Israel

ask: Who are the 144,000 people who were sealed?
answer: "144000" people means the remnant of israel .

(1) Leave seven thousand people behind

ask: What does seven thousand people mean?
answer : " seven thousand people ” → “ seven ” is the perfect number of God. The seven thousand that God has left for His name refers to remnant of israel .

→→What did God say in reply? He said: " I left seven thousand people for myself , who have never bowed the knee to Baal. ” Reference (Romans 11:4)

(2) remainder left

So it is now, according to electing grace, There is a remainder left . Reference (Romans 11:5)

(3) Remaining species

And as Isaiah said before: “If the Lord of hosts had not given us Remaining species , we have long been like Sodom and Gomorrah. "Reference (Romans 9:29)

(4) remnant people

Must have remnant people Go out from Jerusalem; there will be those who escape from Mount Zion. The zeal of the Lord of hosts will accomplish this. Reference (Isaiah 37:32)

3. Escape from Jerusalem →→[ Asaph 】

ask: Those Israelites fled to Asaph?
answer: There must be " remnant people "Going out from Jerusalem → Facing the Mount of Olives to the east, God opened a road for them from the middle of the valley to [ Asaph 】 The remaining people took refuge there .

On that day his feet will stand on the Mount of Olives, which faces eastward in front of Jerusalem. The mountain will be divided in its middle and become a great valley from east to west. Half of the mountain moved to the north and half to the south. You shall flee from the valleys of my mountains , For the valley will extend to Asaph . You will flee as the people fled from the great earthquake in the days of Uzziah king of Judah. The LORD my God will come, and all the Holy Ones will come with him. Reference (Zechariah 14:4-5)

4. God feeds her ( remnant people )1260 days

(1)1260 days

The woman fled into the wilderness, where God had prepared a place for her. Being fed for one thousand two hundred and sixty days . Reference (Revelation 12:6)

(2) One year, two years, half a year

When the dragon saw that he was thrown to the ground, he persecuted the woman who had given birth to a male child. Then the two wings of the great eagle were given to the woman, so that she could fly into the wilderness to her own place and hide from the serpent; She was fed there for a time, two and a half years . Reference (Revelation 12:13-14)

(3) “The remnant of the people” → as in the days of Noah

→→ "a remnant of people" fled from Jerusalem to 【 Asaph 】 take refuge ! It's like Old Testament ( Noah's family of eight )Enter ark Just like avoiding a major flood disaster.

As it was in the days of Noah, so it will be in the days of the Son of Man. In those days, people were eating and drinking, marrying and being given in marriage. On the day Noah entered the ark, the flood came and destroyed them all. Reference (Luke 17:26-27)

(4)" sinners all over the world " → like" Sodom "days

1 The earth and everything on it were burned up

But the day of the Lord will come like a thief. On that day, the sky will pass away with a loud noise, and everything that has substance will be consumed by the fire. The earth and everything on it will be burned up . Reference (2 Peter 3:10)

2 Kill all the sinners

It is like the days of Lot: people were eating and drinking, buying and selling, cultivating and building. On the day Lot came out of Sodom, fire and brimstone came down from heaven, Kill them all . Reference (Luke 17:28-29)

5. The remnant of the people ( Enter )Millennium

(1)Millennium_New Heaven and New Earth

“Behold! I create new heavens and a new earth; the former things will no longer be remembered, nor come to mind any more. Rejoice and be glad in what I have made forever; for I have made Jerusalem a delight, and the inhabitants thereof a delight. I will rejoice in Jerusalem and rejoice in my people; no more weeping or wailing will be heard in it (Isaiah 65:17-19).

(2) Their lifespan is very long

There will be no infant among them who died in a few days, nor an old man whose life span has expired; for those who die at a hundred years old are still considered children, and some sinners who die at a hundred years old are considered cursed. …because of my The days of the people are like trees . Reference (Isaiah 65:22)

【Millennium】

ask: " millennium "Why do they live so long?
answer: Detailed explanation below

1 After the catastrophe, all tangible things were burned and melted by the fire, and there were no more harmful things to hurt people. --Refer to 2 Peter 3:10-12
2 The planets on earth will be completely empty and desolate → Enter rest . Refer to Isaiah chapter 24 verses 1-3.
3 The “remnant people” have long life spans
If we go back to the beginning of the century ( Adam )'s sons "Set, Enosh, Iroh, Methuselah, Lamech, Noah...and so on! Just like the number of years they lived. Refer to Genesis Chapter 5.
4 The “remnant” descendants blessed by Jehovah
They filled the earth with fruitfulness and multiplication. Like Jacob and his family when they came to Egypt 70 People (refer to Genesis Chapter 46:27), they became numerous in the "Land of Goshen" in Egypt in 430 years. Moses led the Israelites out of Egypt, and there were only 603,550 people who were twenty years old and older and capable of fighting. woman, old man and two There are even more people under the age of ten; there are 144,000 remaining Israelites after the millennium. They live a long life. If you count the descendants blessed by Jehovah in a thousand years, their number is even greater. Like the sand of the sea, it fills the whole earth. So, do you understand? Reference (Revelation 20:8-9) and Isaiah 65:17-25.

(3) They no longer learn war

ask: Why don't they learn warfare?

answer: Detailed explanation below

1 Satan was thrown into the abyss and bound for a thousand years so that he could no longer deceive the fierce nations. .
2 The remnant people are God’s chosen foolish, weak, humble, and unlearned people. They only relied on God and planted vineyards. They were farmers and fishermen who worshiped God.
3 Those who have worked hard with their own hands will enjoy it for a long time.
4 There are no more planes, cannons, rockets, ballistic missiles, artificial intelligence robots, etc. or murderous nuclear weapons.

He will judge among the nations and decide what is right for many nations. They will beat their swords into plowshares and their spears into sickles. One nation does not lift up sword against another; they also No more learning about war . Come, O house of Jacob! We walk in the light of the Lord. Reference (Isaiah 2:4-5)

(4) They built houses and ate the fruits of their labor

They are to build houses and live in them; they are to plant vineyards and eat their fruit. What they build, no one else will live in; what they plant, no one else will eat; for the days of my people will be like the days of a tree; the labor of the hands of my chosen ones will be a long enjoyment. Their labor will not be in vain, nor will any evil come to their fruit, for they are descendants blessed by the LORD; so will their descendants. Before they call, I answer; while they are still speaking, I hear. The wolf shall feed with the lamb; the lion shall eat grass like the ox; and dust shall be the food of the serpent. Throughout my holy mountain, none of these will harm anyone or harm anything. This is what the Lord says. "Reference (Isaiah 65:21-25)

6. One thousand years are over

→Satan failed in the end

At the end of the thousand years, Satan will be released from his prison and come out to deceive the nations in the four corners of the earth, even Gog and Magog, so that they can gather for war. Their numbers are as numerous as the sand of the sea. They came up and filled the whole earth, and surrounded the camp of the saints and the beloved city; and fire came down from heaven and consumed them. The devil who deceived them was cast into the lake of fire and brimstone , where the beast and the false prophet are. They will be tormented day and night forever and ever. Reference (Revelation 20:7-10)

ask: Where did these people "Gog and Magog" come from?
answer: " Cogo and Magog "It comes from the people of Israel because the millennium is one thousand years and is preserved by God ( remnant people ) live a long life → They do not have babies who die in a few days, nor old people who do not live long enough; because those who die at the age of 100 are still considered children. For a thousand years they multiplied and multiplied like the sand of the sea, filling the whole earth. Among the children of Israel (there were those who were deceived, including Gog and Magog; there were also those who were not deceived, and all the Israelites were saved)

7. After the Millennium → All Israel will be saved

Brothers, I do not want you to be ignorant of this mystery (lest you think you are wise), that the Israelites are somewhat hard-hearted; When the number of the Gentiles is fulfilled, all Israel will be saved . As it is written: “A Savior will come out of Zion to take away all the sin of the house of Jacob.” It also says, “This is the covenant I will make with them, when I take away their sin.” Reference. (Romans 11:25-27)

Peace to my dear brothers and sisters in God’s family! Amen

Let’s open our Bible to Romans chapter 8 verse 23 and read together: Not only that, even we who have the first fruits of the Spirit groan inwardly, waiting for our adoption as sons, the redemption of our bodies. Amen

Today we will study, fellowship, and share together "The Second Coming of Jesus" No. 3 Speak and offer a prayer: Dear Abba Heavenly Father, our Lord Jesus Christ, thank you that the Holy Spirit is always with us! Amen. Thank you Lord! A virtuous woman【 church 】Send out workers: through the word of truth written in their hands and spoken by them, which is the gospel of our salvation, glory, and redemption of our bodies. Food is transported from the sky from afar and supplied to us at the right time to make our spiritual life richer! Amen. Ask the Lord Jesus to continue to illuminate the eyes of our souls and open our minds to understand the Bible so that we can hear and see spiritual truths: Let all the children of God understand that the Lord Jesus Christ came and our bodies were redeemed! Amen .

The above prayers, supplications, intercessions, thanks, and blessings! I ask this in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ! Amen

Christian: Body redeemed!

Romans [8:22-23] We know that the whole creation groans and labors together until now. Not only that, but we who have the first fruits of the Spirit groan inwardly, waiting for our adoption as sons. It is the redemption of our bodies .

ask: How is the Christian body redeemed?
answer: Detailed explanation below

1. Resurrection of the dead

(1)In Christ all will be resurrected

As in Adam all die, so in Christ all shall be made alive. Reference (1 Corinthians 15:22)

(2)The dead will be resurrected

Just for a moment, in the blink of an eye, When the trumpet sounds for the last time . For the trumpet will sound, The dead will be raised immortal , we also need to change. Reference (1 Corinthians 15:52)

(3) The dead in Christ will be resurrected first

Now we say this to you according to the word of the Lord: We who are alive and remain until the coming of the Lord will not precede those who have fallen asleep. For the Lord Himself will descend from heaven with a shout, with the voice of the archangel, and with the trumpet of God; The dead in Christ will be raised first . Reference (1 Thessalonians 4:15-16)

2. The corruptible, put on the incorruptible

【Put on immortality】

This corruptible must become (become: original text is wear ; Same below) Immortal , this mortal must become immortal. Reference (1 Corinthians 15:53)

3. Despicable ( Change ) to be glorious

(1)We are citizens of heaven

But we are citizens of heaven , and wait for the Savior, the Lord Jesus Christ, to come from heaven. Reference (Philippians 3:20)

(2) humble →change shape

He will make us The humble body changes shape , similar to His own glorious body. Reference (Philippians 3:21)

4. (Death) is swallowed up by the life of Christ

ask: (Death) was swallowed up by whom?
answer: " die " Resurrected by Christ and swallowed up by the victorious life .

(1)Death is swallowed up by victory

When this corruptible has put on incorruption, and this mortal has put on immortality, then it is written: The words "death is swallowed up in victory" have come true. . Reference (1 Corinthians 15:54)

(2) This mortal is swallowed up by life

When we groan and labor in this tent, we are not willing to put off this, but to put on that. that this mortal might be swallowed up by life . Reference (2 Corinthians 5:4)

5. Mentioning meeting the Lord in the clouds

【 Rapture of Living Christians 】

From now on we will Those who are alive and remain will be caught up with them in the clouds , meeting the Lord in the air. In this way, we will be with the Lord forever. Reference (1 Thessalonians 4:17)

6. We will surely see the true form of the Lord

【 When the Lord appears, our bodies also appear 】
→→We must see his true form!

Dear brothers, we are God’s children now, and what we will be like in the future has not yet been revealed, but we know that If the Lord appears, we will be like Him, for we will see Him as He is . Reference (1 John 3:2)

7. We will be with the Lord forever! Amen

(1) God will be with us personally

And I heard a loud voice from the throne saying, “Behold, the tabernacle of God is with men. He will dwell with them, and they will be his people. God himself will be with them and be their God . Reference (Revelation 21:3)

(2) No more death

God will wipe away every tear from their eyes; no more death , and there will be no more mourning, crying, or pain, for the past things have passed away. "Reference (Revelation 21:4)

articles.author: admin
articles.content:
Peace to my dear brothers and sisters in God’s family! Amen

Let’s open the Bible to Revelation Chapter 11, verse 15, and read together: The seventh angel blew his trumpet, and there was a loud voice in heaven saying, “The kingdoms of this world have become the kingdoms of our Lord and of His Christ, and He shall reign forever and ever. Amen!

Today we will study, fellowship, and share together "The Second Coming of Jesus" No. 2 Speak and offer a prayer: Dear Abba Heavenly Father, our Lord Jesus Christ, thank you that the Holy Spirit is always with us! Amen. Thank you Lord! A virtuous woman【 church 】Send out workers: through the word of truth written in their hands and spoken by them, which is the gospel of our salvation, glory, and redemption of our bodies. Food is transported from the sky from afar and supplied to us at the right time to make our spiritual life richer! Amen. Ask the Lord Jesus to continue to illuminate the eyes of our souls and open our minds to understand the Bible so that we can hear and see spiritual truths: Let all God’s children understand that day 1 The Lamb opens the seven seals, 2 The seven angels blew their trumpets, 3 The seven angels poured out the bowls, and God's mysterious things were completed - and then the Lord Jesus Christ came! Amen . The above prayers, supplications, intercessions, thanks, and blessings! I ask this in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ! Amen

1. The Lamb opens the seventh seal

When the Lamb opens the seventh seal , the sky was silent for about two moments. And I saw seven angels standing before God, and seven trumpets were given to them. Reference (Revelation 8:1-2)

ask: What happened for about two moments of silence in the sky?
answer: Detailed explanation below

(1) There are seven trumpets given to seven angels
(2) All the saints put on the fragrance of Christ and come before God
(3) The angel took the censer, filled it with fire from the altar, and poured it on the ground .

Another angel came with a golden censer and stood beside the altar. Much incense was given to him to offer with the prayers of all the saints on the golden altar before the throne. The smoke of the incense and the prayers of the saints ascended from the angel's hand to God . The angel took the censer, filled it with fire from the altar, and poured it out on the earth; and there were thunderings, loud noises, lightnings, and earthquakes. Reference (Revelation 8:3-5)

2. The seventh angel blows the trumpet

(1)The trumpet sounded loudly for the last time
(2) The kingdom of this world has become the kingdom of our Lord and His Christ
(3) Jesus Christ will reign as king forever and ever
(4)The twenty-four elders worship God

The seventh angel blew his trumpet, and a loud voice from heaven said, “ The kingdoms of this world have become the kingdoms of our Lord and of His Christ ; He will reign forever and ever. "The twenty-four elders who were sitting in their seats before God fell on their faces to the ground and worshiped God, saying, "O Lord God, the Almighty, who was and is, we thank you! Because you hold great power and become king. The nations are angry, and your wrath has come, and the hour of judgment of the dead has come; and the hour of reward for your servants the prophets and the saints, the great and the small, who fear your name; The time has come for those who will corrupt the world. "Reference (Revelation 11:15-18)

3. The seventh angel poured the bowl into the air

The seventh angel poured out his bowl into the air, and a loud voice came from the throne in the temple, saying, “ It’s done ! "Reference (Revelation 16:17)

ask: What happened [is done]!
answer: Detailed explanation below

(1) God’s mysterious things have been accomplished

The angel whom I saw walking on the sea and on the earth raised his right hand to heaven and swore by him who created heaven and everything in it, and earth and everything on earth, and the sea and everything in it, who lives forever and ever, saying : “There is no more time (or translation: no more delay).” But when the seventh angel blows his trumpet, God’s mystery will be completed, just as God has preached the good news to his servants the prophets. . Reference (Revelation 10:5-7)

(2)The kingdom of this world has become the kingdom of our Lord Christ

The seventh angel blew his trumpet, and there was a loud voice in heaven saying, "The kingdoms of this world have become the kingdom of our Lord and of his Christ, and he will reign forever and ever." Reference (Revelation 11:15)

(3)The Lord our God, the Almighty, reigns

A voice came from the throne, saying, "Praise our God, all you servants of God, everyone who fears Him, both great and small!" And I heard what sounded like the voice of a crowd, the sound of many waters, and the sound of great thunder, saying, " Hallelujah! For the Lord our God, the Almighty, reigns.” Reference (Revelation 19:5-6).

(4)The time has come for the marriage of the Lamb

(5)The bride has also prepared herself

(6) Graced to be clothed in fine linen, bright and pure

(7) The church (the bride) is raptured

Let us rejoice and give Him glory. For the marriage of the Lamb has come, and the bride has made herself ready, and it has been given her grace to clothe herself in fine linen, bright and white. (The fine linen is the righteousness of the saints.) The angel said to me, “Write: Blessed are those who are invited to the marriage supper of the Lamb ! ” And he said to me, “This is the true word of God.” ” Reference (Revelation 19:7-9)

articles.title: The Second Coming of Jesus (Lecture 1)
articles.author: admin
articles.content:
Peace to my dear brothers and sisters in God’s family! Amen.

Let’s open the Bible to Matthew Chapter 24 and verse 30 and read together: At that time the sign of the Son of Man will appear in heaven, and all the tribes of the earth will mourn. They will see the Son of Man coming on the clouds of heaven with power and great glory .

Today we will study, fellowship, and share together "The Second Coming of Jesus" No. 1 Speak and offer a prayer: Dear Abba Heavenly Father, our Lord Jesus Christ, thank you that the Holy Spirit is always with us! Amen. Thank you Lord! The virtuous woman [the church] sends out workers: through their hands they write and speak the word of truth, the gospel of our salvation, our glory, and the redemption of our bodies. Food is transported from the sky from afar and supplied to us at the right time to make our spiritual life richer! Amen. Ask the Lord Jesus to continue to illuminate the eyes of our souls, open our minds to understand the Bible, and enable us to hear and see spiritual truths: Let all children understand that day and wait for the coming of the Lord Jesus Christ! Amen.

The above prayers, supplications, intercessions, thanks, and blessings! I ask this in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ! Amen

1. The Lord Jesus comes on a cloud

ask: How did the Lord Jesus come?
Answer: Coming on the clouds!

(1)Behold, He is coming in the clouds
(2) All eyes want to see him
(3) They will see the Son of Man coming on the clouds of heaven with power and great glory.

Behold, He comes on clouds ! Every eye will see him, even those who pierced him; and all the families of the earth will mourn because of him. This is true. Amen! Reference (Revelation 1:7)

At that time the sign of the Son of Man will appear in heaven, and all the families of the earth will mourn. They will see the Son of Man with power and great glory, Coming on the clouds from the sky . Reference (Matthew 24:30)

2. How he went, how he will come again

(1) Jesus ascended to heaven

ask: How did Jesus ascend to heaven after his resurrection?
answer: A cloud took him away
(Jesus) had said this, and while they were looking, He was taken up , A cloud took him away , and he can no longer be seen. Reference (Acts 1:9)

(2) Angels testified how he came

ask: How did the Lord Jesus come?
answer: Just as you saw him going up to heaven, so he will come again.

As he was going up and they were looking intently into heaven, suddenly two men in white robes stood nearby and said, "Men of Galilee, why do you stand looking up into heaven? This Jesus, who has been taken up from you into heaven, Just as you saw him going up to heaven, so will he come back in the same way . "Reference (Acts 1:10-11)

Three: Once the disasters of those days are over

(1) The sun will become dark, the moon will not give its light, and the stars will fall from the sky .

ask: When will the disaster be over?
answer: Detailed explanation below
1 Vision of 2300 Days --Daniel 8:26
2 Those days will be shortened --Matthew 24:22
3 one year, two years, half a year --Daniel 7:25
4 There must be 1290 days - -Dan. 12:11.

" Once the disaster of those days is over , the sun will be darkened, the moon will not give its light, the stars will fall from the sky, and the powers of the sky will be shaken. Reference (Matthew 24:29)

(2) The three lights will retreat

On that day, there will be no light, and the three lights will retreat . That day will be known to the LORD; it will not be day or night, but there will be light in the evening. Reference (Zechariah 14:6-7)

4. At that time, the sign of the Son of Man will appear in heaven

ask: What Omen Appear in heaven?
answer: Detailed explanation below

(1) Lightning originates from the east and shines directly to the west

Lightning comes from the east , shining directly to the west. So it will be with the coming of the Son of Man. Reference (Matthew 24:27)

(2)The angel’s trumpet sounded loudly for the last time

He will send his messengers, Loud with a trumpet , gathering his chosen people from all directions (square: wind in the original text), from one side of the sky to the other side of the sky. "Reference (Matthew 24:31)

(3) Everything in heaven, on earth, and under the earth will see the Son of Man coming on clouds with power and great glory. .

At that time, The sign of the Son of Man will appear in heaven Go up, and all the peoples of the earth will weep. They will see the Son of Man coming on the clouds of heaven with power and great glory. Reference (Matthew 24:30)

5. Coming with all the messengers

ask: Who did Jesus bring with him when he came?
answer: Detailed explanation below

(1) Those who have fallen asleep in Jesus are brought together
If we believe that Jesus died and rose again, even those who have fallen asleep in Jesus God will also bring with him. Reference (1 Thessalonians 4:14)

(2) Coming with all the messengers
When the Son of Man comes in the glory of his Father and his angels with him, he will reward everyone according to their deeds. Reference (Matthew 16:27)

(3) The arrival of thousands of saints brought by the Lord
Enoch, the seventh descendant of Adam, prophesied about these people, saying: “Behold, the Lord is coming with thousands of His holy ones. Reference (Jude 1:14)

As it was in the days of Noah, so it will be when the Son of Man comes. In the days before the flood, people were eating, drinking, marrying and giving in marriage as usual until the day Noah entered the ark. Unknowingly, the flood came and swept them all away. So it will be with the coming of the Son of Man. Reference (Matthew 24:37-39)

I looked and saw the heavens opened. There is a white horse, and the one who rides on it is called honest and truthful , He judges and makes war in righteousness. He was clothed in clothes splattered with blood; his name was the Word of God. All the armies in heaven follow him, riding on white horses and clothed in fine linen, white and clean. From his mouth comes a sharp sword to smite the nations. He will rule over them with a rod of iron, and he will tread the winepress of the wrath of Almighty God. On his garment and on his thigh was a name written: "King of kings and Lord of lords." (Revelation 19:11-16)

8. But no one knows that day and hour.

(1) No one knows that day and hour .
(2) It is not for you to know the days that the Father has appointed .
(3)Only the Father knows .

When they were gathered together, they asked Jesus, "Lord, will you restore the kingdom to Israel at this time?" Jesus said to them, " It is not for you to know the times and dates that the Father has set by his own authority. . Reference (Acts 1:6-7)

“But of that day and hour no one knows, not even the angels in heaven, nor the Son; Only the Father knows . Reference (Matthew 24: Chapter 36)

The seventh angel poured out his bowl into the air, and a loud voice came from the throne in the temple, saying, "It is finished!" Reference (Revelation 16:17)

ask: What happened [is done]!

ask: How big an earthquake was?
answer: There has never been an earthquake this big and powerful since there were people on the earth.
There were lightnings, voices, thunderings, and a great earthquake. There had not been such a great and powerful earthquake since the beginning of the earth's history. Reference (Revelation 16:18)

3. Babylon the Great fell

1 The cities of the nations have fallen

The great city was torn in three parts, and all the cities of the nations collapsed; and God remembered the great city of Babylon, that he might give it the cup of his wrath. The islands have fled, and the mountains have disappeared. And large hailstones fell from heaven on people, each one weighing about a talent (a talent is about ninety pounds). Because of the great plague of hail, people blasphemed God. Reference (Revelation 16:19-21)

After that, I saw another angel coming down from heaven with great authority, and the earth shone with his glory. He shouted with a loud voice: "Babylon, the great city, has fallen! It has fallen! The sixth angel poured out the bowl

ask: Where is the great river Euphrates?
answer: The area around present-day Syria

ask: Why did the river dry up?
answer: When the river dries up and becomes land, people and vehicles can walk on it. This is the road prepared by God for the kings.

ask: Where did the kings come from?
answer: He who comes from the rising of the sun →from the kingdom of Satan and the kingdom of the beast and all the peoples and languages of the world, The kings of the nations and the earth are called kings .
