ask: What does Armageddon mean?
answer: " Armageddon ” refers to the three demons who called the kings to gather together.

(1)Three unclean spirits

And I saw three unclean spirits like frogs coming out of the mouth of the dragon, and out of the mouth of the beast, and out of the mouth of the false prophet. Reference (Revelation 16:13)

(2) Go out to the whole world to confuse the kings

ask: Who are the three unclean spirits?
answer: They are spirits of demons.

ask: What are the three unclean spirits doing?
answer: Go out to all the kings of the world and deceive the kings of the nations so that they can gather for war on the great day of God’s Almighty.

They are demonic spirits who work wonders and go out to all the kings of the world to gather for war on the great day of God the Almighty. Behold, I come like a thief. Blessed is he who watches and keeps his clothes, so that he does not walk naked and be seen to shame! The three demons gathered the kings together in a place called Armageddon in Hebrew. Reference (Revelation 16:14-16)

-------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------- ---

(3) The King of kings and all the armies rode against them on white horses.

I looked and saw the heavens opened. There was a white horse, and his rider was called Faithful and True, who judges and makes war in righteousness. His eyes are like a flame of fire, and on his head are many crowns; and there is a name written that no one knows but himself. He was clothed in clothes splattered with blood; his name was the Word of God. All the armies in heaven follow him, riding on white horses and clothed in fine linen, white and clean. From his mouth comes a sharp sword to smite the nations. He will rule over them with a rod of iron, and he will tread the winepress of the wrath of Almighty God. On his garment and on his thigh was a name written: "King of kings and Lord of lords." Reference (Revelation 19:11-16)

(4)The birds in the sky are full of their meat

And I saw an angel standing in the sun, shouting with a loud voice to the birds of the sky, saying, “Assemble yourself to the great banquet of God; eat the flesh of kings and generals, the flesh of mighty men, and the flesh of horses and their riders; and the flesh of both free and slave, and of every people, great and small.” And I saw the beast, and the kings of the earth, and all their armies gathered together to make war against the man who sat on the white horse, and against his army. The beast was captured, and with him the false prophet, who worked wonders in his presence to deceive those who had received the mark of the beast and those who worshiped his image. Two of them were thrown alive into the lake of fire burning with brimstone; the rest were slain with the sword that came out of the mouth of the one who sat on the white horse; and the birds were filled with their flesh. Reference (Revelation 19:17-21)

The above prayers, supplications, intercessions, thanks, and blessings! I ask this in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ! Amen

1. The seven last plagues

Revelation [Chapter 15:1]
And I saw a vision in heaven, great and strange: The seven angels control the seven last plagues , because God’s wrath was exhausted in these seven plagues.

ask: What are the seven last plagues controlled by the seven angels?
answer: God is angry seven golden bowls → Bring down seven plagues .

One of the four living creatures gave to the seven angels seven golden bowls filled with the wrath of God who lives forever and ever. The temple was filled with smoke because of the glory and power of God. So no one could enter the temple until the seven plagues caused by the seven angels were completed. Reference (Revelation 15:7-8)

2. The seven plagues sent by the seven angels

ask: What are the seven plagues brought by the seven angels?
answer: Detailed explanation below

The first angel poured out the bowl

And I heard a loud voice coming out of the temple, saying to the seven angels, "Go and pour out the seven bowls of the wrath of God on the earth." Reference (Revelation 16:1)

(1)Pour the bowl on the ground

Then the first angel went and poured out his bowl on the ground, and evil and poisonous sores appeared on those who had the mark of the beast and worshiped his image. Reference (Revelation 16:2)

(2) There are vicious sores on those who bear the mark of the beast

ask: What is a person who bears the mark of the beast?
answer: mark of the beast 666 →Those who have received the mark of the beast on their foreheads or hands.

It also causes everyone, big or small, rich or poor, free or slave, to receive a mark on their right hand or on their forehead. No one may buy or sell except he who has the mark, the name of the beast, or the number of the beast's name. Here is wisdom: whoever understands, let him calculate the number of the beast; for it is the number of a man; six hundred and sixty six . Reference (Revelation 13:16-18)

ask: What will happen if hail and fire mixed with blood are thrown to the ground?
answer: A third of the earth and a third of the trees were burned, and all the green grass was burned.

articles.author: admin
articles.content:

Revelation [Chapter 8:6] The seven angels with the seven trumpets were ready to blow.

1. Trumpet

ask: What is the Seven-branched Trumpet?
answer: " Number ” refers to trumpet meaning, the seven angels with seven trumpets in their hands were ready to blow.

ask: What is a trumpet?
answer: Detailed explanation below

(1)For war

The wind instrument used to convey orders in the army in the old days was in the shape of a tube with a thin tube and a large mouth. It was first made of bamboo, wood, etc., and later made of copper, silver or gold.
The LORD said to Moses, “You are to make two trumpets of silver, hammered trumpets, to call the congregation and to set the camp in motion. When you blow these trumpets, the entire congregation will come to you and assemble in the congregation. At the entrance of the tabernacle. If you blow a single blow, all the leaders of the army of Israel will gather to you. When you blow a loud sound, all the camps on the east side will move out... To fight against your enemies who oppress you, blow the trumpet with a loud voice , in remembrance before the LORD your God, Also saved from the enemy . Reference (Numbers 10:1-5, 9 and 31:6)

Numbers [Chapter 31:6] So Moses sent a thousand men from each tribe fight , and sent Phinehas son of Eleazar the priest with him; Phinehas had in his hand the vessels of the sanctuary and blow the trumpet loudly .

(2) Used for praise

Instrumental music played in the Old Testament was called " horn ”, blow the trumpet and praise God.

Also offer burnt offerings and peace offerings on your happy days and feasts and on your new moons. blow the trumpet , and this shall be a memorial before your God. I am the LORD your God. ” Reference (Numbers 10:10 and 1 Chronicles 15:28)

2. Blow the trumpet loudly

ask: What does it mean when an angel blows his trumpet?
Answer: Gather Christians from one side of heaven to the other side of heaven .

He will send his messenger with the sound of a trumpet, his electorate , from all directions (square: the original text is wind), They are all gathered from this side of the sky to the other side of the sky . "Reference (Matthew 24:31)

3. The last trumpet blowing

ask: trumpet last ring What will happen to us?
Answer: Jesus comes and our bodies are redeemed! Amen!

Detailed explanation below

(1)The dead will be resurrected
(2) Become immortal
(3) Our bodies need to change

(4)Death is swallowed up by the life of Christ

Just for a moment, in the blink of an eye, the trumpet last blow time. For the trumpet will sound, The dead will be raised immortal , we also need to change. This corruptible must become (become: original text is wear ; the same below) immortal, this mortal must put on immortality. When this corruptible has put on incorruption, and this mortal has put on immortality, then it is written: Death is swallowed up by victory "The words came true. Reference (1 Corinthians 15:52-54)

(5) Be caught up together in the clouds to meet the Lord
For the Lord Himself will descend from heaven with a shout, with the voice of the archangel, and with the trumpet of God; and the dead in Christ will rise first. Afterwards we who are alive and remain will be caught up together with them in the clouds to meet the Lord in the air. In this way, we will be with the Lord forever. Reference (1 Thessalonians 4:16-17)

(6) We will surely see the true nature of the Lord

Dear brothers, we are God’s children now, and what we will be like in the future has not yet been revealed; but We know that if the Lord appears, we will be like Him because we will see Him as He is . Reference (1 John 3:2)

(7) In the kingdom of God’s beloved Son, we will be with the Lord forever.

answer: " fragrant "In the Old Testament, it refers to pure and holy incense, the smell of chime incense acceptable to Jehovah God. Many" fragrant "That is, much fragrance, a fragrance acceptable to God. Amen!

The LORD said to Moses, "Take the sweet-smelling spices, Natapheth, Shiheleth, and Sherebena. The sweet-smelling spices and the pure frankincense shall be in equal quantities. You shall take these and add salt to them. Make pure and holy incense according to the method of making incense. Reference (Exodus 30:34-35).

ask: What does "many incense" mean?
answer: " fragrant "It refers to the saints, of whom there are many" fragrant "There are many prayers of saints.

When he had taken the scroll, the four living creatures and the twenty-four elders fell down before the Lamb, each having a harp and a golden pot full of incense, which was the prayer of all the saints. Reference (Revelation 5:8)

ask: What does the smoke of incense and the prayers of the saints rising up to God symbolize?
answer: Detailed explanation below

( 1 )" fragrant "Saying of the saints, pure and holy" fragrant ” is a symbol of clean and holy saints.
( 2 )" fragrant smoke "That is, Christians have the fragrance of Christ in their bodies.
( 3 )" Prayers of the Saints "It is the fragrant aroma and spiritual sacrifices that are acceptable to God when Christians pray in the Holy Spirit! Ascending to God together means that saints and Christians come to the Father together. Amen!

Revelation [6:12-14] When he opened the sixth seal, I saw a great earthquake. The sun turned black like wool, and the full moon turned red like blood , The stars in the sky fall to the ground , just as the fig tree drops its unripe fruit when shaken by the strong wind. And the heavens were removed, like a scroll rolled up; and the mountains and islands were removed from their places.

1. Earthquake

ask: What does the earthquake mean?
answer:" Earthquake "It was a great earthquake. There had been no such earthquake since the beginning of the world, and the mountains and islands were moved out of their place.

Behold, the LORD has made the earth empty and made it desolate; he has turned it over and scattered its inhabitants. … The earth will be completely empty and desolate ; for this is what the LORD says. …The earth was completely devastated, everything cracked, and it was greatly shaken. The earth will toss to this side like a drunkard and it will rock to and fro like a hammock. If sin weighs heavily on it, it will surely collapse and never rise again. Reference (Isaiah Chapter 24 Verses 1, 3, 19-20)

Two and three lights will retreat

Zechariah [Chapter 14:6] On that day, there will be no light, and the three lights will retreat .

ask: What does three-light withdrawal mean?
answer: Detailed explanation below

(1)The sun becomes dark →Like woolen cloth
(2)The moon does not shine either →turns red like blood
(3)The stars will fall from the sky →Like figs falling
(4) The heavenly forces will shake and move →As if the scroll was rolled up

“When the calamity of those days is over, the sun will be darkened, and the moon will not give its light, and the stars will fall from the sky, and the powers of the heaven will be shaken . Reference (Matthew 24:29)

3. The great day of wrath has come

Revelation [Chapter 6:15-17] The kings of the earth, their princes, their generals, their rich men, their mighty men, and every slave and every free man, hid themselves in caves and in cavities of rocks, and said to the mountains and rocks, "Fall On us! Hide us from the face of him who sits on the throne, and from the wrath of the Lamb; For the great day of their wrath has come, and who can stand? "

(1) Death by cutting off two-thirds

“All the people of the earth,” says the LORD, Two-thirds will be cut off and die , one third will remain. Reference (Zechariah 13:8)

(2) One third is refined by Ao

I want to make this One-third passed through the fire to refine them , as silver is refined; try them as gold is tried. They will call on my name, and I will answer them. I will say: 'These are my people. ’ They will also say, ‘The Lord is our God. ’” Reference (Zechariah 13:9)

(3) None of the fundamental branches remain

“That day is coming,” declares the LORD of hosts, “like a burning furnace, and all the arrogant and evildoers will be like stubble; they will be burned up in that day. None of the root branches remain . Reference (Malachi 4:1)

Looking forward eagerly for the day of God to come. On that day, The sky will be destroyed by the fire, and all the material things will be melted by the fire. . Reference (2 Peter 3:12)

articles.author: admin
articles.content:

Man, how long will it take to avenge our bloodshed?”

Amen. Thank you Lord! Amen!

【Fifth Seal】

Revealed: To avenge the souls of those who were slain for the word of God, they must be clothed in fine, white linen.

1. Being killed for bearing witness to the way of God

Revelation [Chapter 6:9-10] When the fifth seal was opened, I saw under the altar the souls of those who had been killed for the word of God and for the testimony, shouting with a loud voice, "Holy and true Lord, how long will it take until you judge those who live on the earth and avenge our blood?”

ask: Who avenges the saints?
Answer: God avenges the saints .

Dear brother, do not avenge yourself, rather give in and allow the Lord to be angry (or translated: let others be angry); for it is written: "Vengeance is mine, says the Lord, and I will repay.'" Reference (Romans 12) Section 19)

ask: What are the souls of those who were killed for the word of God and for bearing witness?
answer: Detailed explanation below

(1)Abel was killed

Cain was talking to his brother Abel; they were in the field. Cain got up and struck his brother Abel, killing him. Reference (Genesis 4:8)

(2)The prophets were killed

“O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, you who kill prophets and stone those who are sent to you. How many times have I wished to gather your children together, as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, but you will not Yes. Reference (Matthew 23:37)

(3) Revealing the seventy weeks and seven weeks and the sixty-two weeks, the Anointed One was killed

“Seventy weeks are decreed for your people and your holy city, to finish the transgression, to put an end to sin, to make atonement for iniquity, to bring in everlasting righteousness, to seal up vision and prophecy, and Anoint the Holy One. You should know it. Understand that from the time the command is given to rebuild Jerusalem until the time of the Anointed King, there will be seven weeks and sixty-two weeks. In the time of trouble, Jerusalem will be rebuilt, including its streets and fortresses. Seven, that (or translated: there) The anointed one will be cut off , there will be nothing left; a king’s people will come and destroy the city and the sanctuary, and they will eventually be swept away like a flood. There will be a battle to the end, and desolation has been decided. (Daniel 9:24-26)

(4) Apostles and Christians were killed and persecuted

1 Stephen was killed
While they were stoning, Stephen called to the Lord and said, "Lord Jesus, please receive my soul!" Then he knelt down and shouted loudly, "Lord, do not hold this sin against them!" After saying this, Just fell asleep. Saul also rejoiced in his death. Reference (Acts 7:59-60)
2 Jacob was killed
At that time, King Herod harmed several people in the church and killed John's brother James with a sword. Reference (Acts 12:1-2)

3 saints slain
Others endured mockings, scourgings, chains, imprisonment, and other trials, were stoned to death, were sawn to death, were tempted, were slain with the sword, walked about in sheep and goat skins, suffered poverty, tribulation, and pain Harm, reference (Hebrews 11:36-37)

2. God avenged the slain and gave them white robes

Revelation [Chapter 6:11] Then white robes were given to each of them, and it was said to them that they would rest a little while longer, until their fellow servants and their brethren who should be killed like them, so that their number might be fulfilled.

ask: White robes were given to them, " white clothes "What does it mean?"
answer: “White garments” are bright and white fine linen garments, put on the new man and put on Christ! For the word of God, and the righteous deeds of the saints who bear witness to the gospel, you will be clothed with fine linen, bright and white. (The fine linen is the righteousness of the saints.) Reference (Revelation 19:8)

like the high priest" Joshua "Put on new clothes → Joshua stood before the messenger in filthy clothes (referring to the old man). The messenger commanded those standing before him, "Take off his filthy clothes"; and to Joshua Said: “I have freed you from your sins and I have clothed you with beautiful garments (referring to fine linen, bright and white). "Reference (Zechariah 3:3-4)

3. Killed to satisfy the number

ask: Like they were killed, what does it mean to fulfill the number?
answer: The number is fulfilled →The number of glory is fulfilled.

like( old testament ) God sent all the prophets to be killed, ( New Testament ) God sent His only begotten Son, Jesus, to be killed → Many of the apostles and Christians sent by Jesus were persecuted or killed for the truth of the gospel. If we suffer with Him, we will be glorified with Him.

(1) The salvation of the Gentiles has been completed.

Brothers, I do not want you to be ignorant of this mystery (lest you think you are wise), that the Israelites are somewhat hard-hearted; until the number of the Gentiles is full , so all the Israelites will be saved. As it is written: "A Savior will come out of Zion and will wipe out all the sin of the house of Jacob." Reference (Romans 11:25-26)

(2) Jesus, the servant sent by God, was killed

And you will be saved by this gospel, if you do not believe in vain but hold fast what I preach to you. What I also delivered to you is: First, that Christ died for our sins according to the Scriptures, and that he was buried, and that he was raised on the third day according to the Scriptures (1 Corinthians Chapter 15, verses 2-4)

( 3) Suffer with Christ and you will be glorified with Him

The Holy Spirit bears witness with our spirit that we are children of God; and if we are children, we are heirs, heirs of God and joint heirs with Christ. If we suffer with Him, we will also be glorified with Him. Reference (Romans 8:16-17)

articles.author: admin
articles.content:

Let’s open the Bible to Revelation 5:5 and read it together: One of the elders said to me, “Don’t cry! Behold, the Lion of the tribe of Judah, the Root of David, (Lamb) He has overcome , Able to open the scroll and open the seven seals .

Today we will study, fellowship, and share together "Seven Seals" Pray: Dear Abba, Holy Heavenly Father, our Lord Jesus Christ, thank you that the Holy Spirit is always with us! Amen. Thank you Lord! A virtuous woman【 church 】Send out workers: through the word of truth written in their hands and spoken by them, which is the gospel of our salvation, glory, and redemption of our bodies. Food is transported from the sky from afar and supplied to us at the right time to make our spiritual life richer! Amen. Ask the Lord Jesus to continue to illuminate the eyes of our souls and open our minds to understand the Bible so that we can hear and see spiritual truths: Understand the visions and prophecies of the Book of Revelation where the Lord Jesus opened the seven seals of the book. Amen!

The above prayers, supplications, intercessions, thanksgivings, and blessings! I ask this in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ! Amen

"Seven Seals"

The Lamb is worthy to open the seven seals

1. [Seal]

ask: What is seal?
answer: " print " refers to the seals, seals, brands, and imprints that ancient officials, monarchs, and emperors usually made of gold and jade seals.

Song of Songs [8:6] Please keep me in your heart as imprint , wear it on your arm like a stamp...!

2. [Seal]

ask: What is a seal?
answer: " seal "Biblical interpretation refers to using God's ( print ) to seal, seal, seal, hide and seal.

(1) Seventy seven visions and prophecies sealed

"Seventy weeks are decreed for your people and your holy city, to put an end to sin, to put an end to sin, to make atonement for iniquity, and to introduce (or translate: reveal) everlasting righteousness, Seal visions and prophecies , and anoint the Holy One. Reference (Daniel 9:24)

(2) The vision of 2300 days is sealed

The vision of 2,300 days is true, but You have to seal this vision , because it concerns many days to come. "Reference (Daniel 8:26)

(3) One time, two time, half a time, has been hidden and sealed until the end

I heard the one standing over the water, clothed in fine linen, lift up his left and right hands toward heaven and swear by the Lord who lives forever, saying, " One year, two years, half a year , when the power of the saints is broken, all these things will be fulfilled. When I heard this, I did not understand it, so I said, "My lord, what is the end of these things?" He said, "Daniel, go ahead; for These words have been hidden and sealed , until the end. Reference (Daniel 12:7-9)

(4)There will be one thousand two hundred and ninety days

From the time that the continual burnt offering is taken away and the abomination of desolation is set up, there will be one thousand two hundred and ninety days. Reference (Daniel 12:11)

(5) King Michael will stand up

“Then Michael, the archangel, who protects your people, will stand up, and there will be great trouble, such as has not been the case since the beginning of the nation until this time. Whoever is named among your people will Whoever is in the book will be saved. Reference (Daniel 12:1).

(6)One thousand three hundred and thirty-five days

Blessed is he who waits until the one thousand three hundred and thirty-fifth day. Reference (Daniel 12:12)

(7)Hide these words and seal this book

Many of those who sleep in the dust of the earth will awaken. Among them are some who have everlasting life, and some who are shamed and detested forever... Daniel, you must Hide these words, seal this book , until the end. Many will be running to and fro (or translated as: earnestly studying), and knowledge will increase. "Reference (Daniel 12:2-4)

3. The scroll is sealed with [seven seals]

(1) Who is worthy to open the scroll and loose its seven seals?

And I saw in the right hand of him who sat on the throne a scroll, written on the inside and on the outside, and sealed with seven seals. Then I saw a powerful angel proclaiming with a loud voice, "Who is worthy to open the book and loose its seals?" Reference (Revelation 5:1-2)

(2) When John saw that no one was worthy to open the book, he cried loudly

There is no one in heaven, on earth, or under the earth who can open the book or look at it. Because there was no one worthy to open or look at the scroll, I burst into tears. Reference (Revelation 5:3-4)

(3) The elders told John who could open the seven seals

One of the elders said to me, "Don't weep! Behold, the Lion of the tribe of Judah, the Root of David, (Lamb) He has overcome , Able to open the scroll and open the seven seals . "Reference (Revelation 5:5)

(4)Four living creatures

There was like a sea of glass before the throne, like crystal. In the throne and around the throne were four living creatures, full of eyes front and back. Reference (Revelation 4:6)

ask: What are the four living creatures?
answer: Angel- Cherubim .

Each of the cherubim had four faces: the first was the face of a cherub, the second was the face of a man, the third was the face of a lion, and the fourth was the face of an eagle. . Reference (Ezekiel 10:14)

(5) The four living creatures symbolize the four gospels

ask: What do the four living creatures symbolize?
answer: Detailed explanation below

The first living creature was like a lion
Symbolizing the Gospel of Matthew →→ jesus is king
The second living creature was like a calf
Symbolizing the Gospel of Mark →→ jesus is a servant

ask: What are the pleasures of sin?

ask: How to distinguish the pleasure of sin from the joy of enjoying God?
answer: Detailed explanation below

1. The flesh has been sold to sin

We know that the law is of the spirit, but I am of the flesh and have been sold to sin. Reference (Romans 7:14) → For example, Moses in Egypt was the son of Pharaoh’s children, and Egypt represents the world, the sinful world. When the Israelite Moses grew up, he knew that he was God’s chosen people, a holy chosen people. He refused to be called the son of Pharaoh's children and enjoy the wealth of Egypt → including all the knowledge, learning, food, drink and pleasure of Egypt. He would rather suffer with God's people than temporarily enjoy the pleasures of sin. When he saw the suffering of the people, he saw the humiliation of Christ → He refused to be the son of Pharaoh's children and fled Egypt to the wilderness at the age of 40. After 40 years of tending sheep in Midian, he forgot his identity as a son and daughter of the Egyptian Pharaoh, and forgot all the knowledge, learning and talents in Egypt. Only when he was 80 years old did God call him to lead the Israelites out of Egypt. Just as the Lord Jesus said: "Truly I say to you, whoever is not like a child will not be able to enter the kingdom of God." Only God used Moses to turn back to the likeness of a child. The likeness of a child is weakness and does not rely on worldly knowledge and learning. and wisdom, relying solely on God’s wisdom. So, do you understand?
Moses is the son of Pharaoh's children, which typifies the flesh sold to sin, and the flesh enjoying the sinful Egyptian king's possessions and all the food, drink, play, and pleasures. The physical enjoyment of these pleasures → is called enjoying the pleasure of sin!
Therefore, Moses refused to be the son of Pharaoh's children, but was willing to suffer in the flesh with the people → because he who suffered in the flesh has ceased from sin. Reference (1 Peter Chapter 4:1), do you understand this?

Give thanks always to God the Father for everything in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.

Let’s open the Bible to Matthew Chapter 18 Verse 3 and read it together. “Jesus” said, “Truly I say to you, unless you turn around and become like little children, you will never enter the kingdom of heaven.

Be renewed in your mind, and put on the new self, created after the image of God in true righteousness and holiness. Refer to Ephesians 4:23-24

Just as the body is one but has many members, and even though the members are many, they are still one body, so it is with Christ. Whether we are Jews or Greeks, whether we are slaves or free, we are all baptized by one Holy Spirit, become one body, and drink of one Holy Spirit. Refer to 1 Corinthians 12:12-13

He gave some apostles, some prophets, some evangelists, some pastors and teachers, to equip the saints for the work of ministry, and to build up the body of Christ, until we all come to the unity of the faith and the knowledge of God His son grew up to a mature man, attaining to the stature of the fullness of Christ,... through whom the whole body is held together properly, with every joint serving its purpose, and each joint supporting one another according to the function of the whole body, so that the body may grow, and in Build yourself up in love. Like Christ raised from the dead through the glory of the Father. →Put on the new man, put on Christ, drink from one Holy Spirit, and become one body →It is the "Church of Jesus Christ" →Eat spiritual food and drink spiritual water in Christ, and grow into a mature man, full of the stature of the fullness of Christ → By Him the whole body is properly joined together, and every joint has its proper work, and helps one another according to the function of each part, so that the body may grow and build itself up in love. So, do you understand clearly?

Everyone helps each other and loves each other in Christ and runs together → look to Jesus, the author and finisher of our faith → run straight towards the cross, and we must To receive the prize of the high calling of God in Christ Jesus. The Israelites saw Moses' face shining. Moses covered his face with a veil again, and when he went in to speak with the Lord, he took off the veil.

ask: Why did Moses cover his face with a veil?
answer: When Aaron and all the Israelites saw the shining face of Moses, they were afraid to come near him

answer: For God is light, and the LORD spoke to him, and made his face shine → God is light, and there is no darkness in him. This is the message we have heard from the Lord and brought back to you. 1 John 1:5

answer: “Moses covered his face with a veil” indicates that Moses was the steward of the law written on the stone tablets, not the true image of the law. It also typifies that people cannot rely on Moses and observe the law of Moses to see the true image and see the glory of God → The law was originally preached through Moses; grace and truth came from Jesus Christ. (1) Parable of the Wedding Feast

Jesus also spoke to them in parables: “The kingdom of heaven is like a king who prepared a wedding banquet for his son, Matthew 22:1-2

ask: What does the king's wedding banquet for his son foreshadow?
answer: The marriage supper of Christ the Lamb→ Let us rejoice and give glory to Him. For the marriage of the Lamb has come, and the bride has made herself ready, and it has been given her grace to clothe herself in fine linen, bright and white. (The fine linen is the righteousness of the saints.) The angel said to me, “Write: Blessed are those who are invited to the marriage supper of the Lamb!” And he said to me, “This is the true word of God.” Revelation 19:7-9
So he sent his servants to invite those who were called to the banquet, but they refused to come. Matthew 22:3

ask: Send the servant Ephah. Who is this “servant”?
answer: Jesus Christ, the Son of God → My servant will walk wisely and he will be exalted and become the highest. Isaiah 52:13; “Behold, my servant, whom I have chosen, my beloved, the delight of my heart; I will put my Spirit on him; he will teach justice to the Gentiles. Matthew Gospel 12:18
Then the king sent other servants, saying, "Tell those who have been called that my banquet has been prepared. The oxen and fattened animals have been slaughtered, and everything is ready. Please come to the banquet." ’ Matthew 22:4

ask: Who was the “other servant” the king sent?
answer: The prophets sent by God in the Old Testament, the apostles sent by Jesus, Christians, and angels, etc.

1 Those who are called

Those people ignored him and left; one went to his field; the other went to do business; Matthew 22:5 → This is the "parable of the sower" spoken by Jesus → Some fell into thorns, and the thorns grew up and It chokes; those who were sown among thorns are those who hear the word, but later the cares of the world and the deceitfulness of money choke the word, and it cannot bear fruit → that is, it cannot bear "fruit * the fruit of the Spirit". The rest seized the servants, insulted them, and killed them. The king was furious and sent out troops to destroy the murderers and burn their city. Matthew 22:6-7

Revelation 19:19-21

So he said to his servants, "The wedding banquet is ready, but those who have been called are not worthy." Therefore go up to the fork in the road and call all you find to the banquet. ’ So the servants went out into the road and gathered together everyone they met, both good and evil, and the banquet was filled with guests. For many are called, but few are chosen. ” Matthew 22:14

articles.title: The law is spiritual, but I am carnal
articles.author: admin
articles.content:
Peace to my brothers and sisters in God’s family! Amen

Let’s open our Bible to Romans chapter 7 verse 14 We know that the law is of the spirit, but I am of the flesh and have been sold to sin.

Today we study, fellowship, and share "The Law is Spiritual" Pray: Dear Heavenly Father, our Lord Jesus Christ, thank you that the Holy Spirit is always with us! Amen. Thank the Lord for sending workers through the word of truth written and spoken by their hands → to give us the wisdom of the mystery of God that was hidden in the past, the word that God predestined for us to glory before all the ages! Revealed to us by the Holy Spirit. Amen! Ask the Lord Jesus to continue to illuminate our spiritual eyes and open our minds to understand the Bible so that we can see and hear spiritual truths → Understand that the law is spiritual, but I am fleshly and have been sold to sin. .

The above prayers, supplications, intercessions, thanks, and blessings! I ask this in the name of the Lord Jesus Christ! Amen

(1) The law is spiritual

We know that the law is of the spirit, but I am of the flesh and have been sold to sin. --Romans 7:14

ask: What does it mean that the law is spiritual?
answer: The law is of the spirit → “of” means belonging, and “of the spirit” → God is spirit – refer to John 4:24, which means that the law belongs to God.

ask: Why is the law spiritual and divine?
answer: Because the law was established by God → There is only one lawgiver and judge, the one who can save and destroy. Who are you to judge others? Reference - James 4:12 → God establishes laws and judges people. There is only one God who can save people or destroy them. Therefore, "the law is of the spirit and of God." So, do you understand clearly?

ask: For whom was the law established?
answer: The law was not made for oneself, not for the Son, nor for the righteous; it was made for "sinners" and "slaves of sin" → for the law was not made for the righteous, but for the lawless and disobedient, The ungodly and sinners, the unholy and worldly, parricide and murderers, adulterers and sodomites, snatchers and liars, perjurers, or any other thing that is contrary to righteousness. Note: In the beginning there was the Tao, and the “Tao” is God → The law was established as “things that are against the right way and against God.” So, do you understand clearly? Reference - 1 Timothy Chapter 1:9-10 (Unlike the foolish people in the world who think they are wise, they set up the law themselves, and then "put" the heavy yoke of the law around their necks. Breaking the law is sin → Convicting oneself, the wages of sin is death, killing oneself)

(2) But I am of the flesh

ask: But what does it mean that I am carnal?
answer: Spiritual living beings are also translated as fleshly living beings and fleshly living beings → It is also written in the Bible: “The first man, Adam, became a living being with spirit (spirit: or translated as flesh and blood)”; the last Adam became the life-giving spirit. Reference - 1 Corinthians 15:45 and Genesis 2:7 → So "Paul" said, But I am of the flesh, a living being of spirit, a living being of flesh, a living being of the flesh. So, do you understand clearly?

(3) It has been sold to sin

ask: When was my flesh sold to sin?
answer: Because when we are in the flesh, that is because “ law "and" born "of evil desires "that is selfish desires "works in our members to bear the fruit of death → When lust has conceived, it gives birth to sin; and when sin is fully grown, it gives birth to death. Therefore" crime " yes He who was born of the law , so, do you understand clearly? Reference - James chapter 1 verse 15 and Romans chapter 7 verse 5 → This is just like sin entered the world through one man, Adam, and death came from sin, so death came to everyone because everyone sinned crime. Romans 5 verse 12. We are all descendants of Adam and Eve. Our bodies are born from their parents and so have been sold to sin. So, do you understand clearly?

(4) Let the righteousness of the law be fulfilled in us who do not follow the flesh but only follow the Spirit . --Romans 8:4

ask: What does it mean to keep the righteousness of the law from conforming to the flesh?
answer: The law is holy, and the commandments are holy, righteous, and good - refer to Romans 7:12 → Since the law is weak because of the flesh, there are things it cannot do → because when we are in the flesh, that "because of the law" "Law" gives birth to evil customs, that is, selfish desires. When selfish desires are pregnant, they give birth to sins. "As long as you keep the law more and more, sins will be born." The law is to make people aware of sins and know good and evil. The wages of sin is death. Know Good and evil must die → Therefore, because of the weakness of human flesh, the law was unable to perform the "holiness, righteousness, and goodness" required by the law → God sent his own Son to become the likeness of sinful flesh and became a sin offering. Having condemned sin in the flesh → redeemed those who were under the law, that we might receive adoption as sons. Refer to Gal 4:5 and refer to Romans 8:3 → that the righteousness of the law may be fulfilled in us, who do not live according to the flesh but according to the Spirit. Amen!

ask: Why does the righteousness of the law follow only those who have the Spirit?
answer: The law is holy, righteous, and good→ the righteousness required by the law that is Love God and love your neighbor as yourself! Man cannot bear the righteousness of the law because of the weakness of the flesh, and the "righteousness of the law" can only follow those who are born of the Holy Spirit → Therefore, the Lord Jesus said that you must be born again so that the "righteousness of the law" can follow the children of God who are born of the Holy Spirit → Christ is one person " for "Everyone died → God made those who knew no sin, for We became sin so that we could become the righteousness of God in Him - refer to 2 Corinthians 5:21 → God made us in Christ → "become the righteousness of God". The law is spiritual and belongs to God. ; Since the law is a shadow of good things to come and is not the true image of the thing → the summary of the law is Christ, and the true image of the law is Christ → if I abide in Christ, I live in the true image of the law; if I do not live in "" shadow of law "Inside - refer to Hebrews 10:1 and Romans 10:4 → I abide in the image of the law: the law is holy, righteous, and good; Christ is holy, righteous, and good. Good, I abide in Christ and am a member of his body, "bone of his bones and flesh of his flesh"; I am also holy, righteous, and good → so God makes " the righteousness of the law ” This is accomplished in us who do not walk according to the flesh but according to the Spirit. Amen! Do you understand this clearly? Reference – Romans 8:4.

Note: The sermon preached in this article is very important and is related to whether you are in the millennium or not." forward "Resurrection; Still in the Millennium" back "Resurrection. Millennium" forward "The resurrection has the authority to judge → Why do you have the authority to judge? So since the priesthood has been changed, the law must also be changed. Jesus became a priest, not according to the ordinances of the flesh, but according to the power of infinite life. The previous ordinances were abolished because they were weak and useless. The law had accomplished nothing and introduced a better hope! Dear friend! Peace to all brothers and sisters! Amen

We opened the Bible [Deuteronomy 5:1-3] and read together: Moses called all the Israelites together and said to them, "O Israel, listen to the statutes and judgments that I am telling you today, so that you may learn them and observe them. The Lord our God made a covenant with us at Mount Horeb. This covenant is not What was established with our ancestors was established with us who are alive here today. .

Today we will study, fellowship, and share " make a covenant 》No. 4 Speak and offer a prayer: Dear Abba Holy Father, our Lord Jesus Christ, thank you that the Holy Spirit is always with us! Amen, thank the Lord! “The virtuous woman” sends out workers through the word of truth written and spoken in their hands, the gospel of our salvation! Provide us with heavenly spiritual food in time, so that our lives will be richer. Amen! May the Lord Jesus continue to illuminate our spiritual eyes and open our minds to understand the Bible so that we can see and hear spiritual truths. Understand the Law of Moses, which is God’s written covenant with the Israelites. .

---The Law of the Israelites---

【one】 commandments of the law

Let’s look at the Bible [Deuteronomy 5:1-22] and read it together: Then Moses called all the Israelites together and said to them, “O Israelites, listen to the statutes and regulations that I am telling you today; Learn and obey the Lord ours. God made a covenant with us on Mount Horeb. This covenant was not made with our ancestors, but with us who are here alive today. The Lord spoke to you face to face on the mountain... "I am the Lord. your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery,
1 You shall have no other gods before me.
2 You shall not make for yourself any graven image, or any likeness of anything that is in heaven above, or that is on earth beneath, or that is under the earth, or that is in the waters.
3 You shall not take the name of the LORD your God in vain; for the LORD will not hold him guiltless who takes his name in vain.
4 You shall keep the Sabbath day holy, as the LORD your God has commanded you. Six days you shall labor and do all your work, but the seventh day is a Sabbath to the LORD your God. …
5 Honor your father and your mother, as the LORD your God has commanded you, so that it may go well with you and that your days may be long in the land which the LORD your God gives you.
6 Thou shalt not kill.
7 Thou shalt not commit adultery.
8 Thou shalt not steal.
9 Thou shalt not bear false witness against anyone.
10 You shall not covet your neighbor's wife; you shall not covet your neighbor's house, his field, his male servant, his maidservant, his ox, his donkey, or anything that is his. ’ “These are the words that the LORD spoke to you all the congregation on the mountain, with a loud voice out of fire, out of cloud, and out of darkness; he didn’t add any other words to them. So he wrote these words on two tablets of stone and gave them to me.

【two】 the statutes of the law

( 1 ) Burnt Offering Ordinance

[Leviticus 1:1-17] The LORD called to Moses from the tent of meeting and said to him, "Speak to the Israelites and say to them: If any of you brings an offering to the LORD, he must offer an offering of cattle from the flock. . “If his offering is a burnt offering of an ox, he shall offer a bull without blemish at the door of the Tent of Meeting, so that it may be accepted before the LORD. He shall lay his hands on the head of the burnt offering, and the burnt offering will be accepted as atonement for his sins. … “If a man’s offering is a burnt offering of a sheep or a goat, he must offer a ram without blemish. … “If a man’s offering to the LORD is a burnt offering of a bird, he must offer a turtledove or a young pigeon. The priest shall burn it all as a burnt offering on the altar, an offering made by fire for a sweet aroma to the LORD. --Recorded in Leviticus 1:9

( 2 ) Meat Offering Ordinance

[Leviticus 2:1-16] If anyone brings a grain offering as an offering to the LORD, he must pour fine flour with oil and add frankincense... “If you offer a grain offering from something roasted in the oven, you must use it. Fine unleavened flour cakes mixed with oil, or unleavened wafers anointed with oil. … “No grain offering you offer to the LORD shall have leaven in it; for you shall not burn any leaven or any honey as an offering made by fire to the LORD. These are to be offered to the LORD as a firstfruits offering, but they are not to be offered as a fragrant offering on the altar. Every grain offering you offer must be seasoned with salt; the salt of the covenant of your God must not be missing from the grain offering. All offerings must be offered with salt. …The priest shall burn some of the grains of grain as a memorial, some of the oil, and all the frankincense, as an offering made by fire to the LORD. recorded

( 3 ) Peace Offering Ordinance

[Leviticus Chapter 3 Verses 1-17] “When a man brings an offering as a peace offering, if it is offered from the herd, whether it is a male or a female, it must be an offering without blemish. Before the LORD. … “When a peace offering is offered to the LORD, it must be of a flock, whether a male or a female, without blemish. … “If a man’s offering is a goat, he shall offer it before the LORD.

( 4 ) Sin Offering Ordinance

[Leviticus 4 Chapter 1-35] The LORD said to Moses, “Speak to the Israelites: If anyone commits a sin against any of the things the LORD has commanded that is not lawful, or if an anointed priest sins and causes the people to sin, he will be blamed for it. for the sin of sacrificing a bull without blemish to Jesus The king is a sin offering. … “If the whole congregation of the Israelites does any thing which is forbidden to them according to the commandment of the LORD, and commits a sin by mistake, but it is hidden and invisible to the congregation, then as soon as the congregation becomes aware of the sin they have committed, they will offer it. A young bull was brought to the tent of meeting as a sin offering. … “If a ruler does what the LORD has done, he If anyone commits a sin which is forbidden by God and he knows the sin he has committed, he must bring a male goat without blemish as an offering... "If anyone among the people does anything that is forbidden by the command of the LORD, If you commit a sin by mistake, and you know the sin you have committed, you must bring a female goat without blemish as an offering for the sin you committed. "If a man brings a lamb for a sin offering, he must bring a female without blemish and lay his hands on the head of the sin offering and kill it for the sin offering in the same place as the burnt offering. . . . The priest shall burn it on the altar according to the regulations of the offering made by fire to the LORD. The priest shall make atonement for him, and he shall be forgiven.

( 5 ) Guilt Offering Ordinance

[Leviticus 5:1-19] “If anyone hears a voice calling for an oath, and he is a witness but does not tell what he has seen or knows, it is sin; he will bear his iniquity. Or if someone touches an unclean thing, whether it is an unclean dead beast, an unclean dead animal, or an unclean dead worm, but he does not know it, and therefore becomes unclean, he is guilty of sin. Or he has touched someone else’s uncleanness, and he does not know what uncleanness he has, and when he knows it, he is guilty... “If anyone sins and does anything forbidden by the Lord, even though he does not. But if you have sinned, you must bear his iniquity; and you must bring a ram without blemish from the flock as a guilt offering to the priest, according to your estimate of the price. As for the wrong thing he has done by mistake, the priest will make atonement for him, and he will be forgiven.

( 6 ) Regulations on Wave Offerings and Lift Offerings

[Leviticus 23:20] The priest shall make a wave offering of these with the bread of the firstfruits of wheat, and wave them before the LORD; it shall be a holy offering to the LORD unto the priest. Refer to Exodus 29, verse 27

【three】 the rules of the law

[Exodus 21:1-6] “This is the ordinance you shall establish before the people: If you buy a Hebrew as a slave, he shall serve you six years; in the seventh year he shall be free and go out free. If he comes alone, he shall go alone; If he has a wife, his wife may go out with him. If his master gives him a wife and she bears him a son or a daughter, the wife and the children shall belong to the master, and he shall be alone. Go out. If a slave declares, "I love my master and my wife and children, and I do not want to go out free," his master shall take him to the judge (or God; the same below) and take him away. Go to the door, get close to the door frame, pierce his ear with an awl, and he will serve his master forever (Note: Laws are the basic rules for regulating people's life and behavior).

【Four】 If you obey the commandments, laws, and ordinances, you will be blessed

[Deuteronomy 28:1-6] “If you will listen carefully to the voice of the LORD your God and observe and do all his commandments, which I command you today, he will set you above all the people on earth. You If you obey the Lord God says, these blessings will follow you and come upon you: You will be blessed in the city, and you will be blessed in the fruit of your body, in the fruit of your land, in the offspring of your cattle, in your calves and in your lambs. , and you will be blessed. Blessed will be your basket and your kneading basin.

【five】 Those who break the commandments will be cursed

Verses 15-19 “If you do not obey the LORD, If you do not obey the word of God and obey all his commandments and statutes, which I command you today, these curses will follow you and befall you: Cursed will you be in the city, and cursed in the field. Cursed . Cursed is your basket and your kneading basin. Cursed is your offspring, your calves and your lambs. Cursed is your going out. Cursed is your coming in. PLUS 3:24-25 In this way, the law is our tutor, leading us to Christ so that we can be justified by faith.

Note: By studying the above scriptures, we record that the laws of the Israelites include commandments, statutes, and regulations, a total of 613! The law is our teacher. Before the truth of salvation by faith came, we were kept under the law until the future truth was revealed. The law led us to Christ and justified us by faith. ! Since the New Testament principle of salvation by faith has come, we are no longer under the master "Old Testament law", but under the "New Testament" grace, that is, in Christ, because the end of the law is Christ. Amen! So, do you understand?

【 one 】 Abraham's Covenant of God's Promise

Let’s study the Bible [Genesis 15:1-6], turn it over and read together: After this, the LORD spoke to Abram in a vision, saying, "Do not be afraid, Abram! I am your shield, and I will reward you greatly." Abram said, "O Lord LORD, I What will you give me, since I have no son? And the one who will inherit my inheritance is Eliezer of Damascus.” Abram said again, “You have not given me a son, who is born into my family.” The one among them will be my heir.” Then the LORD said to him, “This man will not be your heir, but your own offspring.” Then he took him outside and said, “You are the heir. Look up to the sky and count the stars. Can you count them?" And he said to him, "This will be the case with your descendants." Abram believed in the LORD, and the LORD counted it to him as righteousness.
Chapter 22 Verses 16-18 “‘Because you have done this and have not withheld your son, your only son,’ declares the LORD, ‘by myself I swear, I will bless you greatly,’ says the LORD. "As for your descendants, I will multiply your descendants like the stars in the sky and the sand on the seashore. Your descendants will have the gates of their enemies, and through your descendants all the nations of the earth will be blessed, because you have obeyed my voice." Turn again to Gal. 3:16. The promise was made to Abraham and to his descendants. God is not saying " descendants ", referring to many people, means " That descendant of yours ", Pointing to a person, that is, Christ .

( Note: We know that the Old Testament is a type and a shadow, and Abraham is a type of "Heavenly Father", the father of faith! God promised that only those born to Abraham would become His heirs. The promise was originally made to Abraham and his descendants. God does not say “all your descendants,” referring to many people, but “one of your descendants,” referring to one person, Christ. We are born through the true word of the gospel of Jesus Christ, born from the Holy Spirit, and born from God. Only in this way can we become children of the Heavenly Father, heirs of God, and inherit the inheritance of the Heavenly Father. ! Amen. So, do you understand? God promised Abraham that his descendants would be as numerous as the stars in the sky and the sand on the seashore! Amen. Abraham "believed" in the Lord, and the Lord counted it as righteousness to him. This is the covenant of promise that God made with Abraham ! Amen)

【 two 】 sign of covenant

Let’s study the Bible [Genesis 17:1-13] When Abram was ninety-nine years old, the Lord appeared to him and said to him, “I am the Almighty God. Be perfect before me, and I will I will make a covenant with you to make your descendants extremely numerous.” Abram fell to the ground; God said to him again: "I have made a covenant with you: You will be a father of many nations. From now on, your name will no longer be called Abram, but your name will be Abraham, because I have made you a father of many nations. I will make you a father of many nations. I will establish my covenant with you and your descendants after you throughout their generations, an everlasting covenant between you and your descendants after you. God. I will give all the land of Canaan, where you are now a stranger, an eternal inheritance to you and to your descendants, and I will be their God.”

God also said to Abraham: "You and your descendants must keep my covenant throughout your generations. All your males must be circumcised; this is my covenant between me and you and your descendants, which you are to keep. . You must all be circumcised (the original text is circumcision; the same verses 14, 23, 24, and 25); This is the sign of my covenant with you: every male born in your family shall be circumcised on the eighth day after his birth, whether he is born in your family or is purchased with money from someone other than your descendants. Everyone you buy with money must be circumcised. Then my covenant will be established in your flesh as an everlasting covenant.

( Note: Old Testament God promised Abraham and his descendants to become heirs, and the sign of the covenant was "circumcision", which originally means "circumcision", which is a mark engraved on the body; It typifies the children of the New Testament who are born of the true word of the gospel of Jesus Christ, born of the Holy Spirit, and born of God! Promise to be sealed by [the Holy Spirit] , not written on the flesh, because the corruptible flesh from Adam does not belong to us. External physical circumcision is not true circumcision, it can only be done on the inside. True circumcision is in the heart and depends on " spirit "Right now Holy Spirit ! For in Christ neither circumcision nor uncircumcision has any effect, except that which works love. confidence "that is believe in jesus christ "It is effective. Amen! Do you understand clearly? Refer to Romans 2:28-29 and Gal. 5:6

【three】 Imitate Abraham’s faith and receive the promised blessings

We search the Bible [Romans 4:13-17] because God promised Abraham and his descendants that they would inherit the world, not by law but by the righteousness of faith. If only those who belong to the law are heirs, faith will be in vain and the promise will be nullified. For the law provokes wrath; and where there is no law, there is no transgression. Therefore, it is by faith that a man is an heir, and therefore by grace, so that the promise may be accrued to all descendants, not only to those who are of the law, but also to those who imitate the faith of Abraham. Abraham believed in the God who raises the dead and brings things into being from nothing, and who is the Father of us men before the Lord. As it is written: "I have made you a father of many nations." Even when there was no hope, he still had hope through faith, and he was able to be the father of many nations, just as it was said before: "So shall your descendants be. "

Galatians Chapter 3 Verse 7.9.14 Therefore, you must know: Those who are of faith are the children of Abraham . … It can be seen that those who are based on faith are blessed together with Abraham who has faith. …so that the blessing of Abraham may come to the Gentiles through Christ Jesus, so that we may receive the promise of the Holy Spirit through faith and inherit the kingdom of heaven. . In the rainy days, quietly feel the feelings in the rain, leave loneliness to the years, and leave simplicity to yourself. Looking into the distance between the brows and the rain, a rainbow appeared in front of my eyes. The rainbow should be the most beautiful gift given by God to mankind. It has seven colors of all the colors in the world: the red of the sun, the yellow of gold, the blue of the ocean, the green of leaves, the orange of morning glow, the purple of morning glory, and the cyan of grass. Nowadays, many boys, girls and young lovers will unconsciously make a wish in their hearts when they see a rainbow - "peace and blessings"! 【 two 】 great flood

articles.title: Cross｜The origin of the cross
articles.author: admin
articles.content:
Peace, dear friends, brothers and sisters! Amen. Today we will study, fellowship, and share the origin of the cross

ancient roman cross

crucifixion , it is said that it was caused by Phoenicians Invention, the Phoenician Empire is the general name of a series of small city-states in the northern region of the east coast of the ancient Mediterranean. Its history can be traced back to the 30th century BC. The cross of the torture instrument usually consisted of two or three wooden stakes---or even four if it was a quadrilateral cross, with different shapes. Some are T-shaped, some are X-shaped, and some are Y-shaped. One of the great inventions of the Phoenicians was the execution of people by crucifixion. Later, This method was passed from the Phoenicians to the Greeks, Assyrians, Egyptians, Persians and Romans. Especially popular in the Persian Empire, Kingdom of Damascus, judah Kingdom, the Kingdom of Israel, Carthage, and ancient Rome, often used to execute rebels, heretics, slaves, and people without citizenship .

This cruel punishment originated from a wooden stake. At first, the prisoner was tied to a wooden stake and suffocated to death, which was both simple and cruel. Later wooden frames were introduced, including crosses, T-shaped frames and X-shaped frames. The X-shaped frame is also called "Saint Andrew's frame" because the saint died on the X-shaped frame.

Although the details of executions vary slightly from place to place, the general situation is the same: the prisoner is whipped first and then forced to carry a wooden frame to the execution ground. Sometimes the wooden frame is so heavy that it is difficult for one person to move it. Before execution, the prisoner was stripped of his clothes, leaving only a loincloth. There is a wedge-shaped piece of wood under the prisoner's palms and feet to prevent the body from sliding down due to gravity. Then insert the cross into the prepared fixed opening on the ground. To hasten death, the limbs of the prisoner were sometimes broken. The stronger the prisoner's tolerance, the longer the torture. The merciless scorching sun burned their bare skin, flies bitten them and sucked their sweat, and the dust in the air suffocated them.

Crucifixion was usually carried out in batches, so several crosses were often erected at the same location. After the criminal was executed, he continued to hang on the cross for public display. After the public display, it was customary to bury the cross and the criminal together. The crucifixion later underwent some improvements, such as fixing the prisoner head down on a wooden frame, which could make the prisoner lose consciousness quickly and actually reduce the prisoner's pain.

It is difficult for modern people to imagine the pain of crucifixion, because on the surface, just tying a person to a stake does not seem to be a particularly cruel punishment. The prisoner on the cross did not die of hunger or thirst, nor did he die of bleeding—the nails were driven into the cross, the prisoner eventually died of suffocation. The crucified man could only breathe by stretching his arms. However, in such a posture, coupled with the intense pain caused by driving the nails in, all the muscles will soon produce a violent back contraction force, so the air filled in the chest cannot be discharged. To speed up suffocation, weights are often hung on the feet of the strongest people, so that they can no longer stretch their arms to breathe. The consensus among scientists is that crucifixion was an unusually cruel method of execution because it slowly tortured a person to death over a period of several days.

The earliest crucifixion in Rome should be during the reign of Targan at the end of the Seven Kings. Rome finally suppressed three slave rebellions. And every victory was accompanied by bloody massacres, and thousands of people were crucified. The first two were in Sicily, one in the first and a half centuries BC and the other in the first century BC. The third and most famous one, in 73 BC, was led by Spartacus and six thousand people were crucified. Crosses were erected all the way from Cabo to Rome. Execution by cross or column was very popular in Roman times, but began to slowly disappear in the centuries after Christ was crucified, rose from the dead and ascended to heaven. Those in power no longer used the method of executing "sons of God" to execute criminals, and hangings and other punishments began to be widely used.

The "new man" born of God does not belong to Adam's old man

Let us study the Bible Romans 8:9 If the Spirit of God dwells in you, you are no longer of the flesh but of the Spirit. If anyone does not have the Spirit of Christ, he does not belong to Christ.

[Note]: The Spirit of God is the Spirit of God the Father → the Holy Spirit, the Spirit of Christ → the Holy Spirit, the Spirit of the Son of God → also the Holy Spirit, they are all one spirit → the "Holy Spirit"! Amen. So, do you understand? → If the Spirit of God lives in you → you are "reborn", and "you" refers to the "new man" born from God → not of the flesh → that is to say, "not of the old man Adam's flesh → but of the Holy Spirit." Amen! So, do you understand clearly?
Separation of new people from old ones:

( 1 ) distinguished from rebirth

Newcomers: 1 Who are born of water and the Spirit, 2 Who are born of the gospel, the truth in Christ Jesus, 3 Who are born of God → are children of God! Amen. Refer to John 3:5, 1 Corinthians 4:15, and James 1:18.
Old man: 1 Created from the dust, the children of Adam and Eve, 2 born of the flesh of their parents, 3 natural, sinful, earthly, and will ultimately return to the dust → they are the children of man. See Genesis 2:7 and 1 Corinthians 15:45

( 2 ) from spiritual distinction

It is eternal life! Amen – refer to John 11:26
Old man: Earthly, Adamic, born of the flesh of the parents, natural → sinful, sold to sin, filthy and unclean, corruptible, corruptible through lust, mortal, and ultimately will return to dust. See Genesis 3:19

Amen! So, do you understand clearly? →Refer to Ephesians 2:6 He raised us up and seated us together in the heavenly places with Christ Jesus. →When Christ, who is our life, appears, you also will appear with him in glory. Refer to Colossians chapter 3 verse 4.

Note: Christ is" live "In your "heart"," Not live "In the flesh of Adam's old man, the "new man" born of God soul body → All are hidden, hidden with Christ in God → On that day when Jesus Christ comes again, he will be born of God." newcomer " soul body Will appear Come out and be with Christ in glory. Amen! So, do you understand clearly?

Old man: The "old man" is the sinful body that came from Adam. He can see himself, and others can see himself. He is the fleshly soul body that comes from Adam! All the thoughts, transgressions and evil desires of the flesh will be expressed through this body of death. But the "soul and body" of this old man were on the cross with Christ lost . So, do you understand?

So the "soul body" of this old man does not belong →The "new man" soul body born from God! → born of god →" spirit "It's the Holy Spirit," soul "It is the soul of Christ," body "It is the body of Christ! When we eat the Lord's Supper, we eat and drink the Lord's" body and blood "! We have it body of christ and life soul . So, do you understand clearly?

Many churches today doctrine The mistake lies in this → Not comparing the soul body of Adam with the soul body of Christ separate , their teaching is to →"save"→Adam's soul→to cultivate the physical body and become a Taoist; The →"soul body" of Christ was thrown away .

Let’s see → what the Lord Jesus said: “Whoever loses his life (life or soul) for me and the gospel → will lose Adam’s “soul” → and will “save” his life → → “save his soul”; Because Adam's soul is "natural" - refer to 1 Corinthians 15:45 → Therefore, he must be united with Christ and crucified to destroy the sinful body and lose his life; → Resurrection and rebirth with Christ! Earned is → the "soul" of Christ → this is →" Saved the soul " ! Amen. So, do you understand clearly? See Mark 8:34-35.

Brothers and sisters! In the Garden of Eden God created Adam's "spirit" as a natural spirit. articles.title: Rebirth (Lecture 3)
articles.author: admin
articles.content:
Peace, dear friends, brothers and sisters! Amen.

Let’s open the Bible to John chapter 1 verses 12-13 and read together: As many as received Him, to them He gave the authority to become children of God, to those who believe in His name. These are those who are not born of blood, not of lust, nor of the will of man, but are born of God.

Today we will study, fellowship, and share together "Rebirth" No. 3 Speak and offer a prayer: Dear Abba Heavenly Father, our Lord Jesus Christ, thank you that the Holy Spirit is always with us! Amen. Thank you Lord! A virtuous woman" church "Sending workers through the word of truth written and spoken in their hands, which is the gospel of your salvation. Bread is brought from far away from heaven, and is provided to us in season, so that our spiritual life may be abundant! Amen. Ask the Lord Jesus to continue to illuminate the eyes of our souls and open our minds to understand the Bible so that we can hear and see spiritual truths → 1 born of water and the Spirit, 2 born of the true gospel, 3 Those who are born of God→all come from one, and are all children of God ! Amen.

The above prayers, supplications, intercessions, thanks, and blessings! I ask this in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ! Amen.

1. Born from God

Question: What is the birth of blood, the birth of passion, and the birth of human will?
Answer: The first man, Adam, became a living person with spirit ("spirit" or "flesh") - 1 Corinthians 15:45.

The LORD God formed man from the dust of the ground and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life, and he became a living soul, and his name was Adam. Genesis 2:7

[Note:] Adam, who was created from dust, became a living person with spirit, "that is, a living person of flesh and blood." A living person of flesh and blood → has a body of flesh and blood, has evil passions and desires, and God calls Adam "man"; therefore, all people from Adam Everything that comes out of the roots → is born of blood, passion, and human will! Do you understand this?

Question: What is born of God?
Answer: Detailed explanation below

In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God - John 1:1
"The Word" became flesh → that is, "God" became flesh, and "God" is a spirit → that is, "Spirit" became flesh. He was conceived by a virgin from the Holy Spirit and was born, named Jesus! Refer to Matthew 1:21, John 1:14, 4:24

Jesus was born of the Heavenly Father → Of all the angels, to which one did God ever say: You are my Son, and I have begotten you today? Which of them did he say: I will be his Father, and he will be my son? Hebrews 1:5

Question: How do we receive Jesus?
Answer: We believe that Jesus is the Son of God. If we eat his body and drink the blood of the Lord, we will have the "life of Jesus Christ" within us! Reference John 6:53-56

The Father Jehovah is God, the Son Jesus is God, and the Holy Spirit the Comforter is also God! When we welcome Jesus, we welcome God. When we welcome the one sent by God, we welcome the Holy Father! To receive the promised Holy Spirit is to have Jesus. If you have the Son "Jesus", you have the Father. Amen! Reference 1 John 2:23

Therefore, everyone who receives the promised Holy Spirit, receives Jesus, and receives the Holy Father! A "new man" is reborn within you → This kind of man is not born of "Adam's" blood, not of lust, nor of human will, but of God.
So, do you understand clearly?

2. Born from God (not belonging to) Adam’s body

Let’s study the Bible Romans 8:9 If the Spirit of God dwells in you, you are not of the flesh but of the Spirit. If anyone does not have the Spirit of Christ, he does not belong to Christ.

Note: "The Spirit of God" → is the Spirit of Jehovah, the Spirit of the Father, the Spirit of Christ, the Spirit of Jesus, the Holy Spirit, and the Holy Spirit of truth! It is also called the Comforter and the Anointing.

If the Spirit of God, the Spirit of Christ, the Holy Spirit dwells in you! A "person" is born again in you - see Romans 7:22. This "man" is the body of Jesus, the blood of Jesus, the life of Christ, a spiritual person. This "new man" is the body of Christ! Amen

You "new man" do not belong to the "old man" Adam's physical body, the "new man"'s immortal spiritual body; you do not belong to the "old man" Adam's corruptible body. Your regenerated "new man" belongs to the Holy Spirit, Christ, and God the Father! Amen

If Christ is in you, the "old man" in the body dies because of sin → died with Christ; but the soul is justified and lives by "faith" → the "new man" lives with Christ! So, do you understand? Reference Romans 8:9-10

3. Anyone born of God will never sin

Let’s turn to 1 John 3:9 Whoever is born of God does not sin, because the word of God abides in him; nor can he sin, because he is born of God.

Question: Why do those who are born of God never sin?
Answer: Detailed explanation below

1 For the word of God abides in the heart - John 3:9
2 But the Spirit of God dwells in you, and you are not carnal - Romans 8:9
3 The new man born of God abides in Jesus Christ - 1 John 3:6
4 The law of the Spirit of life has made me free from the law of sin and death - Romans 8:2
5 Where there is no law, there is no transgression - Romans 4:15
6 Washed, sanctified, justified by the Spirit of God - 1 Corinthians 6:11
7 Old things have passed away; all things have become new - 2 Corinthians 5:17

The "old man" was crucified with Christ → old things have passed away;

The "new man" lives with Christ, now abides in Christ, has been cleansed, sanctified, and justified through the Holy Spirit → everything has become new (called a new man)!

Question: Can Christians (new ones) sin?
Answer: No one who is born of God will sin; whoever sins is of the devil. Reference 1 John 3:8-10, 5:18

Question: Some preachers say that Christians still commit sins. What is going on?
Answer: People who say that they (born of God) can sin do not understand the salvation of Christ. They are deceived by error. Because those who sin are not regenerated; those who are not regenerated do not have the promised Holy Spirit! Anyone who does not have the Spirit of Christ does not belong to Christ.

(If Christ is in you:)

1 The "old man" body is dead because of sin → He who "believes" that the old man is dead is free from sin - Romans 6:6-7
2 Freed from the law → Where there is no law, there there is no transgression - Romans 4:15
3 Put off the old man and its deeds → If the Spirit of God dwells in you, you are no longer in the flesh (the old deeds) - Romans 8:9, Col 3:9
4 Without the law, sin is not counted → "New Testament" God will no longer remember your sins and transgressions. The transgressions of the old man's fleshly behavior were crucified with Christ because you have died (refer to Col. 3:3 )So God does not remember! - Romans 5:13, Hebrews 10:16-18
5 For without the law sin is dead (Romans 7:8) → You have been put away from sin, from the law, and from the old man and his works through the body of Christ. You have died - Col. 3:3. Your regenerated "new man" does not belong to the deeds and transgressions of the old man's flesh. God will no longer remember your sins and transgressions, so Paul said! Consider yourselves dead to sin and alive to God in Christ Jesus - Romans 6:11
6 The body is dead because of sin, but the spirit is alive because of righteousness (Romans 8:10)

Question: How does the body of sin die?
Answer: Believe in dying with Christ → experience the death of the old man and gradually put it off → take on a dead body, a mortal body, a corruptible body, and the outer body will gradually destroy and become corrupted (Ephesians 4:21-22) Adam’s sinful body It is from dust and to dust it will return. --Refer to Genesis 3:19

Question: How do newcomers live?
Answer: Live with Christ → The new man (reborn spiritual man) abides in Christ Jesus, and in you (the new man) is growing day by day into a man, growing into the stature of Christ. If a "treasure" is placed in an earthen vessel, it will show that this great power comes from God. It activates the death of Jesus and also shows the life of Jesus → preaching the gospel, preaching the truth, and leading many people to righteousness! Experience resurrection with Christ and the redemption of the body. The spiritual life of the "new man" will achieve an incomparable weight of eternal glory. When Christ appears, your body will also appear (that is, the body is redeemed), and you will be resurrected even more beautifully! Amen. Reference 2 Corinthians 4:7-18

7 Whoever is born of God does not sin, because the word of God abides in him; nor can he sin, because he is born of God. 1 John 3:9 , 5:18

So, do you understand?

OK! Today we are sharing "Rebirth" here.
Let us pray to God together: Dear Abba Heavenly Father, our Lord Jesus Christ, thank you that the Holy Spirit is always with us! Constantly illuminate our spiritual eyes and open our minds so that we can see and hear spiritual truths, understand the Bible, and understand rebirth, 1 born of water and the Spirit, 2 born of the true word of the gospel, 3 born of God! He who abides in Jesus Christ is holy, sinless, and does not sin. No one who is born of God will sin, for we are all born of God. Amen
In the name of the Lord Jesus Christ! Amen
