Peace to all brothers and sisters!

Today we continue to examine traffic sharing "Rebirth" 2

Lecture 2: The True Word of the Gospel

Let us turn to 1 Corinthians 4:15 in our Bibles and read together: You who learn about Christ may have ten thousand teachers but few fathers, for I have begotten you through the gospel in Christ Jesus.

Turn back to James 1:18 According to his own will he gave birth to us in the word of truth, so that we would be as firstfruits of all his creation.

These two verses talk about

1 Paul said! For I have begotten you through the gospel in Christ Jesus

2 Jacob said! God gave birth to us with the truth

1. We were born with the true way

Question: What is the true way?
Answer: Detailed explanation below

Bible interpretation: "Truth" is the truth, and "Tao" is God!

1 The truth is Jesus! Amen
Jesus said, “I am the way, the truth, and the life; no one comes to the Father except through me. John 14:6

2 "The Word" is God - John 1:1-2

"The Word" became flesh - John 1:14
"God" became flesh - John 1:18
The Word became flesh, was conceived by a virgin and born of the Holy Spirit, and was named Jesus! Amen. Reference Matthew 1:18,21
Therefore, Jesus is God, the Word, and the Word of truth!
Jesus is the truth! The truth gave birth to us, it was Jesus who gave birth to us! Amen.

Our (old man) physical body was previously born of Adam; our (new man) spiritual body was born of the last Adam "Jesus". God gave birth to us with the truth according to His own will. So, do you understand?
In Him you were sealed with the Holy Spirit of promise, when you also believed in Christ when you heard the word of truth, the gospel of your salvation. Ephesians 1:13

2. You were born of the gospel in Christ Jesus

Question: What is the gospel?
Answer: We are explaining in detail

1 Jesus said, "The Spirit of the Lord is upon me, because he has anointed me,
Call me to preach the gospel to the poor; send me to report:
The captives are set free,
The blind must see,
To set free the oppressed,
Announcement of God’s acceptable year of jubilee. Luke 4:18-19

2 Peter said! You have been born again, not of corruptible seed, but of incorruptible, through the living and abiding word of God. …Only the Word of the Lord endures forever. This is the gospel that was preached to you. 1 Peter 1:23,25

3 Paul said (you will be saved by believing this gospel) what I also delivered to you: first, that Christ died for our sins and was buried according to the Scriptures; thirdly, according to the Scriptures Heaven is resurrected. 1 Corinthians 15:3-4

Question: How did the gospel give birth to us?
Answer: Detailed explanation below

Christ died for our sins according to the Bible

(1) That our sinful body may be destroyed - Romans 6:6
(2) For those who have died are freed from sin - Romans 6:7
(3) To redeem those who are under the law - Gal. 4:4-5
(4) Freed from the law and its curse - Romans 7:6, Gal 3:13

And buried

(1) Put off the old man and its practices - Colossians 3-9
(2) Escaped from the power of Satan in the darkness of Hades - Colossians 1:13, Acts 26:18
(3) Out of the world - John 17:16

And he was resurrected on the third day according to the Bible

(1) Christ was resurrected for our justification - Romans 4:25
(2) We are reborn through the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead - 1 Peter 1:3
(3) Believing in the gospel makes us resurrected with Christ - Romans 6:8, Ephesians 3:5-6
(4) Believing in the gospel gives us sonship - Gal. 4:4-7, Ephesians 1:5
(5) Believing in the gospel redeems our body - 1 Thessalonians 5:23-24, Romans 8:23,
1 Corinthians 15:51-54, Revelation 19:6-9

so,
1 Peter said, “We have been born again to a living hope through the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead, 1 Peter 1:3

2 Jacob said! According to his own will, he gave birth to us in the word of truth, so that we would be as the firstfruits of all his creation. James 1:18

3 Paul said! You who learn about Christ may have ten thousand teachers, but few fathers, for I have begotten you through the gospel in Christ Jesus. 1 Corinthians 4:15

So, do you understand clearly?

Peace to all my dear brothers and sisters! Amen

(1) There is only one lawgiver and judge

Let’s look at the Bible [James 4:12] and read it together: There is one lawgiver and judge, the one who is able to save and to destroy. Who are you to judge others?

1 In the Garden of Eden, God made a law covenant with Adam. He was not to eat from the tree of good and evil. The Lord God placed the man in the Garden of Eden to cultivate and guard it. The Lord God commanded him, "You may freely eat from any tree of the garden, but you shall not eat from the tree of the knowledge of good and evil, for in the day you eat from it you will surely die!" Genesis 2 Chapter 15- Verse 17 records.

2 Jewish Mosaic Law - Jehovah God gave the law "Ten Commandments" on Mount Sinai, that is, Mount Horeb. The law includes statutes, regulations, and commandments. Exodus 20 and Leviticus. Moses called all the Israelites together and said to them, "O Israel, listen to the statutes and judgments that I am telling you today, so that you may learn them and observe them. The Lord our God made a covenant with us at Mount Horeb. This covenant is not What was established with our ancestors was established with us who are alive here today - Deuteronomy 5:1-3.

(2) The law was not established for the righteous; it was established for lawlessness, disobedience, ungodliness and sin.

We know that the law is good, if it is used properly; for the law was not made for the righteous, but for the lawless and disobedient, the ungodly and sinful, the unholy and worldly, parricide and murderer for those who commit adultery and sodomy, for those who rob people of their lives, for those who tell lies, for those who swear false oaths, or for anything else that is contrary to righteousness. --Recorded in 1 Timothy Chapter 1:8-10

(3) The law was added for transgressions

In this way, why does the law exist? It was added for transgressions, waiting for the coming of the offspring to whom the promise was made, and it was established by the mediator through angels. --Galatians 3:19

(4) The law was added from outside to increase transgressions

The law was added so that transgressions might abound; but where sin abounded, grace abounded all the more. --Recorded in Romans 5:20. Note: The law is like "light and mirror" that reveals the "sin" in people. Do you understand?

(5) The law makes people aware of their sins

Therefore, no flesh can be justified before God by the works of the law, because the law convicts people of sin. --Recorded in Romans 3:20

(6) The law blocks every mouth

We know that everything in the law is addressed to those who are under the law, so that every mouth may be stopped, and the whole world may be brought under the judgment of God. --Recorded in Romans 3:19. For God has imprisoned all men in disobedience for the purpose of having mercy on all men. --Recorded in Romans 11:32

(7) The law is our training teacher

But the principle of salvation by faith has not yet come, and we are kept under the law until the future revelation of the truth. In this way, the law is our training teacher, leading us to Christ so that we can be justified by faith. --Recorded in Galatians 3:23-24

For the wages of sin is death; but the gift of God is eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord. -Romans 6:23. But each one is tempted when he is drawn away and enticed by his own lust. When lust is conceived, it gives birth to sin; when sin is fully grown, it gives birth to death. -According to James 1:14-15

Unless the law says, "Thou shalt not be greedy," I would not know what greed is. However, sin took the opportunity to activate all kinds of covetousness in me through the commandment; for without the law, sin is dead. Before I was alive without the law; but when the commandment came, sin came to life again, and I died. Recorded in Romans 7:7-9.

( 7 ) We are saved from sin and from the law and the curse of the law through faith in the Lord Jesus Christ.

He deserves it; but to the one who does no works but believes in God who justifies the ungodly, his faith is counted as righteousness. Romans 9:11 For the twins were not yet born, and no good or evil was done, but that God's purpose in election might be revealed, not because of works, but because of Him who calls them. )

[Matthew 5:45] In this way you may become sons of your Father who is in heaven, for He makes his sun rise on the good and the evil, and sends rain on the righteous and on the unjust. Psalm 65:11 You crown your years with grace; all your paths drip with fat. (Note: Isn’t the sun, rain, dew, air, etc. also God’s grace, freely given to mankind?)

God established Jesus as the propitiation by virtue of the blood of Jesus and through man’s faith to demonstrate God’s righteousness; because He patiently tolerated the sins committed by people in the past in order to demonstrate His righteousness in the present time. that he himself may be known to be righteous, and that he may also justify those who believe in Jesus. If this is the case, how can you boast? There is nothing to boast about. How can we use something that is not available? Is it a meritorious method? No, it is the method of believing in the Lord. So (there are ancient scrolls: because) we are certain: A person is justified by faith, not by obedience to the law .

Amen, it is not a method of meritorious service, but a method of believing in the Lord. Therefore, we have concluded that a person is justified by faith and does not depend on obedience to the law. )

The law of the Israelites was given through Moses:

(1) Commandments carved on two stones

[Exodus 20:2-17] "I am the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage." "You shall have no other gods before me." "You shall not have any for yourselves. "You shall not take the name of the LORD your God in vain; for the LORD will not hold him guiltless who takes his name in vain. "Remember the Sabbath day, to keep it holy..." "Honor your father and your mother, that your days may be long in the land which the Lord your God is giving you." "You shall not commit adultery." "You shall not bear false witness against your neighbor." "You shall not covet your neighbor's house; you shall not covet your neighbor's wife, his manservant, his maidservant, his ox, or his donkey, or anything that belongs to him."

[Deuteronomy 28:1-6] “If you will listen carefully to the voice of the LORD your God and observe and do all his commandments, which I command you today, he will set you above all the people on earth. You If you obey the voice of the LORD your God, these blessings will follow you and come upon you: You will be blessed in the city, and you will be blessed in the fruit of your body, in the fruit of your ground, and in the fruit of your cattle. Blessed will be your calves and lambs. Blessed will be your basket and your kneading basin. Blessed will you be when you go out, and blessed will you be when you come in.

(3) Breaking the commandments and being cursed

Verses 15-19 “If you do not obey the voice of the LORD your God, to keep all his commandments and His statutes, which I command you today, these following curses will follow you and befall you: You Cursed will it be in the city, and cursed will it be in the field: Cursed is your basket and your kneading basin; Curse. You are cursed when you go out, and you are cursed when you enter. Galatians 3:11 No one is justified before God by the law. This is obvious; for the Scripture says, “The righteous shall be cursed.” Live by faith. "

(4) The law depends on behavior

[Romans 2:12-13] Because God is no respecter of persons. Anyone who sins without the law will perish without the law; everyone who sins under the law will be judged according to the law. (For it is not the hearers of the law who are righteous before God, but the doers of the law.

Galatians Chapter 3 Verse 12 For the law was not by faith, but said, “He who does these things shall live by them.”

( Note: By examining the above scriptures, we record that the law was given through Moses, just as Jesus rebuked the Jews - John 7:19 Didn’t Moses give you the law? But none of you keeps the law. Jews such as "Paul" were as observant of the law as they were before. Paul was taught strictly by the law under Gamaliel. In terms of the righteousness in the law, Paul said that he kept the law and was blameless. Why did Jesus say that none of them kept the law? This is because they kept the law, but no one kept the law. They all broke the law. Breaking the law is sin, so they all sinned. This is why Jesus rebuked the Jews for not keeping the Law of Moses. Paul himself said that previously keeping the law was beneficial, but now that he has come to know the salvation of Christ, keeping the law is detrimental. --Refer to Philippians 3:6-8.

After Paul understood the salvation of God's grace through Christ, he also rebuked the circumcised Jews for not keeping the law even themselves - Galatians 6:13. Do you understand this clearly?

Since everyone in the world has broken the law, breaking the law is sin, and everyone in the world has sinned and fallen short of the glory of God. God loves the world! Therefore, He sent His only begotten Son, Jesus, to come among us to reveal the truth. The summary of the law is Christ. --Refer to Romans 10:4.

The love of Christ fulfills the law → that is, it changes the bondage of the law into God’s grace and the curse of the law into God’s blessing! God’s grace, truth, and great love are demonstrated through the only begotten Jesus ! Amen, so, do you all understand clearly?

articles.title: Bible｜What sin? A sin that does not lead to death?
articles.author: admin
articles.content:
Peace to all brothers and sisters! Amen.

Let’s open the Bible to 1 John chapter 5 verse 17 and read together: All unrighteousness is sin, and there are sins that do not lead to death. .

Today we will study, fellowship, and share " What is a sin that does not lead to death? 》Prayer: Dear Abba, Heavenly Father, our Lord Jesus Christ, thank you that the Holy Spirit is always with us! Amen. Thank you Lord! "The virtuous woman" sent out workers through their hands, both written and preached, through the word of truth, which is the gospel of your salvation. Food is transported from the sky from afar and supplied to us at the right time to make our spiritual life richer! Amen. Ask the Lord Jesus to continue to illuminate our spiritual eyes and open our minds to understand the Bible so that we can hear and see spiritual truths → Understand "what sin" is a sin that does not lead to death? So that by relying on the Holy Spirit, we may put to death all the evil deeds of the body, take root in the faith, and be rooted and built in Jesus Christ instead of being built in Adam. . Amen!

The above prayers, supplications, intercessions, thanksgivings, and blessings! I ask this in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ! Amen

Question: What crime? Is it a sin that does not lead to death?

Answer: Detailed explanation below

【1】Sins outside the covenant law between God and man

Just like in ancient times when there was no marriage law, it was not a sin for a brother to take his sister. For example, Abraham married his sister Sarai. Genesis Chapter 20:12 Moreover, she is indeed my sister; she is my half-brother and later became my wife. There are also records in Genesis 38 about Judah and Tamar, that is, the sin of fornication and incest between the father-in-law and Tamar.

In John 2, there is also a Gentile prostitute named Rahab, who also committed the sin of telling lies, but Gentiles did not have the Law of Moses, so it was not considered a sin. These are sins outside of the legal covenant, so they are not considered sins. Because the law provokes wrath (or translation: causes people to suffer punishment); "where there is no law," there is no transgression. --Refer to Romans 4:15. So, do you understand clearly?

[2] Sins committed by the flesh

Let’s study Romans 8:9 in the Bible and read it together: If the Spirit of God dwells in you, you are no longer of the flesh but of the Spirit. If anyone does not have the Spirit of Christ, he does not belong to Christ.

Note: If the Spirit of God, that is, the Holy Spirit "dwells" in your hearts, you are not of the flesh → that is to say, you "hear" and understand the true way and believe the gospel of Christ → are baptized by the Holy Spirit → that is, the "new man" who is reborn and saved is not Belongs to the "old man" body. Here are two persons → one is born of the Spirit of God; the other is born of Adam-parents. The visible transgressions of the "old man" in the flesh will not be imputed to the "new man" who is hidden with Christ in God. As the Lord says: "Do not hold the trespasses of their "old man" against their "new man"! Amen - refer to 2 Corinthians 5:19. Do you understand this clearly?

The apostle "Paul" rebuked the Corinthian church: "It is heard that fornication is taking place among you. Such fornication does not exist even among the Gentiles, even if someone takes his stepmother... who has committed the evil act of fornication and adultery will be punished Cast such a person out from among you and give him to Satan to "corrupt his flesh" so that his soul may be saved in the day of the Lord Jesus - for such a person is. If you live according to the "old man" and want to destroy the temple of God, the Lord will punish him and destroy his body so that his soul may be saved. Colossians 3:5 Therefore, put to death your members who are on earth. Fornication, impurity, evil passions, evil desires, and greed (greed is the same as idolatry). Therefore, the process of putting off the "old man" body of the "new man" → is a process of suffering with Christ. The death of Jesus is initiated in us. Let the life of Jesus be revealed in us → It is God who gives you glory, reward, and crown! It is also the spiritual path that Christians must take. Amen! Do you understand clearly?

If anyone is in Christ, he is a new creation; old things have passed away; all things have become new. …This is how God was in Christ reconciling the world to himself, not counting their trespasses against them, and entrusting this message of reconciliation to us. --Refer to 2 Corinthians 5:17,19.

Romans 7:14-24 Just as the apostle "Paul" was born again and the flesh was at war with the spirit, so I know that there is no good thing in me, that is, in my flesh. Because it’s up to me to decide to do good, but it’s not up to me to do it. Therefore, the good that I want, I do not do; the evil that I do not want, I do. If I do something I don’t want to do, it is not me who does it, but sin that lives in me. The old human flesh was crucified and died with Christ. It is no longer me who lives, but Christ lives for me. As the apostle "Paul" said! I consider myself dead to "sin" and I am dead to the law because of the "law" - refer to Romans 6:6-11 and Gal. 2:19-20. It explains that the "new man" after being reborn and saved does not belong to the sins of the "old man"'s flesh. The Lord says! Remember no more, and do not impute the sins of the old man's flesh to the "new man." Amen! Then he said, "I will remember their sins and their transgressions no more." Now that these sins have been forgiven, there is no need to offer sacrifices for "sin" anymore. So, do you understand clearly? --Refer to Hebrews 10:17-18

(Warning: King David also committed adultery and murder in the flesh, and the disaster of the sword came to his family in the flesh. He said in the Psalm that those who are counted righteous by God "outside of works" are blessed. Because of God's "righteousness" Revealed "outside the law" - refer to Romans 3:21. Likewise, "King Saul and the traitor Judas" also regretted their actions and confessed their sins because they "unbelieved" and did not establish regulations on [faith]. , God did not forgive their sins. Do you understand clearly? (See 2 Timothy 1:4.)

【3】Sin committed without law

1 Whoever sins without the law will perish without the law; and whoever sins under the law will be judged according to the law. --Romans 2:12.

2 Where there is no law, there is no transgression → for the law provokes wrath (or translation: to punish); and where there is no law, there is no transgression. --Romans 4:15

3 Without the law, sin is dead → However, sin took the opportunity to work all kinds of covetousness in me through the commandment; for without the law, sin is dead. --Romans 7:8

4 Without the law, sin is not considered sin → Before there was the law, sin was already in the world; but without the law, sin is not considered sin. --Romans 5:13

(Romans 10:9-10 Gentiles do not have the law. They can be justified and have eternal life by believing in Jesus Christ alone. But the Jews have the Law of Moses. They must first repent of their sins and be baptized in water. They must believe in Jesus and be baptized by the Holy Spirit to be saved and have life. ! )

So, do you understand clearly?

OK! Today I would like to share my fellowship with you all. May the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ, the love of God, and the inspiration of the Holy Spirit be always with you all! Amen

2021.06.05

articles.title: Bible｜What sin is the sin leading to death?
articles.author: admin
articles.content:
Peace to all brothers and sisters! Amen.

Let’s open the Bible to 1 John chapter 5 verse 16 and read together: If anyone sees his brother committing a sin that does not lead to death, he must pray for him, and God will give him life; but if there is a sin that leads to death, I do not say that he should pray for him. .

Today we will study, fellowship, and share " What sin is a sin leading to death? 》Prayer: Dear Abba, Heavenly Father, our Lord Jesus Christ, thank you that the Holy Spirit is always with us! Amen. Thank you Lord! "The virtuous woman" sends out workers - through their hands they write and speak the word of truth, the gospel of your salvation. Food is brought from far away in the sky and supplied to you at the right time, so that your spiritual life will be richer! Amen. Ask the Lord Jesus to continue to illuminate our spiritual eyes and open our minds to understand the Bible so that we can hear and see spiritual truths → Understand what sin is a sin leading to death? Let us believe the gospel and understand the true way, and be freed from the sin that leads to death; we can obtain the title of sons of God and obtain eternal life. ! Amen!

The above prayers, supplications, intercessions, thanksgivings, and blessings! I ask this in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ! Amen

Question: What sin is the sin leading to death?
Answer: Let’s look at 1 John 5:16 in the Bible and read it together: If anyone sees his brother committing a sin that does not lead to death, he must pray for him, and God will give him life; if anyone has a sin that leads to death, I It is not said that one should pray for this sin.

Question: What are the sins leading to death?
Answer: Detailed explanation below

【1】Adam’s sin of breach of contract

Genesis Chapter 2 Verse 17 But you shall not eat from the tree of the knowledge of good and evil, for in the day you eat from it you will surely die!

Romans 5:12, 14 Just as through one man sin entered the world, and through sin death came to all, because all have sinned. …But from Adam to Moses, death reigned, even those who did not sin like Adam. Adam was a type of the man who was to come.

1 Corinthians 15:21-22 For since death came by one man, so also did the resurrection of the dead come. As in Adam all die, so in Christ all shall be made alive.

Hebrews 9:27 It is appointed for men to die once, and after that the judgment.

(Note: By examining the above scriptures, we record that Adam's "sin of breaking the covenant" is a sin that leads to death; Jesus Christ, the son of God, has washed away people's sins with his own "blood". Those who [believe] in him will not be condemned → Eternal life; those who do not believe have already been condemned - the "blood" of Jesus has washed away people's sins, and you [unbelieve] → will be condemned, and there will be judgment after death → "According to you, you are under the law "You will be judged for what you do." Do you understand this clearly?)

【2】Sin based on the practice of law

Galatians 3 Chapter 10 Everyone is under a curse who does the works of the law, for it is written: “Whoever does not continue to do everything written in the book of the Law is under a curse curse."

( Note: By studying the above scriptures, we record that anyone who takes the practice of the law as his identity, who boasts in being justified by keeping the rules of the law, who pays attention to the ritual regulations of the law as a sign of humility, who keeps the law as his life, and who "walks in the law" Those who do not live up to the "righteousness of the law" will be cursed by the law; those who do not pay attention to God's mercy and the rewards of grace are cursed. So, do you understand?

It is not as good as a gift to be condemned because of one person's sin. It turns out that judgment is condemned by one person, while gift is justified by many sins. If through one man's transgression death reigned through that one man, how much more will those who have received abundant grace and the gift of righteousness reign in life through one man, Jesus Christ? …The law was added from outside, that transgression might abound; but where sin abounded, grace abounded all the more. Just as sin reigned in death, so grace reigns through righteousness to eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord. -Refer to Romans 5 verses 16-17, 20-21. So, do you understand clearly?

As the apostle "Paul" said! But since we died to the law that bound us, we are now free from the law...--See Romans 7:6.

Because of the law I died to the law, that I might live to God. --Refer to Gal. 2:19. So, do you understand clearly? )

【3】The sin of abolishing the new covenant established by Jesus’ blood

Hebrews 9:15 For this reason he is the mediator of the new covenant, so that those who are called may receive the promised eternal inheritance, having atone for the sins of the first covenant by dying. Amen!

(I)Everyone in the world commits crimes and breaches of contract

Because all have sinned...--Romans 3:23 Therefore all have broken God's covenant, both Gentiles and Jews have broken the covenant and sinned. Romans 6:23 The wages of sin is death. Jesus, the Son of God, died for our sins to atone for the sins committed by man in the "previous covenant", which are the "sins of Adam breaking the covenant" and the sins committed by the Jews in violating the "law of Moses". Jesus Christ redeemed us from the curse of the law, freeing us from the law and its curse - see Gal. 3:13.

(II) Those who do not keep the New Covenant but keep the Old Covenant

Hebrews 10:16-18 "This is the covenant I will make with them after those days, saith the Lord: I will write my laws on their hearts, and I will put them within them." ; and then he said, "I will remember their sins and their transgressions no more." Now that these sins have been forgiven, there is no need for any more sacrifices for sins. (But people are always rebellious and stubborn, always trying to find ways to remember the transgressions of their flesh. They don’t believe what the Lord said! The Lord said they will not remember the transgressions of the flesh. The transgressions of the flesh were crucified with Christ. Why do you remember it? Do you believe in your own feelings or in the words of the covenant made with the Lord’s blood? Now that these sins have been forgiven, there is no need to sacrifice for sins anymore. Do you understand?

Keep the sound words which you have heard from me, with faith and love that is in Christ Jesus. You must "keep" the "good way" that was entrusted to you by relying on the Holy Spirit who lives in us. The scale of pure words → You have heard the word of truth, which is the good word, the gospel of your salvation! Rely on the Holy Spirit and keep it firmly; I am not telling you to go back to observing the Old Testament Law of Moses. Do you understand? --Refer to 2 Timothy 1:13-14

(III) Those who return to keep their previous covenant

Galatians 3:2-3 I only want to ask you this: Did you receive the Holy Spirit by the works of the law? Is it because of hearing the gospel? Since you were initiated by the Holy Spirit, do you still rely on the flesh for perfection? Are you so ignorant?
Christ sets us free. So stand firm and don’t let yourself be held hostage by the yoke of slavery any longer. --Refer to Plus chapter 5, verse 1.

( Note: Jesus Christ redeemed us from the old covenant and freed us to establish a new covenant with us. If we go back to abide by the laws of the "first covenant", wouldn't this mean that we have abandoned the new covenant that the Son of God made with us through his own blood? Are you so ignorant? It is also a metaphor for us modern people, is it okay to abide by the laws of the ancient Qing Dynasty, Ming Dynasty, Tang Dynasty or Han Dynasty? If you keep the ancient laws in this way, don’t you know that you are violating the current laws?

Gal 6:7 Don’t be deceived, God will not be mocked. Whatever a man sows, that will he also reap. Don’t be held hostage again by the yoke of sin’s slaves. Do you understand? )

【4】The sin of not believing in Jesus

John 3:16-19 God so loved the world that he gave his only begotten Son, that whoever believes in him shall not perish but have everlasting life. Because God sent His Son into the world, not to condemn the world (or translated as: to judge the world; the same below), but so that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not condemned; but whoever does not believe is already condemned because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. Light has come into the world, and men love darkness instead of light because their deeds are evil. This is their condemnation.

( Note: The name of God's only begotten Son is Jesus. Refer to Matthew 1:21. She will give birth to a son, and you are to name him Jesus, because he will save his people from their sins. It is Jesus Christ who will redeem those under the law, save us from the sins of the old man Adam’s breach of contract, and enable us to obtain the sonship of God! Amen. Those who believe in Him will not be condemned → and receive eternal life! ; Those who do not believe are already condemned. So, do you understand clearly? )

articles.title: Sin｜Creation of Adam and fall in the Garden of Eden
articles.author: admin
articles.content:
Peace to all brothers and sisters! Amen.

We open the Bible to Genesis Chapter 3 17, and verse 19 says to Adam: " Because you obeyed your wife and ate from the tree, which I commanded you not to eat from, cursed is the ground because of you; you must labor all the days of your life to get anything to eat from it. ...and by the sweat of your brow you shall eat your bread until you return to the ground, from which you were born. You are dust, and to dust you will return. "

Today we will study, fellowship, and share " Creation of Adam and fall in the Garden of Eden 》Prayer: Dear Abba, Heavenly Father, our Lord Jesus Christ, thank you that the Holy Spirit is always with us! Amen. Thank you Lord! "The virtuous woman" sends out workers - through the word of truth, which is written and spoken in their hands, the gospel of your salvation. Food is transported from the sky from afar and supplied to us at the right time to make our spiritual life richer! Amen. Ask the Lord Jesus to continue to illuminate our spiritual eyes and open our minds to understand the Bible so that we can hear and see spiritual truths → We understand that the created Adam is "weak" and can easily fall. God tells us not to live in the "created" Adam; so that we can live in Jesus Christ, the one born of God. . Amen!

The above prayers, supplications, intercessions, thanksgivings, and blessings! I ask this in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ! Amen

Creation Adam fell on earth in the Garden of Eden

(1) Adam was created from the dust of the earth

【Adam's Law】-You shall not eat

God promulgated the law on Mount Sinai and gave it to the nation of Israel. The law on earth is also called the Law of Moses. Including the Ten Commandments, laws, regulations, tabernacle system, sacrificial regulations, festivals, moon sculptures, Sabbaths, years... and so on. There are 613 entries in total! --Refer to Exodus 20:1-17, Leviticus, Deuteronomy.

【My own law】-The law of the Gentiles

If the Gentiles who do not have the law do the things of the law according to their nature, even though they do not have the law, You are your own law . This shows that the function of the law is engraved in their hearts, and their sense of right and wrong bears witness. , and their thoughts compete with each other, either right or wrong. ) on the day when God will judge the secrets of men by Jesus Christ, according to my gospel. --Romans 2:14-16. Conscience accuses everyone of the good and evil, good and bad, which are engraved in the conscience of the Gentiles. )

【Law of Christ】-The law of Christ is love?

Bear each other's burdens, and in this way you will fulfill the law of Christ. --Additional chapter 6 verse 2
Because the whole law is wrapped up in this sentence, "Love your neighbor as yourself." --Additional chapter 5 verse 14
God loves us, and we know and believe it. God is love; whoever abides in love abides in God, and God abides in him. --1 John 4:16

(Note: The law of Adam - the law of Moses - the law of conscience, that is, the law of the Gentiles, is a law that belongs to the fleshly regulations on earth; while the law of Christ is a spiritual law in heaven, and the law of Christ is love! To love your neighbor as yourself exceeds all laws on earth. )

[Purpose of establishing laws] ?-Reveal God’s holiness, justice, love, mercy and grace!

【Function of Law】

(1) Convict people of sin

Therefore, no flesh can be justified before God by the works of the law, because the law convicts people of sin. -- Romans 3:20

(2) Make transgressions multiply

The law was added so that transgressions might abound; but where sin abounded, grace abounded all the more. --Romans 5:20

(3) Confining everyone in sin and guarding them

But the Bible has imprisoned all men in sin... Before the doctrine of salvation by faith came, we were kept under the law until the revelation of the faith in the future. --Additional chapter 3 verses 22-23

(4) stop everyone's mouth

We know that everything in the law is addressed to those who are under the law, so that every mouth may be stopped, and the whole world may be brought under the judgment of God. --Romans 3:19

(5) Keep everyone in disobedience

You once disobeyed God, but now you have received mercy because of their disobedience. …For God has put all men under disobedience in order that he may have mercy on them all. --Romans 11:30,32

(6) The law is our teacher

In this way, the law is our tutor, leading us to Christ so that we can be justified by faith. But now that the principle of salvation by faith has come, we are no longer under the Master’s hand. --Additional chapter 3 verses 24-25

(7) that the promised blessings may be given to those who believe

But the Bible imprisons all men in sin, so that the promised blessings through faith in Jesus Christ may be given to those who believe. --Galat chapter 3 verse 22

In Him you were sealed with the Holy Spirit of promise, when you also believed in Christ when you heard the word of truth, the gospel of your salvation. This Holy Spirit is the pledge (original text: inheritance) of our inheritance until God’s people (original text: inheritance) are redeemed to the praise of His glory. --Refer to Ephesians 1:13-14 and John 3:16.
